title: Real Estate Cold Caller / Acquisitions Specialist – Tax Delinquent & Messy Title Properties
description:
We are a U.S. real estate investment company based in Texas that buys tax-delinquent and messy-title properties for profit.

We’re hiring two full-time Cold Callers / Acquisitions Specialists to join our outbound team.



You’ll be the first point of contact with property owners and heirs. Your job is to start real conversations, build quick rapport, gather ownership details, and handle objections confidently.



We provide everything you need:

VPN

CRM

Dialer

Scripts, objection charts, and full training



All calls are recorded for coaching and quality improvement.



This is a stable, long-term position with consistent hours and two fixed rest days each week.



SCHEDULE: 



Monday-Friday 9am-5pm cst



WHAT YOU NEED:



Fluent English with no heavy accent



Strong communication and rapport-building skills



Reliable high-speed internet (screenshot required)



Quality headset or USB microphone (we’ll verify during your voice test)



Quiet workspace



Cold calling, sales, or real estate experience preferred - Big bonus if you are already doing these type of calls, please let me know.



$800 base pay per month + 5% of each deal we close (Example deal closes at 50k, you will make $2,500 on top of base pay)



HOW TO APPLY:



Send a voice recording that includes:



Your name



A quick background on your experience and why you’d be a great fit



Read this line exactly as written so we can hear your tone and delivery:

Sound: Calm, curious, and natural — like you’re asking for help, not selling.



“Hi Juno, my name’s [Your Name]. I was calling to see if you could help me with something real quick?

I don’t know if you’d know anything, but I was trying to see if you could help me with the property at 417 Sherwood ct. — or if you know who I should talk to that takes care of that property, because it looks like there’s some title issues with it.”

title: Admin Helpdesk & Data Processing Specialist
description:
Admin & Data Processing Specialist | Full-Time | Remote

We are a fast-growing digital media brand looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Admin & Data Processing Specialist to join our team full-time. You will manage client website admin data, oversee payment workflows, and handle our customer ticketing system daily.

Responsibilities



Monitor and manage the client website admin panel

Track incoming payments, clear transactions, and resolve pending or failed payments

Coordinate directly with payment processor teams for payment clearance

Monitor, respond to, and close all customer tickets within 1 hour of creation (strict SLA)

Create and categorise tickets accurately

Send a structured hourly update to the internal team via
 covering: open tickets, resolved tickets, payments processed, payments pending, and any flags or issues



Schedule & Availability

This is a flexible role — no fixed 8-hour shift required. You can log in and out at any point throughout the day. However, you must be available and responsive during the coverage window of 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily. All tickets must be closed within 1 hour regardless of when they arrive, and hourly
 reports must be sent consistently without gaps.

Requirements



Must own and use an Apple Mac computer — certain client applications are macOS-exclusive and non-negotiable

Reliable high-speed internet connection

Proficient with

Prior experience in admin, data entry, payment operations, or customer support preferred

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent written communication skills

Ability to multitask and handle high volumes of tickets and payment queries

Self-motivated and able to work independently



If you are organised, tech-savvy, and thrive in a fast-paced role where responsiveness is everything, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Airbnb guest experience & reservations specialist
description:
Guest Experience & Reservations VA



Haven Stays QT is a premium, quality-driven short-term rental management company based in Queenstown, New Zealand.



We manage a growing portfolio of high-performing Airbnb & VRBO properties and pride ourselves on exceptional guest experience, fast communication and five-star standards.



We are looking for a highly reliable, hospitality-focused Virtual Assistant to manage guest communications and reservations during our evening/weekend coverage. We are keen to find someone who is willing to grow with us as we scale. 



Required Availability (Non-Negotiable)

Wednesday – Sunday

5:00pm – 12:00pm New Zealand time

30hours per week



You must be:

-Fully available during these hours

-Not working another live customer support role at the same time

-At your desk and responsive for the entire shift

-This role requires real-time responsiveness. It is not suitable for someone managing multiple active jobs simultaneously.



???? The Role

-You will be the primary guest contact during your shift. Guests must feel cared for and responded to quickly.



Your responsibilities will include:

-Responding to Airbnb & VRBO messages within 5 minutes (once fully trained up).

-Vetting guests

-Managing reservation adjustment to guest specific requests

-Escalating urgent maintenance issues

-Updating internal notes in Hostaway,

-Completing End-of-Day (EOD) reporting

-Following SOPs in Notion

-Maintaining a warm, personal, non-robotic tone in guest messaging

-Monitoring ring cameras

-Communicating with internal cleaners and reviewing quality check videos

-Filing reimbursement requests



???? Required Experience

You MUST have proven experience with:

1.Airbnb (host-side messaging + resolution centre)

2.VRBO 

3.Hostaway (PMS)

4.Notion (for SOP tracking & documentation)



Please do not apply if you have not worked directly in short-term rental guest messaging.



The Kind of Person We’re Looking For

-Hospitality-first mindset

-Obsessed with customer service

-Calm under pressure

-Highly accountable

-Detail-oriented

-Proactive problem solver willing to suggest & implement new systems

-Guests are the heart of our business. We need someone who cares deeply about protecting our five-star reputation.



???? Performance Expectations

-5 min response time during shift 

-Zero missed guest messages

-Daily EOD completion

-100% shift coverage

-On laptop throughout working hours 

-Failure to meet response-time standards will not be tolerated.





???? Compensation

-$5.5 USD per hour

-Wage review after 6 months

-Long-term growth opportunity as the company scales



???? To Apply

Please include:

-Your experience with Airbnb/Hostaway & notion 

-A little bit about yourself

-Confirmation that you are not working overlapping live support roles

-Example of a guest message you would send in this scenario:

'A guest messages at 9:30pm saying the heat pump isn’t working and it’s cold.'

title: Inbound Sales Closer – High-Ticket Coaching (C1+ English)
description:
SOLV Languages is hiring an inbound sales closer for high-ticket French communication coaching for expats living in France.



This is NOT cold calling.

Leads book calls themselves after watching our webinar.

Your role is to run discovery calls, close enrollments, follow a strict process, and do fast follow-up.



What you will do:

• Run discovery + closing calls (mostly in English)

• Follow a clear sales framework (discovery first, then close)

• Handle objections calmly (no pressure, no discounts)

• Send checkout links and follow up within 15 minutes after calls

• Log clean notes in our CRM (100% required)



Who we are looking for:

• C2 English (native or near-native)

• Some knowledge of French (used for examples and credibility; we train you)

• Calm, consultative sales style

• Very strong process discipline (scripts, notes, follow-up)

• Reliable internet, quiet environment, headset



Availability (France / CET time):

• Highest demand: Mon–Fri, 09:00–14:00 CET

• Priority days: Monday and Friday

• Any other time you're ready to take leads



Compensation:

• Commission-based

• 10% on Paid-In-Full deals

• 8% on payment plans

• Commission paid only after the full amount is collected

• Payment plans last 2–3 months



Trial:

• 2-week paid trial

• $200 training retainer

• Plus commission on any closed deals during trial



Important:

• CRM hygiene and follow-up compliance are non-negotiable



How to apply:

1) Go to 
 and watch our funnel/webinar

2) Contact me here and explain why you would be a great fit.



Applications without a Loom will be ignored.

title: Accounting/CFO
description:
Job Description:



We are seeking a highly skilled CPA Accountant / CFO to oversee the financial strategy, accounting operations, and compliance for a multi-location restaurant group. This leadership role demands a hands-on professional who can manage the full financial picture—daily, weekly, and monthly—while also supporting long-term planning, audits, and investor reporting.



Responsibilities:

 • Oversee all accounting functions, including general ledger, AP/AR, payroll review, bank reconciliations, and month-end close

 • Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial statements and balance sheets across all locations

 • Monitor daily cash flow and vendor payments to ensure financial discipline

 • Lead the budgeting and forecasting process for each unit and consolidate group-level projections

 • Prepare weekly and monthly P&Ls and compare against budgeted performance

 • Identify and reduce unnecessary expenses; track food, labor, and operational cost drivers

 • Ensure timely and accurate tax filings (payroll, sales, income) and maintain compliance with local, state, and federal agencies

 • Manage relationships with external tax advisors, banks, and auditors

 • Supervise or collaborate with in-house accounting staff and provide clear task delegation

 • Support financial modeling for expansion, investment, or potential asset sales

 • Provide strategic recommendations to ownership based on data-driven financial insights

 • Maintain internal controls and accounting policies that align with GAAP standards



Daily Expectations:

 • Check daily sales reports and verify deposits across all locations

 • Monitor bill payments, cash outflows, and reconcile bank accounts

 • Review payroll summaries and flag any discrepancies

 • Communicate with store managers or office staff to resolve any financial issues

 • Track outstanding receivables, vendor balances, and lease obligations

 • Update owner with a quick daily summary on cash position, red flags, and wins



Qualifications:

 • Active CPA license required

 • 7+ years of accounting and financial leadership experience, preferably in multi-unit restaurant or hospitality businesses

 • Strong grasp of GAAP, tax regulations, and restaurant-specific accounting (e.g., prime cost control, inventory tracking, COGS)

 • Proficiency in QuickBooks, Excel, and restaurant software systems

 • Exceptional organization, communication, and leadership skills

 • Strategic thinker with the ability to execute quickly and accurately

title: Copywriting Specialist for Newsletters, Blogs & Social Media
description:
We are a fast-growing digital media brand looking for a talented and creative Copywriting Specialist to join our team. This is not a role for someone who copy-pastes from AI tools — we are looking for someone with a genuine human touch who can craft compelling, unique content that resonates with real audiences.

Responsibilities



Write original, engaging blog posts across multiple websites based on context and briefs provided by us — content must be unique, human-written, and not AI-generated

Write and schedule social media content daily including Instagram captions, tweets, and LinkedIn posts — content will be scheduled directly within our social media applications

Write and send newsletters three times per week using our platform — full training via screen recording tutorials will be provided

Incorporate product details and CTA links provided by us into newsletters and social content

Ensure all content aligns with brand voice, tone, and messaging across all platforms



What We're Looking For

We want someone who actually loves writing. Someone who can take a brief or context, think creatively, and produce content that feels fresh and authentic — not recycled or generic. Heavy reliance on AI tools is a dealbreaker for this role.

Requirements



Proven copywriting experience — blogs, newsletters, and social media preferred

Strong command of English with excellent grammar, tone, and storytelling ability

Ability to write in a consistent brand voice across different platforms and formats

Comfortable scheduling content directly on Instagram,
/X, and LinkedIn

Reliable, organised, and able to meet deadlines consistently

A portfolio or writing samples are required with your application

AI tools may be used for research or light assistance only — final content must reflect genuine human creativity and writing skill



Schedule & Hours

This is a part-time role requiring approximately 3 to 4 hours per day, 5 days a week — totalling around 15 hours per week or less. You have flexibility in when you work as long as deadlines are met and content is delivered on time.

What's Included in the Role



Blog writing and uploading across multiple websites

Daily social media copywriting for Instagram,
/X, and LinkedIn

Three newsletters per week — written, built, and sent by you

Full onboarding and platform tutorials provided



If you are a passionate writer who takes pride in original, high-quality content and wants to be a core part of a growing digital brand, we would love to hear from you!

To apply, please send a short introduction, your writing portfolio or samples, and your availability.

title: Digital Marketing VA - Focusing on Email marketing and content creation
description:
About Us



We are a growing fashion e-commerce brand selling on
, Instagram, TikTok, and marketplaces. We are looking for a performance-focused marketer who can directly contribute to revenue through
 marketing, UGC sourcing, and compelling creatives.



Listed below are the requirements needed



Role Overview

You will execute across:



•
 marketing focused on retention and revenue (IMPORTANT) 

• Influencer / X-deal outreach and UGC sourcing

• AI-driven creative production for ads and organic

• Conversion-focused copywriting

• Monthly content calendar planning and execution



Monthly Deliverables (Non-Negotiable)



1.
 Marketing



• 8
 campaigns per month (minimum 2 per week)

• 1 new automation or optimization per month (abandoned cart, post-purchase, winback, etc.)

• Maintain and improve
 revenue contribution

• Submit monthly
 performance report including open rate, CTR, revenue, repeat purchase impact



2. X-Deals / Influencer Outreach



• 80 qualified outreach per month (20 per week)

• Maintain structured outreach tracker (status, responses, secured deals)

• Secure minimum 20 usable UGC assets per month for ads 

• Ensure all edited UGC videos are structured and ad-ready



3. AI Creative Production



• 20 short-form ad creatives per month (5 per week) - for ads

• Plan and create 10 content pieces per month - for posting

• Improve first 3 seconds and hooks for CTR performance and page engagement

• Deliver ad-ready versions with strong CTA

• Maintain organized creative library



4. Copywriting



• Write all
 campaign copy

• Write ad copy and captions for creatives

• Optimize at least 5 product descriptions per month (website + marketplaces)

• Provide 3 hook variations per creative for A/B testing

Copy must be conversion-driven and SEO-aware.



5. Content Calendar



• Create monthly content calendar by the 25th (1 month in advance)

• Align calendar with promotions, launches, and sales cycles

• Submit weekly content execution plan every Monday



Meetings & Reporting



• 1 weekly strategy and performance meeting every Friday (review performance and next week’s plan)

• Weekly performance report including:

–
 revenue

– UGC secured

– Creatives produced

– Outreach progress



Requirements



• 2+ years digital marketing experience

• Experience with
 platforms (Klaviyo, Omnisend, Shopify
, etc.)

• Experience editing short-form videos (CapCut, Canva, etc.)

• Comfortable using AI tools for creative and copy

• Understand performance metrics (CTR, conversion rate, ROAS)

• Fluent written and spoken English



Bonus:

• E-commerce experience

• Fashion or lifestyle brand experience

• Experience turning UGC into paid ad creatives



Offer

• Full-time remote

• P30,000 – P35,000 monthly (based on experience)



Application Instructions



Send:

1. Portfolio 
s + creatives)

2. 1 short-form creative you edited

3. 1
 campaign you wrote

4. How would you increase returning customers for an e-commerce brand?

5. Please confirm and agree that you've read the deliverables and offered salary



Applications without portfolio will not be reviewed.

title: Personal Assistant & Video Editor
description:
I’m a creative director based in the US, and we are a niche company focused on restaurant content creation and branded visuals for local businesses. I’m looking for long?term help. ’m currently hiring for two related positions:



- Personal Assistant / Video Admin & Outreach



- Food Reels Editor (short?form vertical videos)



Please read both roles below and tell me which position you’re applying for.



1) Personal Assistant / Video Admin & Outreach

You’ll help with personal admin, creative business tasks, and keeping our restaurant content and video projects organized. This is mostly admin, research, light marketing, and organization work.



Typical tasks:



- Research and build lists of potential business leads (restaurants and other local brands) with contact info.

- Send and track outreach
s/DMs using templates I provide.

- Organize leads in a simple CRM or Google Sheet (status, last contact date, notes).

- Help with scheduling: confirmations, reminders, and simple “project / shoot sheet” details.

- Organize client folders, project files, and portfolio examples in shared drives.

- Help maintain a simple social media posting schedule using our content and voice.

- Light admin support for ongoing video projects (updating trackers, statuses, notes, due dates).



You’re a good fit if:



- You have strong written English and can follow detailed instructions.

- You enjoy organized, systems?based work (research, updating sheets, tracking details).

- You’re proactive, ask questions when unsure, and care about accuracy and deadlines.



When you reply for this role, use the subject line:

“Personal Assistant / Video Admin – [Your Name]”

__________________________________________________________________________



2) Food Reels Editor (Short?Form Vertical Video)

You’ll edit short?form food and brand content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.



Typical tasks:



- Edit high quality vertical videos (9:16) for IG Reels/TikTok/Shorts.

- Add music, text, hooks, and pacing suitable for social media.

- Follow a basic brand style and adjust based on feedback.



You’re a good fit if:



- You have strong experience editing short?form content (please send examples).

- You understand hooks, pacing, and storytelling for Reels/TikTok.

- You’re comfortable working with shared drives and following naming conventions.



When you reply for this role, use the subject line:

“Food Reels Editor – [Your Name]”



How to Apply

Please send an
 to: [YOUR
 HERE]



Include:



Which position you are applying for (or if you’re open to both).

A short introduction (who you are, where in the Philippines you’re based, your availability).



- For Personal Assistant / Video Admin & Outreach: any experience with research, outreach, or admin work.



- For Food Reels Editor: links to your portfolio/Instagram/TikTok/YouTube with your best short?form edits.



After I review your portfolio and information, I will reply with a booking calendar link so we can set a time for a call.

title: Bookkeeping + Admin + Social Media (QuickBooks Online) — Part-Time
description:
Title:

Bookkeeping + Admin + Social Media (QuickBooks Online) — Part-Time



Job Type:

Part-time (4 hours/day) — 20 hours/week (potential to grow)



Pay:

$3–$5/hour (depending on experience)

Paid trial: 1 week



Schedule:

Preferred overlap with U.S. Eastern Time: 10am–2pm ET (flexible if you respond fast)



About Us:

We are a U.S. accounting firm (est. 2017) located in Boston, Massachusetts. We help individuals, small business owners, and real estate investors with tax prep, bookkeeping, and payroll.



What You Will Do (No phone calls to start):



BOOKKEEPING (Primary)

- Categorize bank/credit card transactions in QuickBooks Online (QBO) and Excel

- Monthly bank + credit card reconciliation

- Identify transfers vs. expenses (no guessing; flag “REVIEW”)

- Basic cleanup and simple reports support (P&L notes)



CLIENT FOLLOW-UP + ADMIN (Required)

- Follow up with clients for missing documents (W-2, 1099, bank statements, etc.)

- Send reminders for monthly bank statements for bookkeeping clients

- Follow up to collect sales tax reports and confirm filing deadlines (monthly/quarterly)

- Help clients upload documents through secure portal / Client Hub

- Update client status tracker (Google Sheet/Excel)

- Organize documents and notes (Google Drive)



SOCIAL MEDIA (Light / Secondary)

- Social media is light and template-based (we provide branding, logo, colors, and examples)

- Create and schedule posts for
, Instagram, TikTok, and Google Business Profile

- Repurpose content across platforms (same post, adjusted format)

- Turn my notes into short captions/posts when needed



Weekly Targets (Example)

- Bookkeeping: keep monthly reconciliations current

- Admin: follow up daily and keep tracker updated

- Social: 2–3 posts/week using our templates (repurpose across platforms)



Requirements:

- QuickBooks Online experience (reconciliation + categorization)

- Strong written English (Chinese Mandarin/Cantonese is a plus)

- Canva experience (basic graphics, resizing, templates)

- Organized, detail-oriented, and fast communicator

- Comfortable with Microsoft Suite and MS Teams

- Stable internet + computer



Nice to Have:

- CapCut / short video editing (Reels/TikTok style)

- Experience with accounting/tax firms or small business clients

- Basic SEO knowledge (local keywords)



How to Apply (OnlineJobs.ph):

1) Send your resume

2) Include your weekly availability (in U.S. Eastern Time)

3) Answer these questions:

   Q1: How many QBO clients have you handled end-to-end (categorization + reconciliation)?

   Q2: Which industries have you worked with (construction, restaurants, etc.)?

   Q3: Share 2–3 social posts you’ve created (links or screenshots).

   Q4: What tools do you use (Canva, CapCut, Buffer/Later, Google Drive, etc.)?

   Q5: What is your expected hourly rate?

   Q6: Do you have experience doing client follow-ups 
/text) and tracking status in a spreadsheet? Briefly explain.



Shortlisted candidates will take a short skills test and a paid 1-week trial.

title: Remote Appointment Setter – Cold Calling Local Businesses
description:

Sun Valley Window Washers is a fast-growing local service company based in Arizona. We work with restaurants, gyms, retail stores, and small professional offices to keep their interior/exterior windows looking clean and professional.

We are looking for a reliable, confident appointment setter to call local businesses and schedule qualified walk-through appointments for our owner.

title: Senior Web Developer (Part-Time)
description:
About YSS Media

YSS Media is an Australian company operating in the hair and beauty industry across three divisions: a B2B SaaS loyalty platform (Hair Clubs by YSS), a creative agency for beauty brands (YSS Agency), and a podcast/media platform (Can We Go Live). We work with major brands and premium salons, and our philosophy is simple: don't be boring. Everything we produce from code to creative needs to meet a premium standard.

We're a small, tight team that moves fast. You'll be working directly with the founder (who has a technical background in software engineering) and alongside our Ops & Automation Engineer and Art Director.



The Role

We're looking for a senior web developer with strong design sensibility to own our web properties - primarily client websites on WordPress and Shopify, and Framer.



This is not a pure execution role. We need someone who can look at a design and implement it perfectly, but also someone who can take a rough brief and build something that looks and feels premium without needing their hand held. You should be as comfortable in PHP and server config as you are in CSS and animations.



You'll start part time (30 hours/week). For the right person, this role grows into a technical full time lead position. This is someone who doesn't just build, but thinks architecturally, contributes to infrastructure decisions, and becomes a true engineering partner.



What You'll Be Doing

Core Responsibilities (Day One)

Frontend & Design Implementation



Implementing designs from our Art Director, translating Figma/design files into responsive websites

Frontend animations and interactions, CSS animations, GSAP, scroll effects, loaders. The details that make a site feel premium

Maintaining visual consistency and premium quality across all web properties



WordPress Development

Theme development, ACF flexible content, custom blocks, page templates

We need modular, reusable architecture

PHP backend logic custom functions, hooks, filters, REST API endpoints

Security hardening SSL management, malware scanning, vulnerability patching, keeping WordPress core and plugins secure



Shopify Development

Liquid templates, theme customisation, section architecture

Frontend polish and theme modifications



Framer

Marketing pages, landing pages, interactive components



Server & Hosting

Managing hosting environments, staging sites, DNS configuration

Server troubleshooting and performance issues

Deployments and environment management



Analytics & Tracking

GA4, Google Tag Manager, conversion pixels setup and maintenance

Ensuring tracking is accurate and properly configured across client sites





Performance Optimisation

Page speed, caching strategies, CDN configuration

Core Web Vitals and overall site performance



API Integrations

Third party service integrations and webhooks

Building and maintaining connections between platforms



Growth Responsibilities (As You Develop) 

Contributing to technical architecture decisions across YSS, including our SaaS platform (Hair Clubs)

Solutions architecture,  evaluating approaches, identifying trade offs, making recommendations

Helping shape engineering processes and standards across the team

Mentoring and collaborating with our automation engineer on cross functional projects

Occasionally handling client communication on technical matters when needed





What We're Looking For

Must Haves



5+ years web development experience across WordPress and Shopify

Strong design sensibility, you understand typography, spacing, visual hierarchy, and colour. You don't just build what you're told; you notice when something looks off and fix it

WordPress expertise, custom theme development, ACF (Advanced Custom Fields), flexible content, custom blocks, PHP templating. You build modular, reusable components not one off sections that can't be repurposed

PHP proficiency comfortable writing custom backend logic, not just installing plugins

Shopify Liquid comfortable with theme architecture, sections, templates

Modern CSS/SCSS responsive design, animations, transitions, grid, flexbox

JavaScript vanilla JS, DOM manipulation, some framework experience is a plus

Server management comfortable with hosting environments, SSH, staging setups, DNS, basic server troubleshooting

Security awareness SSL, WordPress hardening, malware scanning, keeping things locked down

Git proficiency branching, merging, pull requests, code review. Not just committing to main

AI coding tools this is critical. We expect you to use Claude Code, Cursor, or similar AI tools daily. Not as a crutch, but as a force multiplier. If you're not already using AI in your development workflow, this isn't the right fit

Documentation habits you write code comments, maintain READMEs, and document architecture decisions. We never want to be in a position where only you understand how something is built

Independence you can take a brief, ask smart questions, and deliver without constant oversight

Attention to detail pixel level precision on implementation. If the design says 24px padding, it's 24px padding



Nice-to-Haves



Framer experience

GSAP / animation libraries

GA4 and Google Tag Manager setup experience

Klaviyo or similar
 platform experience

Performance optimisation (Core Web Vitals, caching, CDN)

API integration experience (REST APIs, webhooks)

CI/CD and deployment pipeline experience

Experience with headless CMS setups

Understanding of SEO best practices

Agile thinking you understand iterative development, not just waterfall task execution

Coaching tea
mbers



How You'll Work



Embedded in the team — you'll be on Slack, standups and all tea
etings

Timezone overlap with Sydney - you work from 11am Sydney time year round

Direct communication - you'll work directly with the founder and Art Director, not through a project manager or ticketing black box

Structured engineering practices — we're building proper Git workflows, PR processes, and code review practices together. You'll have input into how we set these up





Our Standards

We're moving away from an external agency because their output consistently didn't meet our standards. To be direct about what that means:



A page duplication with copy and image swaps should take 2–3 hours, not 20

A loading animation should actually loop until the page is ready, not play once and show a black screen

If you're building ACF sections, they should be modular enough to reuse across pages without rebuilding from scratch every time

Code should be clean, commented, documented, and structured — not 150 lines of inline CSS with no explanation

If something will take longer than expected, we want to know upfront with a clear explanation — not a post-hoc justification

Every project should have a README. Every architectural decision should be documented. We will never again be in a position where only one person or team understands how something works



We're not unreasonable. We understand complexity. But we don't accept padded hours or sloppy architecture.



Compensation & Growth



Starting: Part-time (30 hours/week)

Growth path: Full-time as revenue scales, with compensation growth to match

Long-term: For the right person, this evolves into a technical lead role with broader architectural responsibility and compensation that reflects it

Payment: Monthly, USD





How to Apply

Don't send a generic cover letter. Instead, send us:

Your portfolio 

Loom video introduction





Location

Philippines based candidates only.

?

title: Product lister – Shopify Dropshipping
description:
Dear applicant,



For our dropshipping business we are looking forward to hitting 8 figures this year. Therefore we are looking for a highly developed Shopify Lister with experience in Dropshipping in Shopify to be part of a new team in our organization, this is for a long term application!



You must understand the whole process and must be highly developed in communication. Therefore, please apply by typing the word strawberry before you introduce yourself. Read on to find out what tasks we expect you to perform, as well as the experience we feel is necessary for this job.



Please answer the following questions, if you are interested.



- Do you have experience working with Shopify?

- Do you have experience with preparing products so that they are ready to be advertised?

- Do you have experience in Google Sheets?

- Have you ever used Slack for communication?

- Are you available for 4-10 hours a day, 7 days a week?



As a Shopify Lister you have:



- Experience in Shopify (Must!)

- Good communication skills (Must!)

- Experience with
 Ad Library (pre)

- Experience with product research (pre)

- Experience with workflows (must)

- Experience with different communication platforms (Slack)



If you do not meet the requirements, do not apply. (thank you)



Your duties will be:



- Preparing products in the process to launch on our social media platforms. (5 per day, per store)

- Communicating with tea
mbers who participate in the same process

- Being aware of the process and making sure there are no delays.

- Updating the Google sheet with all products and following the instructions given.





WORKFLOW IS PROVIDED THROUGH EVERY STEP OF THE PROCESS INCLUDING VIDEO TRAINING! 



WE OFFER CAREER OPPORTUNITIES IN THE TEAM TO HARD WORKING TEA
MBERS



If you think you are the right person for this job and you are able to contribute to our company, please respond to this post.



Best regards,

Team SW

title: Admin Agent
description:
We’re looking for an Administrative Agent to help support our sales and recruiting teams. This is an entry-level position that is eligible for promotion after 12 months of tenure.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********



You will fail the application process if you don't read the entire job description.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********





About Us



Started in 2017, and we're growing like crazy.

We expect to hire at least 4 salespeople, 3 admins, and 3 marketers in 2026.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2025 and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2026

A small team of 1 American and 10 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don’t do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive commission package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week

Schedule - 9 AM to 5 PM EST



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid two weeks off for the Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job.

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience.

If you’re looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you.

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Orders - Processing Product Order (Gift Certificate)

New Orders - Initial Order Confirmation (Level 3)

Instructor Onboarding, Offboarding and Reonboarding

Reactivate Unavailable Instructor

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT. This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Duplicate Record Check

Updating the "Daily Tracking" Process

CTM Prospect Staging





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years of minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and the ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management, and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and a good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experience lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINK ELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here.





Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed.

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system.

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.





How to apply: Please click on the link: 
/work-opportunities/administration-agent

title: Invoicing & Accounting Support for Miami, Florida tech company
description:
wynwood tech is a fast-growing global IT staffing and consulting company specializing in digital transformation technologies, such as Adobe Experience Cloud and Salesforce. We are looking for a detail-oriented Invoicing & Accounting Specialist based in the Philippines to join our international team (we already have an established team in the Philippines).



Responsibilities:

- Create, manage, and send client invoices accurately and on time

- Maintain and update financial records in QuickBooks

- Track payments, follow up on outstanding invoices, and reconcile accounts

- Support basic bookkeeping tasks and month-end close activities

- Coordinate with our teams in the US, Germany, and the Philippines to ensure accurate billing and documentation



Requirements:

- Proven experience with QuickBooks (required). QuickBooks Level 2 Certification is strongly preferred. 

- Proven experience in invoicing, accounting, and bookkeeping roles.

- Strong attention to detail and a high level of accuracy

- Good English communication skills (written and verbal)

- Reliable internet connection and home office setup

- Availability to work partially during US business hours, while primarily covering CET business hours



Why Join Us?

- Remote-first international team

- Stable, process-driven back-office role

- Fast-growing consulting environment with long-term opportunities

- Potential for increased responsibility as the company scales

title: Junior Developer / AI-Assisted Tech Builder
description:
**Company:** US Vacation Rental Tech Company

**Type:** Part-time, Remote (20-40 hrs/week depending on performance and availability -

**Rate:** $4-5/hr USD (with raises based on performance)



---



## About Us



We're a small but growing US-based property management company running 17+ vacation rental units. We use technology heavily to automate our operations and are looking for a smart, motivated developer to help us build and expand our automation systems.



## The Role



We need a sharp, resourceful junior developer who is comfortable using AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor, Claude Code) to build real, working solutions. **You don't need to be a senior engineer.** You need to be intelligent, honest, and relentless about figuring things out.



You'll be integrating multiple business platforms via their APIs into a centralized data system, building automation workflows, and growing into more advanced AI projects over time.



**This is NOT a role for someone who wants to bill hours and drag projects out.** We want someone who takes ownership, moves fast, delivers results, and charges fairly.



## What You'll Do



- Connect APIs (Gmail, Hostaway, OpenPhone, (Quo) 
) into a centralized data system (MCP architecture)

- Use Claude, Claude Code, and other AI tools as your daily co-pilot to write, debug, and ship code

- Build simple but functional automation pipelines that process data across platforms

- Communicate progress clearly, ask good questions when stuck, and document your work

- Grow into more advanced projects: voice AI (ElevenLabs), video AI (HeyGen), guest-facing interfaces



## What We're Looking For



**Must-Have:**

- High problem-solving ability — you figure things out, you don't give up easily

- Basic comfort with Python or JavaScript (you don't need to be an expert)

- Already using AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor, etc.) to code and learn faster

- Honest, reliable, responsive communication (we use async communication heavily)

- You'd rather ship something that works than overthink it

- Strong English communication skills (written)

- Available 20-40 hours per week with consistent schedule



**Nice-to-Have:**

- Familiarity with REST APIs and webhooks

- Experience with 
, n8n, or Zapier

- Familiarity with Git/GitHub



**What Does NOT Matter:**

- Years of experience

- Computer Science degree

- Having used these specific APIs before

- Your age (we care about ability, not credentials)



## What We Offer



- a posibility of  long-term part-time work with a fair employer

- Access to Claude Pro and AI development tools (we pay for your tools)

- Real projects that ship — not busywork

- Opportunity to grow your skills on interesting AI/automation projects

- Direct communication with the founder (no corporate bureaucracy)



## Minimum Requirements to Apply



**You MUST meet ALL of the following to be considered. Applications missing any of these will be ignored.**



### 1. Proof of a Working Project



You must share a link to at least ONE project you have built that involves code. This can be:

- A GitHub, GitLab, or Replit link

- A CodePen or CodeSandbox link

- A deployed app or website you built

- A Google Drive link to a project folder with source code



The project does NOT need to be complex. It could be a simple automation script, a web scraper, a basic web app, a bot, a data tool — anything. But it must be real code that you wrote (with or without AI assistance), and you must be able to explain it.



**No link = no consideration. No exceptions.** 



### 2. Demonstrate AI Tool Usage



Record a short Loom video (2-3 minutes max) showing:



- You opening Claude.ai (free version is fine) or ChatGPT

- You giving it a coding prompt related to an API integration (any API)

- You explaining what the AI gave you, what's correct, and what you would fix or improve



This shows me you actually use AI tools and understand what the code does — not just copy-paste blindly.



**No Loom video = no consideration.**



### 3. Written Application Answers



Answer ALL of these questions in your application:



**A)** What programming language(s) are you most comfortable with? Rate yourself 1-10 for each and be honest — I respect honesty more than inflated numbers.



**B)** Have you ever connected to a REST API? If yes, which one(s) and what did you do with the data? If no, that's okay — describe how you would approach it for the first time.



**C)** What is your hourly rate expectation in USD? How many hours per week are you available, and what hours/time zone do you work in?



**D)** Why do you want this role specifically? (2-3 sentences — I can spot copy-paste answers.)



---



Your application must include,



Link to at least one code project you built

Loom video showing you using an AI coding tool (2-3 min)

Written answers to questions A, B, C, and D above



**Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.** I know this is a lot to ask — that's intentional. If you take the time to do this, you're already ahead of 90% of applicants.

title: Maintenance coordinator
description:
We are looking for someone to fill the position of a remote maintenance coordinator for STR / Airbnb / rental properties in various US locations, the main role is communicating with house various vendors, handymen, service techs, scheduling and tracking progress.  You will be helping others with their role when they are not working and other will be helping you with your tasks while you are not working but you the maintenance coordinator is the one responsible to follow up.  Besides maintenance, you will also be responsible for speaking and messaging with guests, other vendors, owners and anyone else that has a question or concern while you are on shift.  You will need a strong internet,  a back up plan if you ever have a power outage, like another place you can go to work, a cell phone for back up as well.  We need your English language and accent to be very good. Any STR AirBnB experience is a plus. The job will be 40 hours per week.  California time zone, either 6am PST Start time, or we might need you in the 10am start time.  Please contact your internet service provider and find out what your home internet speed is. I believe wired internet is better than Wifi, but Wifi could be acceptable.  A working microphone with a back up mic, if you don't have a good mic and back up you should be willing to get one soon,  A good laptop or desktop computer with specs that show it is fast,  Please find out what kind of computer processor your computer is and mainly if it is newer and fast for doing internet activities. You will also use other softwares, any experience is a plus, HostAway, Turno, PriceLabs, others



Please reply to this message with the following information:

1. Your internet speed 

2. Your computer type / processor speed

3. Your Microphone types

4. Your English language level and please send an audio voice sample 

5. Your experience with cleaning management in the US if possible

6. Your experience with Airbnb, 
, VRBO,  or any short term and long term renting.

title: Senior Social Media Manager (Remote | Full-Time) Australian-Based Brands | Long-Term Position
description:
We are looking for a highly organised, creative and reliable Social Media Manager to manage multiple growing Australian businesses across food, lifestyle and service industries.



This is a serious long-term role for someone who understands branding, content planning, design and execution without needing micromanagement.



Australia is an excellent market to work with because time zones align far better than the US, allowing clear communication, consistent workflow and long-term stability.



No time wasters.

We want someone dependable who takes ownership and delivers results.





---



Responsibilities



• Manage social media across multiple brands

• Plan structured weekly and monthly content calendars

• Design high-quality, modern posts suited to the Australian market

• Perform strong photo editing and video editing for Instagram and short-form content

• Schedule and publish consistently

• Keep organised folders, captions and systems

• Bring creative direction and proactive ideas





---



Requirements



• Excellent organisation and reliability

• Strong Canva design skills with a clean, modern style

• Advanced photo and video editing ability (not basic)

• Minimal AI usage — real creativity is required

• Strong understanding of Instagram,
 and short-form content

• Reliable internet and consistent availability

• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines





---



Important



This role is not for beginners.

We are looking for someone experienced who can take full ownership of social media management.



All applicants will complete a short test task.

Successful candidates will be invited to a final interview.





---



How to Apply



Send:



1. Portfolio or sample work/skills





2. Internet speed test result





3. Your availability and working hours





4. A short message explaining why you are the right fit

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Day Shift
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Short Form Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Financial Accountant
description:
The Property Accountant is responsible for reconciling property cash accounts, monitoring accounts payable and receivable activity at the property level, reconciling supporting schedules to account balances on the financial statements and resolving tie out variances, entering general ledger journal entries, compiling the financial statements for owners, and working closely with the property onsite tea
mbers to answer any Accounting-related questions.



Responsibilities?

- Complete bank reconciliations and deposit receipts as necessary

- Work closely with Property Managers and Regional Managers

- Monitor revenue/expense activity and make corrections as necessary

- Post journal entries

- Tie out account balances to supporting schedules and resolve variances

- Prepare monthly financial statements for multiple properties

- Address uncashed checks over 90 days for unclaimed property purposes

- Prepare/submit draw requests

- Enter invoices on a limited basis

- Prepare 1099s

- Assist in budgeting process

- Assist in onboarding/offboarding of new properties/clients

- Oversee property taxes for assigned properties

- Create year-end financial packages for tax reporting purposes

- Fulfill audit requests as necessary



Requirements?

- CPA preferably with big four firm experience.

- Proficiency in the use of 10-key calculator, personal computers, including knowledge of Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and - accounting software.

- Ability to analyze financial statements is absolutely required.

- Strong written and oral communication skills in a business environment.

- Ability to work well under pressure, with daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly deadlines.

- Well-developed organizational skills. Ability to prioritize duties and meet deadlines.

- Ability to work successfully as part of a team environment.

- Excellent interpersonal skills and a service-oriented background and mentality





Education

- A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or closely related field is a required.

- Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles

- Two to three years’ experience in property management and accounting is helpful. A general real estate background is helpful. - Experience with Yardi software is a plus.

title: Medical Virtual Assistant | Women’s Health & Thyroid Clinic
description:
Medical Virtual Assistant

Remote | Philippines-Based | Clinical Practice Support

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented Medical Virtual Assistant to support the clinical operations of a busy women’s health and thyroid-focused naturopathic medical practice based in Ontario, Canada.

This practice specializes in hormone health, thyroid conditions, and root-cause care for women. 

You will work directly with Dr. Robin to ensure patient charts, lab results, billing, and prescriptions are handled accurately and efficiently.

This is a medical support role requiring comfort with lab data, structured documentation, financial accuracy, and strong attention to detail. Strict confidentiality and professionalism are required when handling sensitive patient information.

You will be joining a small, established team with clear systems in place. Another experienced Virtual Assistant supports
 and administrative workflows, and you will collaborate via Slack during morning Eastern Time hours. Structured SOPs and training are provided to support your success.

This position is available immediately, with a target start date in March 2026. Candidates must be ready to begin onboarding within 2 weeks.

This is a part-time role of approximately 20 to 30 hours per month. Work is completed during morning Eastern Time hours, with flexibility as long as communication windows are maintained.

________________________________________

Core Responsibilities

• Upload and organize lab results in Jane (EMR system)

• Retrieve and download lab results from external laboratory portals as required

• Extract lab values and enter them accurately into patient charts according to established SOPs

• Prepare charts prior to appointments by carrying forward relevant Objective and Assessment sections from previous visits

• Create lab requisitions based on instructions from Dr. Robin

• Send lab requisitions to patients with templated instructions following appointments

• Process appointment billing independently and ensure all lab fees are added accurately before charging patient cards

• Double-check invoices carefully for completeness and pricing accuracy prior to payment processing

• Maintain precise and organized billing records

• Send lab results, handouts, and Care Plans to patients using approved template messages

• Fax prescriptions and confirm successful transmission

• Maintain prescription tracking documentation

• Prepare Care Plan templates by inserting current ND and MD lab results and organizing data for physician review

• Track time accurately and submit detailed invoices

________________________________________

Requirements

• Minimum 1 year experience as a Virtual Assistant

• Medical or clinical VA experience strongly preferred

• Experience working inside an EMR system preferred

• Comfortable working with lab panels and medical terminology

• Excellent written English and strong comprehension of spoken English for training videos

• Exceptional attention to detail. Billing accuracy is critical, as invoices are processed without secondary review

• Demonstrated ability to work independently with high accountability

• Strong internal quality control habits, including double checking work before submission

• Reliable computer and stable high speed internet

• Available Monday to Friday during Canadian Eastern Time mornings

• Responsive during morning ET hours for communication and coordination via Slack

• Comfortable using Slack, Google Drive, and AI tools with structured prompts

• Commitment to confidentiality. All patient information must remain secure

________________________________________

Work Hours & Availability

• Approximately 20 to 30 hours per month to start, with opportunity to grow

• This role is well suited to a Virtual Assistant managing multiple clients, provided responsiveness and accuracy are maintained.

• Must be available Monday to Friday during Eastern Time mornings for Slack communication and task coordination

• On Tuesdays and Wednesdays Eastern Time (ET), you must be available during morning ET hours to send patients their lab results prior to their scheduled appointments

• All other tasks may be completed on a flexible schedule, provided they are completed before midnight Canadian time

________________________________________

Compensation

• Paid via Wise

• Biweekly or monthly payment

• Please include your expected hourly rate in your application materials.

• This is a long-term hourly position. Compensation is based on experience.

________________________________________

Ideal Candidate

You are:

• Organized and structured

• Highly detail-oriented and naturally double-check your work

• Comfortable working with numbers and lab data

• Able to follow detailed SOPs precisely and ask questions when unsure

title: Customer Service Representative/Sales Coordinator
description:
I’m looking for a detail-oriented customer service/sales assistant to take ownership of our entire lead-to-job workflow cycle. Most of our clients reach out by phone, so clear, proficient, confident and friendly English on both inbound and outbound sales calls is essential. 



You will handle every touchpoint after the first ring: noting enquiries that come in by phone, SMS, web form or
, qualifying each lead, locking in an inspection time with our senior technician, following up on sent quotes, nudging clients about unpaid invoices, and—once the work is complete—politely requesting a google review for the business. 



Calls and sms are managed through a platform called LeadConnector and I track everything in Trello boards. If you have a smarter way to keep the pipeline visible, I’m open, but you must at least be comfortable living inside Trello from day one.



Where I need the heaviest lift is answering and returning calls and SMS and booking inspections as well as contacting customers post quote acceptance and managing the job schedule. Speed matters here, so you’ll need to find mutually convenient slots with the client, confirm details, and drop the appointment straight onto my calendar without back-and-forth.



This will ideally turn into a long-term, full-time position. If you’re organised, confident on the phone especially with warm outbound Sales, and eager to run the show from first enquiry to glowing review, let’s talk.



Must be available to answer all incoming calls and SMS between 9am-5pm Sydney Australia time (average calls per day can range from 1-10 incoming calls/sms) however all other admin tasks and outbound calls can be more flexible and made at later hours. 

   

We offer a base hourly rate plus a commission structure to be discussed during interview process.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Title: Remote Administrative Assistant



Job Summary

We are seeking a proactive, organized, and dependable Administrative Assistant to support our executives or supervisors in a remote work environment. The ideal candidate will excel in managing meetings, sending invites, updating schedules, taking detailed notes, and following up on action items until they are completed. This role requires strong communication, time management, and multitasking abilities, along with a high level of professionalism and discretion.



Key Responsibilities

• Attend meetings, take accurate notes, and provide reminders and follow-ups on discussed action items

• Send meeting invites, manage schedules, and update calendars to ensure all appointments and deadlines are met

• Proactively follow up with executives or supervisors and tea
mbers to ensure tasks are completed

• Maintain organized calendars, manage schedules, and coordinate appointments

• Answer
s on behalf of executives or supervisors, or assist with drafting, reviewing, and managing
 correspondence as directed

• Handle sensitive and confidential information with integrity

• Prioritize tasks, manage multiple assignments simultaneously, and meet deadlines

• Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with executives or supervisors and colleagues

• Support executives or supervisors with project coordination, including planning, execution, and follow-up

• Collaborate with other departments to ensure smooth coordination of tasks and projects

• Utilize office software and collaboration tools such as Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Planner, Power Automate, Microsoft Office, Cisco IP Communicator, Google Workspace, and CRM systems to manage daily tasks and workflows

• Demonstrate flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and business needs



Required Traits and Skills

• Strong organizational and time-management skills

• High attention to detail and accuracy

• Clear and professional verbal and written communication

• Ability to prioritize effectively and meet deadlines

• Discretion and confidentiality when handling sensitive information

• Proactive mindset with the ability to anticipate needs

• Tech-savvy, with experience using collaboration and productivity tools and the ability to quickly learn new systems

• Dependable, reliable, and consistent

• Strong multitasking and problem-solving abilities

• Professional demeanor in all interactions

• Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams

• Critical thinking and sound decision-making skills

• Ethical integrity and professionalism

• Experience with basic project coordination and follow-ups

• Resilience and adaptability in a fast-paced environment



Preferred Qualifications

• 3+ years of experience as an Administrative Assistant

• Experience working remotely and using tools such as Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Planner, Power Automate, or similar platforms

• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

Schedule & Availability

• Sunday to Friday work schedule

• Primary hours vary between 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM US Eastern Time

• Supervisors may require you to work overtime, up to 7:00 PM US Eastern Time, as needed

• Please apply only if you are willing and able to work this schedule and extended hours when requested

title: Social Media Manager & Content Creator - Remote, Full Time, AU Timezone, Fluent English
description:
We’re a fast-scaling, multi-vertical property tech company redefining how people buy, sell, rent, and manage property, without agents.



Our flagship platform is an agentless real estate ecosystem, powered by automation, compliance, and smart systems. We’ve been dubbed the Uber of Real Estate.



Currently in stealth mode ahead of national launch, this is a rare ground-floor opportunity inside a high-ambition, well-funded build years in the making.



The Role



We’re hiring a Senior Social Media Manager & Content Creator to own and execute our social strategy across:



Instagram, TikTok,
, LinkedIn, YouTube, Threads, X 
), and Google Business Profile.



You’ll work directly with the founder to build attention, create 
ntum, attract early adopters, and make our brand unavoidable.



What You’ll Do



• Plan, create, edit and post daily content

• Manage monthly content calendars across multiple verticals

• Write sharp captions with strong hooks and CTAs

• Edit short-form video (non-negotiable)

• Repurpose internal content into high-performing social assets

• Manage engagement (comments, DMs, shares)

• Spot trends, 
s, formats and leverage them fast

• Build hype for campaigns & competitions

• Track performance and optimise based on data

• Maintain content libraries and reporting systems



This is not a scheduling role. This is editorial ownership.



Expectations



• Be proactive - bring ideas weekly

• Stay on top of trends, algorithm shifts & competitors

• Protect the brand - no sloppy posts

• Move fast and adapt quickly

• A/B test and iterate constantly

• Collaborate closely with founder & EA



Some content is planned. Some is reactive. You must handle both.



Experience Required



Minimum 5+ years managing brand social media (not hobby accounts).



You must:



• Edit short-form video yourself

• Understand hooks, retention & pacing

• Produce 15–20+ pieces weekly

• Handle negative or heated engagement calmly

• Thrive in fast environments

• Think independently



What Success Looks Like



Our accounts feel dominant.



Content sparks reactions, shares, stitches, screenshots.

If something works, you scale it.

If it doesn’t, you pivot fast.



Why This Is Different



You’re joining before the spotlight.

You’ll shape how the brand sounds, moves, and is perceived nationally.



This isn’t a campaign role. It’s long-term.

If you’re strong, you grow with us.



How to Apply



Apply via Google Form:




We’ll ask for:

• Proof of experience

• Video editing examples

• Your content thinking



Final Note



We’re building something loud, visible and serious.



If you want safe and predictable, skip this.

If you want to build a media engine that dominates attention, apply.

mbers in Australia

title: Social Media Manager & Content Creator
description:
Build a Media Brand That Takes Over an Industry



About Us

Our company is a fast-scaling, multi-vertical property tech company redefining how people buy, sell, rent, and manage property, without agents. Our flagship platform is the first agentless real estate ecosystem, powered by automation, legal compliance, and smart systems. We have been dubbed the Uber of Real Estate

We’re currently in stealth mode, preparing for a national public launch. This is a rare opportunity to join at the ground level of a disruptive brand backed by years of planning, serious tech, and major ambitions.



Role Overview

We’re looking for a high-performing, senior Social Media Manager & Content Creator to own and execute our social content strategy across Instagram, TikTok,
, LinkedIn, Threads, and more.

You’ll work closely with our founder to drive brand awareness, build a cult-like following, launch viral campaigns, attract early sellers and buyers, and create content that makes agents nervous and audiences obsessed.



Key Responsibilities

Plan, create, and post daily content across IG, TikTok, FB, LinkedIn & more

Create and manage monthly content calendars across multiple verticals 

Write engaging, on-brand captions with sharp hooks, clear CTAs, and platform-specific tones

Edit reels and short-form videos (raw footage provided or repurposed from internal content)

Manage comment replies, DMs, shares, and cross-platform engagement

Identify and leverage trending audio, 
s, formats, and hashtags

Produce professional visual assets

Build hype for competitions & campaigns

Track metrics, growth, engagement, and make data-backed content decisions

Expectations

Be proactive: Suggest and execute new ideas weekly, fortnightly & monthly, not just follow orders.

Stay up to date: Monitor trends, 
s, algorithm changes, competitor activity & report back.

Protect the brand: Proofread everything, escalate risks, and never post off-brand content.

Be responsive: Quick to answer, quick to adapt. Social is 24/7.

Move fast

Measure & iterate: Regularly A/B test content, double down on what works.

Collaborate: Work closely with our founder & their EA

Document: Maintain a living content calendar, asset library, and reporting sheet.

This is not a “social media job”. We’re building a media machine to support one of the most ambitious property technology launches. Our goal isn’t to “grow an Instagram page”. Our goal is to dominate attention, shape the conversation, and make our brand unavoidable.



We want our social channels to feel like a media company, fast, opinionated, disciplined, creative, relentless



If your idea of social media is posting a few graphics each week and waiting for likes, this role is not for you. If you love building 
ntum, spotting angles, cutting sharp videos, reacting fast, and watching content explode, keep reading.



Our platform has been dubbed the Uber of Real Estate. We’re launching aggressively and we expect attention, criticism & scale, and we’re building a serious media operation to match that ambition.



What you’ll actually be doing day to day



You will run our social presence, and that means:

• planning content

• creating content

• editing content

• posting content

• reacting to what happens because of the content

• and doing it again, faster, smarter, better



Platforms Managed

• Instagram (posts, reels, stories)

•
 (page, groups)

• TikTok (videos, trends, skits)

• YouTube (shorts, testimonials, explainer videos)

• LinkedIn (company, founder profile)

• Threads

•
/X (brand, PR, viral threads)

• Google Business Profile (for reviews and posts)



Some days you’ll be editing planned content, other days you’ll be cutting a clip or post within hours because something unexpected blew up. 



This role rewards people who think like editors and producers, not just schedulers.



Some content is planned a month ahead, some content is created because something just happened. You need to be good at both.



What we’re looking for:



We’re looking for someone who already knows what they’re doing.

You should have 5+ years of experience managing brand social media, not personal pages and not hobby accounts.



You should:



• personally edit short-form video (this is non-negotiable)

• understand hooks, pacing, subtitles, and retention

• have taste and restraint, not just trend addiction

• be comfortable producing 15–20 pieces of content per week

• stay calm when comments turn negative or heated

• enjoy fast-moving environments



This is not a role where someone tells you exactly what to post every day. You’re expected to have initiative & think.



What success looks like



After a few months, our accounts should feel like: “These guys are everywhere.”

Content should:

• spark discussion

• trigger reactions

• get shared into group chats

• be stitched, duetted, screenshotted

• shape how people talk about the industry



If something hits, you know how to milk it.

If something doesn’t, you know how to kill it.



Why this role is exciting

You’re joining before the big spotlight.

You’ll help define:

• how the brand sounds

• how it moves

• how fast it reacts

• what it becomes known for



This isn’t a short campaign or a throwaway contract.

If you’re good, you’ll grow with the company.



How to apply



You’ll apply via our Google Form where we’ll ask for:

• proof of experience

• examples of your video editing

• how you think about content



???? 



Final note



We’re building something loud, visible, and serious.



If you want safe, predictable work, skip this.

If you want to build a media engine and be proud of it, we want to hear from you.
