title: Logistics / Supply Chain Analyst
description:
Location: Remote – Philippines

Type: Full-Time



About the Role



We are looking for a highly analytical Logistics / Supply Chain Analyst to support end-to-end supply chain planning, logistics performance tracking, and data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate has senior-level Excel skills, strong analytical capabilities, and experience working with operations, procurement, inventory, or 3PL teams.



This role requires someone who can turn raw operational data into actionable insights, optimize workflows, and support strategic planning across the supply chain.



Key Responsibilities



Supply Chain & Logistics Analysis

Analyze inventory levels, replenishment needs, order flows, and lead times to ensure product availability.

Monitor logistics KPIs including OTIF, order accuracy, freight costs, and warehouse performance.

Track inbound/outbound shipments and identify bottlenecks affecting delivery timelines.

Support demand planning by analyzing sales, forecast accuracy, and SKU performance.



Reporting & Dashboarding

Build, maintain, and automate complex Excel models for forecasting, inventory planning, and cost analysis.

Develop dashboards and weekly/monthly reporting packs for operations leaders.

Consolidate data across multiple sources (ERP, WMS, 3PL dashboards, spreadsheets) for executive-level reporting.



Operational Optimization

Identify inefficiencies in logistics processes and recommend data-driven improvements.

Analyze vendor and freight performance, comparing SLA adherence and cost-effectiveness.

Support procurement and replenishment decisions with robust data models and simulations.

Partner with warehouses, suppliers, and internal teams to resolve discrepancies or supply interruptions.



Cross-Functional Collaboration

Work closely with operations, finance, merchandising, and logistics partners.

Prepare and present insights, trends, and recommendations to management.

Assist in SOP development and operational workflow improvements.



Qualifications

Required

3–5+ years of experience in logistics, supply chain analysis, operations analysis, or related roles.

Senior-level Excel expertise, including:

Advanced formulas (INDEX/MATCH, XLOOKUP, SUMIFS, ARRAY formulas)

Pivot tables and Power Query

Scenario modeling and complex multi-sheet workbooks

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret large datasets and identify actionable insights.

Experience working with supply chain tools (ERP, WMS, OMS, 3PL portals).

Excellent communication skills—able to explain complex findings in a clear, structured manner.

Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and problem-solving skills.



Preferred

Experience in eCommerce, retail, CPG, or multi-channel supply chain environments.

Familiarity with SQL, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar analytics tools.

Experience with demand planning or inventory forecasting models.



Who You Are

Highly analytical and detail-oriented

Comfortable managing and interpreting large datasets

title: Shopify Fulfillment & Order Batching VA (Operations Focused)
description:
We are a U.S.-based 3PL fulfillment warehouse handling multiple Shopify brands.



We are hiring a highly detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to manage daily order batching, shipping setup, label organization, and operational reporting.



This role directly supports warehouse efficiency and shipping accuracy. Mistakes in this role affect real shipments and real costs, so attention to detail is critical.



This is NOT a customer service or marketing role.

This is an operations control position.



Daily Responsibilities



Log into Shopify and filter UNFULFILLED orders.



Filter orders by yesterday’s date (orders ship the following business day).



Batch same-SKU orders together for efficient warehouse processing.



Input correct shipping details according to our SOP:



Weight



Box size



Shipping service type



Generate shipping labels.



Extract and batch Order IDs after label creation.



Upload structured order data into our master Google Sheet:



Order ID



SKU type



Quantity



Misc cost



Prep type (box or envelope)



Upload and organize daily shipping labels into structured folders by:



Client



Date



SKU batch



Labels must be uploaded and organized EVERY day.



Daily Reporting Requirement



Before logging off each day, you must submit a structured fulfillment report including:



Total unfulfilled orders at start of day



Total orders processed



Total labels generated



SKU breakdown



Confirmation spreadsheet was updated



Any discrepancies or issues



Time log (start/end time)



This is mandatory.



Requirements



Strong Shopify experience (REQUIRED)



Experience batching orders by SKU



Extremely detail-oriented



Comfortable working with shipping data



Google Sheets proficiency



Ability to follow structured SOP exactly



Available during U.S. CST business hours



Stable internet connection



To Apply



Send a short Loom video (2–3 minutes) explaining:



Your Shopify experience



How you would batch orders by SKU efficiently



Your experience handling shipping labels



Applications without a Loom video will not be reviewed.

title: Cinematic Travel Series Producer (Hospitality & Lifestyle)
description:
Do You Feel Your Video Editing & Long-Form Storytelling Skills Are Cinematic?



Can you take beautifully shot travel footage and shape it into something emotionally compelling?



Can you create hospitality storytelling that feels refined, immersive, and intentional — not loud or influencer-driven?



If you understand pacing, presence, and emotional resonance in editing… keep reading.



Cinematic Travel Series Editor



Go Travel Community | Hospitality-Driven Travel Brand



About Go Travel Community



Go Travel Community is not a booking site.

We are not a traditional travel agency.



We are building a belief-led hospitality ecosystem rooted in:



• Intentional travel

• Meaningful community

• Elevated experiences

• Human connection

• Impact-driven exploration



Our brand exists at the intersection of hospitality, storytelling, and emotional resonance.



We are launching a Virgin Voyages travel content series and are seeking a skilled Video Editor to transform captured footage into a cohesive, emotionally intelligent long-form episode and supporting social content.



This is not influencer-style “look at me” content.

This is not loud luxury.



This is refined, emotionally grounded hospitality storytelling.



Our tone:

80% emotion

20% intellect

Calm confidence

Elevated but inclusive

Story-driven, never salesy



The content should make viewers feel:

Present

Inspired

Expanded

Curious

Part of something bigger



Role Overview



This is a post-production focused role.



All footage will be professionally captured and provided.

You will collaborate closely with a founder-led brand to shape narrative, pacing, tone, and emotional arc.



We are looking for someone who understands cinematic storytelling — not just technical cutting.



This is a flexible, project-based opportunity with potential for ongoing collaboration as the series expands.



Key Responsibilities



• Edit one long-form episode (approximately 30–45 minutes)

• Shape strong emotional and narrative structure from provided footage

• Create multiple vertical short-form edits (Reels, TikTok, Shorts)

• Apply intentional pacing and music selection

• Perform clean, polished color grading

• Integrate immersive but subtle sound design

• Collaborate creatively while remaining efficient and organized

• Deliver structured final files and project assets



Required Skills & Experience



• Strong cinematic storytelling sensibility

• Advanced proficiency in professional editing software

• Experience editing long-form content (30+ minutes)

• Ability to balance luxury aesthetics with authenticity

• Understanding of hospitality, lifestyle, or travel branding

• Strong communication and collaboration skills

• Ability to work within defined scope and timelines



Preferred Experience



• Travel or hospitality editing experience

• Documentary-style pacing

• Experience creating both long-form and short-form content from the same footage

• Familiarity with YouTube storytelling structure

• Understanding of emotionally intelligent brand positioning



Deliverables Expectations (Per Episode)



• One long-form episode (30–45 minutes)

• 3–6 vertical short-form cuts

• Clean audio balance and music integration

• Light color correction and polish

• Organized project file delivery



Final scope and number of short-form edits will be aligned prior to project start to ensure clarity and creative focus.



Tone & Creative Alignment



Your editing should prioritize:



• Presence over hype

• Atmosphere over spectacle

• Emotion over ego

• Story over sales



We are not documenting luxury for display.

We are capturing hospitality as a lived, shared experience.



What Success Looks Like



• Viewers feel transported, not marketed to

• The brand feels cohesive and elevated

• The storytelling feels intentional and emotionally resonant

• The founder feels creatively supported

• The audience feels like they belong



Compensation



$12 – $15 per hour

(approximately ?670 – ?850 per hour, depending on exchange rate)



Estimated per episode range: $500 – $700 USD



Compensation is based on experience, efficiency, and portfolio strength.



Opportunity for ongoing collaboration as we continue building our long-form travel series.



If your editing style is thoughtful, refined, and emotionally aware — we would love to see your work.



Please apply with:



• Portfolio or reel

• One example of long-form storytelling

• Examples of short-form edits

• A brief note describing your approach to hospitality or travel storytelling



Thank You!

title: Administrative & Customer Support Officer
description:
WHO ARE WE:

We are a fast-growing children’s sports development network operating across the Central Coast, Gold Coast and Northern Rivers for children aged 1.5-8yrs. Our program delivers structured football programs for children aged 18 months to 8 years, focusing on confidence, coordination and life skills, not just sport.

We are expanding and tightening our systems to support growth. We operate with clear protocols, strong communication standards and high expectations. Our goal is simple: deliver an exceptional experience and custome service  to every family to join.



WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for a long-term, reliable Administrative & Customer Support Officer to work part-time within set daily hours when our offices are open.



This role is focused on:

-Text communication


 management

-CRM updates (Salesforce, Dialpad, etc)

-Data entry

-Following structured action protocols

-Supporting enrolments, waitlists, retention systems and assisting custromer needs.

-This is not a casual short-term position. We are looking for someone who wants stability and to grow with us long term.



This position will be for 4-5 hours per day Monday-Friday AEST to start. We will increase pay with experience and good performance. Our main values are trust, consistency and ownership. All are extremely important to us. If you treat the role with professionalism and care, we will support and reward strong performance. We are not looking for someone to be with us for months, we are looking for someone to be with us for YEARS and grow with us. There are lots of possibilities and expansions with us.



Hours will fall within business hours (approx. 8:30am–4:30pm AEST structure). Remote work.



WHO YOU ARE:



You are structured and process-driven.

You like clear systems and checklists.

You don’t need constant supervision and once you understand the protocol, you execute it consistently.

You communicate clearly and professionally via text and
.

You take pride in keeping systems clean, organised and up to date.

You are calm under pressure and handle customer concerns with maturity.

You understand that small delays in admin can cost a business revenue and you don’t let things slip.



You have:

-Reliable internet at home

-A distraction-free workspace at home

-Strong written English

-High attention to detail



JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

-Respond to inbound text messages via DialPad in a timely manner (within the hour maximum)

-Manage structured daily
 waves through your working day (eg. morning, midday, end of day)

-Execute lead follow-up protocols (waitlists, failed registrations, offers sent)

-Process enrolments, card details and update our Salesforce records accurately

-Maintain detailed profile notes for all customer communication and use our tracker systems

-Manage weekly potential customer follow-ups, via text or

-Execute cancellation and retention protocols

-Run debtor communication process according to structured stages

-Monitor trial bookings and send reminders

-Track move-ups and class availability

-Maintain organised digital folders and CRM data

-Ensure no enquiry, lead or task is left unaddressed at end of your day



This role is about consistency and execution.



THE BEST CANDIDATE:

-Has previous admin or customer support experience

-Has worked with CRM systems (Salesforce, DialPad, Gmail experience is a bonus)

-Writes clearly, professionally and confidently english

-Has outstanding attention to detail

-Is organised and structured, and is consistent 

-Can follow clear systems without cutting corners

-Is proactive in flagging issues

-Has strong time management skills

-Has a positive, solutions-focused mindset

-Treats this role as a long-term opportunity, not a temporary job



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE:

-All communication responded to within required timeframes

-Clean and accurate CRM records

-No lost leads due to admin delays

-customer needs actively managed

-Systems and protocols processed and executed correctly

-Systems followed without supervision

-A smooth, professional customer service experience for our families



HOW TO APPLY?

Congratulations on making it this far,  that already tells us something about you ????

If this role sounds like a fit and you believe you’re the organised, process-driven rockstar we’re looking for, we’d genuinely love to hear from you.



To apply, please submit:

-Your resume

-A short cover letter explaining why you are suited to a structured, protocol-driven admin role

-Your available working hours (including time zone)

-Confirmation of your internet reliability and home workspace setup



Looking forward to hearing from you:

 In the first paragraph of your application, include the words, I am a rockstar, hire me so we know you’ve read this entire job description carefully.

Applications without the words I am a rockstar, hire in the first paragraph will not be considered.



Bonus points: Briefly tell us what you think makes great customer service (in 2–3 sentences max).

We are looking for someone long-term not just for months, but for years. If you take pride in structure, consistency and doing things properly, this could be a great fit and we are keen to meet you.



We look forward to hearing from you.

mber ready to help Smart Local scale globally.

title: FUNNEL BUILDER (Part-time)
description:
We’re hiring a Funnel Builder who knows how to architect, build, and optimize conversion-focused funnels using GoHighLevel and automation tools like 
 and Zapier.



This role is for someone who thinks in systems, understands how cold traffic behaves, and builds funnels cleanly and correctly. You are here to design, deploy, and improve funnels.  Your priorities are CRO, reliable automation, and creating a magical client experience from the first time someone interacts with our brand.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Team Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important, and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just managing marketing campaigns for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you think like a funnel and conversion architect? Do you enjoy structuring systems, workflows, and sales psychology that drives measurable results? Are you obsessed with improving KPIs by designing experiments and running tests? Do you take pride in building things properly the first time while still iterating and optimizing?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Funnel Architecture, Buildout & Optimization

- Build complete funnels inside GoHighLevel focused on lead generation

- Structure landing pages with conversion principles in mind

- Create and customize pages, forms, and
s

- Embed forms, manage page layouts, and ensure clean user flow across multiple devices

- Maintain proper tagging architecture and funnel logic



Automations, Workflows & Integrations

- Build and maintain workflows, automations, and multi-step sequences

- Implement conditional logic and clean tag-based systems

- Create 
 automations as needed

- Integrate APIs and third-party tools where required (OPTIONAL, but preferred)

- Set up UTM parameters, tracking codes, and verify traffic source links are set up correctly



Tracking, Optimization & Testing

- Implement Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager (bonus)

- Ensure accurate tracking and data flow across funnels

- Apply an A/B testing mindset to improve conversion rates

- Optimize funnels over time based on performance data and KPIs



Campaign Systems & Deployment

- Maintain clean, scalable campaign structures

- Collaborate with leadership on funnel improvements and testing plans

- Continuously learn and stay up to date on best practices to help brainstorm and make recommendations for improvements to our funnel ecosystem



Requirements:

- STRONG hands-on experience with GoHighLevel, required

- Recent experience with workflows, automations, tags, and sequences, required

- Experience building lead generation funnels (not ecom or dropshipping focused), required

- Experience with 
 and/or Zapier automations, required

- Understanding of conversion rate optimization and buyer behavior, required

- Ability to think in systems and campaign logic, required

- Clean build habits, required

- Moderate familiarity with cold traffic funnels, required

- Strong English communication skills; near-native preferred if involved in testing copy

- Interest in copy, funnel strategy, and optimization (execution-focused)

- A stable, high-speed internet connection, required (at least 150mbps)

- Growth mindset, required



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)

- Meta Ads, Google Ads, or media buying familiarity

- Meta Pixel, GA4, GTM setup experience

- Basic SEO understanding

- API integrations beyond native tools



NOTE: This is a part-time role (5–15 hrs/week) with the opportunity to grow into a full-time position for the right person.



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.



As part of your application, include a Loom or YouTube video (2 minutes or less) explaining why you believe you’re a strong fit for this specific Funnel Builder role.







STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to an interview.



STEP 3:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 4:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Funnel Builder with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: GHL Ops Implementer (Systems + Bot Logic + QA) — PH Day Shift (Long-Term)
description:
Role: GHL Ops Implementer (Systems + Bot Logic + QA) — PH Day Shift (Long-Term)

Hours: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM Philippines time (Remote, no graveyard)

Type: Full-time, long-term. Not a side gig.



If you’re the kind of implementer who ships tested + documented systems (not just “set up”), this will feel like home.



What you’ll own

1) GoHighLevel Builds + Troubleshooting (Daily)

- Pipelines/stages + lifecycle logic

- Tags + custom fields + clean naming conventions

- Forms/surveys + lead capture flows

- Calendars + booking workflows (confirmations, reminders, no-show, reschedule)

- Workflows (If/Else logic, waits, stop conditions, internal notifications)

- Debugging: misfires, duplicates, missing field mapping, wrong triggers



2) Conversation AI Bot & Automation Build (Primary)

- Build structured flows: enquiry ? qualify ? CTA/booking intent ? escalation

- Maintain knowledge base / training content (clean, organised, easy to update)

- Safe fallback rules: unknown ? capture details ? notify staff (no guessing, no hallucinations)

- Improve flows based on real conversations (drop-offs, confusion points, repeated questions)



3) Project Management (Non-negotiable)

- Convert Loom/voice notes into a task plan (owners, deadlines, dependencies)

- Maintain tracker (ClickUp/Notion/Asana — tool doesn’t matter, discipline does)

- Weekly updates: Done / Next / Blockers / Decisions needed

- Changelog + handover docs (simple SOP + quick Loom walkthrough)

- Clear, reliable client communication



4) QA / Testing (Must)

- You test before shipping:

- New lead vs existing lead

- Edge cases (missing fields, random user replies, long delays)

- Stop conditions + duplicate triggers

- Pipeline movement + internal notifications

- You provide QA evidence (test notes + screenshots OR short Loom)



Definition of Done (how we work)

A build is only “done” when it has:

-QA evidence (notes + screenshots / short Loom)

- Changelog entry (what changed + why)

- Handover note (what to watch + where to edit next time)



Must-have skills

- Proven hands-on GHL experience (workflows + calendars + pipelines) 

- Strong written English (clear, concise, structured)

- High ownership + detail obsession (testing + documentation)



Strong advantage

- GHL Certified Admin

- Webhooks/APIs basics (payloads, auth, debugging)

- Make/Zapier/n8n

- WhatsApp-first flow design patterns

- UTM / attribution basics

- Marketing background



Not a fit if…

- You need constant prompting

- You build without testing

- You dislike documentation/trackers

- You guess when unsure instead of escalating

- You’re juggling multiple agency clients and can’t commit long-term



Compensation + growth (read carefully)

- Salary band: PHP 27k –50k/ month (based on proof of work + paid practical test)

- Top of range is reserved for implementers who can own builds end-to-end with QA + documentation and minimal supervision.

- Performance reviews: 30 / 60 / 90 days with clear raise criteria (delivery + QA + rework rate).

- Stability: long-term role, PH day shift, clear process, clean handovers.



How to apply (follow exactly)

- Subject: GHL-OPS-READY

- Include: Resume/CV

- WhatsApp number

- Expected salary + earliest start date

- Weekly availability + timezone



Proof of work (required — choose ONE):

- Loom walkthrough of a workflow + calendar flow you built, OR

- Screenshots of workflows/pipelines (blur client names) + short explanation, OR

- Sample changelog/handover/SOP you wrote (redacted)



Answer these 3 questions (bullet points):

- You receive a 12-min Loom of requirements. How do you turn it into tasks and ship safely within 48 hours?

- A workflow fires twice. List likely causes + your debug steps.

- A user asks the bot something not in the knowledge base. What do you reply, and what do you log internally?



Only shortlisted applicants will contacted.

title: Marketing & Short Form Video Editor
description:
About the Client



You’ll be supporting an Australian creator-led business in the dance/education space with a large back-catalogue of video content and an active audience across YouTube and
. The work is practical, fast-moving, and focused on getting consistent content out the door—without overcomplicating things.



Your Impact



Within 90 days, you’ll help the creator publish short-form content consistently, reduce the weekly “content bottleneck”, and build a simple, repeatable workflow that keeps 
ntum. This isn’t about perfection—it’s about reliable output, clean execution, and steady improvement.



Key Responsibilities



Repurpose existing long-form videos into YouTube Shorts using an efficient workflow (AI clip generation + selection + light editing).

Create batches of draft shorts, flag the strongest clips, and refine them so they’re clear, watchable, and on-brand.

Apply a consistent style using existing templates (captions/look & feel), with small improvements over time.

Export, upload, and schedule Shorts to the YouTube channel (titles, basic metadata, consistency).

Create/update thumbnails in Canva using provided templates (no need to design from scratch).

Track performance basics (views, retention, simple trends) and share a weekly snapshot to guide what to double down on.

Communicate daily: end-of-day update covering what you did / what didn’t work / what’s next / blockers.

As capacity allows (later stage): cross-post selected Shorts to
/Instagram and assist with simple marketing admin (e.g., basic newsletter or opt-in support using existing tools/templates).

Must-Have Qualifications (Self-Check)



2+ years editing short-form content (Shorts/Reels/TikTok) with a focus on speed + clarity

Comfortable working with Filmora (Wondershare) or willing to learn it quickly (and/or propose a faster tool that achieves the same outcome)

Confident uploading and scheduling content on YouTube

Canva skills (template-based thumbnails and simple visual assets)

Strong English comprehension (you can judge whether a clip “makes sense” and catch awkward cut points)

Proactive communicator: You raise blockers early and don’t disappear

Can work within AEST overlap and provide daily EOD updates

Reliable home setup: stable internet, headset, and a distraction-managed workspace

Nice-to-Have Skills



Experience using YouTube optimisation tools (e.g., vidIQ/keyword tools) for titles and basic SEO

Experience 
 content across
/Instagram (platform-specific formatting awareness)

Familiarity with newsletter/email platforms (Kajabi/Mailchimp/Beehiiv or similar)

A strong creative eye: you can suggest small tweaks that lift quality without adding hours

Success Outcomes (30/60/90 Days)



30 Days: You can run the full Shorts workflow end-to-end with minimal supervision; publish consistently (target range: 8–15 Shorts/week, depending on complexity), with clean captions and sensible clip selection.

60 Days: You help lock in a repeatable “house style” (templates + do/don’t examples), reduce rework, and improve titles/thumbnails consistency.

90 Days: Publishing is steady and predictable; weekly reporting is clear; turnaround time improves; the creator feels confident the content machine runs without chasing.



Job Type: Part-time

title: Urgent Hiring: Tiktok Shop Creator Success Manager
description:
Job Title: Tiktok Shop Creator Success Manager 



Overview

We're one of the top TikTok Shop agencies in the US, ranking top 3 as the CAP. We work with 200+ top beauty creators generating $10M+ GMV monthly.



But we're not just a TikTok agency. TikTok Shop is all about affiliates now, and we use media to attract like-minded creators to join our journey. Surrounded with A+ creators, work on something challenging and exciting, and build real relationships and deep trust with the best ones.



The vision is to evolve into a media company + tech-enabled platform, using media to attract like-minded creators and together define the product trends on TikTok Shop.



The Role

We're looking for a Creator Success Manager - a mix of Creator Manager, Community Manager, and Relationship Builder.



You'll be the first line of contact with our creators. You represent our reputation. This isn't about following scripts - it's about genuinely caring and building trust.



Key Responsibilities



Manage daily communication with creators via text and calls

Conduct weekly 1:1 creator check-ins and support group calls

Act as the primary point of contact and brand representative

Build and maintain strong, trust-based creator relationships

Identify creator needs, blockers, and growth opportunities

Assess creator fit and engagement; flag misaligned or inactive creators

Onboard new creators and align expectations

Coordinate with internal teams to support creator success

Ensure fast responses and consistent follow-ups

Step in during high-priority or peak periods as needed



What We're Looking For



Straightforward: Say it directly. No fluff, no dancing around.

Hungry:You want to win. You care about results.

Aggressive: You take initiative. You don't wait for instructions.

Buy into TTS Vision: You see the potential of TikTok Shop in the US market.

Want to be surrounded by A-players: You want challenge. You want to grow with excellent people.



Requirements

Fluent English - native or near-native level (calls + text)

Strong communication - no Al/ChatGPT tone, real human voice

Detail-oriented - catch everything, respond fast

Good judgment - know who's a fit and who's not

EST working hours, 8 hours/day

Willing to put in extra during critical periods (with bonus/overtime pay)



Our Values (How We Treat Creators)

Creator First - We think about their pain points first

Reputation - We do what we say

Trust & Transparency - Direct and honest

True Relationship - Build something we're all proud of together

Fast Communication - Never leave them waiting





This role is NOT for you if:

You want a chill, low-pressure job

You prefer to wait for instructions

You don't care about TikTok Shop or e-commerce

You just want a paycheck



This role IS for you if:

You want to be part of something big

You thrive in fast-paced environments

You genuinely enjoy connecting with people

You want to grow with a top-tier team



Rate: $1000

Schedule: Full-time, Remote, EST working hours, 8 hours/day

Requirement: Minimum 1 year of experience with TikTok Shop Seller Center





Important:

*Only applicants who meet the requirements will be considered.

*Make sure your resume and portfolio are updated, as these will be the main basis for screening.

title: Executive Assistant / Operations Support Specialist
description:
Executive Assistant / Operations Support Specialist for The Rise & Shine Collective



Hello! Please only apply if you have at least 3+ years of experience in executive assistant or operations support roles.



ABOUT US



The Rise & Shine Collective is home to holistic business mentoring, aligned online off growth and launch coaching and consulting, and The Aligned & Thriving Podcast. We are passionate about supporting women in service-based businesses to rise and shine through aligned strategic business design and development alongside entrepreneurial development that feels good, sustainable, and right for them.



Founded by Jada de Goey, a multi-passionate entrepreneur with a background in business management, event production, and dance studio leadership, we help ambitious female entrepreneurs grow and scale their businesses in alignment with their vision, strengths, and ideal clients. We are an exciting small business, and we are growing fast!



We are looking for an exceptional Executive Assistant / Operations Support Specialist to join our team in this critical role.

About the Role



Working as part of our small, dynamic and client-focused team, this role is responsible for operational excellence, content management (social media,
 and podcast), tech stack maintenance, and providing high-level customer care throughout our clients' journeys.



You will be managing various operational tasks, supporting launch campaigns, maintaining our digital systems, providing customer support, and helping to create the backend systems that allow us and our clients to thrive. This is less about high-volume customer service and more about operational excellence, content creation and management, tech stack management, and thoughtful high-level customer care.



This role will see you supporting ambitious female entrepreneurs who are building service-based businesses, so you'll need to be organised, proactive, detail-oriented, service focussed and able to think strategically about business operations.



This role is available on a Permanent Part-Time basis to begin with, with opportunity for expansion as the business grows for the right fit person. Starting at approximately 15 - 20 hours per week.



HERE'S WHAT A TYPICAL WEEK IN THIS ROLE LOOKS LIKE:

- Managing and maintaining the company's tech stack including (but not limited to) LeadPages, Kit
 system, project management tools, scheduling management platforms and tools and other digital platforms.

- Maintaining regular
 campaigns to our community.

- Creating and updating digital products, course content, and resources as these are developed.

- Building and optimising landing pages for launches, lead magnets, and program enrolments.

- Podcast production tasks including editing, scheduling, show notes, and content repurposing.

- Managing the company inbox and ensuring timely, thoughtful responses to client enquiries.

- Providing high-level customer support to private clients and program participants via
 and Messenger (as well as future upgrades we implement for improved service and management).

- Supporting launch campaigns by creating and scheduling
 sequences, updating landing pages, and managing campaign timelines.

- Creating standard operating procedures (SOPs) and documentation for business processes.

- Managing client onboarding and offboarding processes with care and attention to detail.

- Supporting event coordination for masterminds, workshops, and online programs.

- Handling administrative tasks including scheduling, calendar management, and meeting preparation.

- Assisting with content creation and social media scheduling as needed.

- Managing systems and workflows to ensure smooth business operations.

- Troubleshooting technical issues and finding creative solutions to operational challenges.



ABOUT YOU



We are looking for someone who has a proven track record in an executive assistant or operations support role, ideally within an online coaching, consulting, or service-based business environment. Experience with digital course platforms, LeadPages and
 CRM’s for creating products, managing
 campaigns, and building landing pages would be highly valued. Or variations that are similar where skills are transferable.



You are comfortable working independently, taking initiative, and managing multiple projects simultaneously. You have a strategic mind and can see how operational systems support business growth.



It goes without saying that you must possess exceptional organisational and communication skills, attention to detail, and a passion for creating systems that support ambitious entrepreneurs in building sustainable businesses as well as a genuine love for being of service/helping others.



In addition, you are proactive, solutions-focused, and thrive in a dynamic environment where priorities can shift. Your ability to anticipate needs, think critically, and make sound decisions will be essential, as will your comfort with technology and digital systems and a willingness to learn new skills.



Importantly, you must be tech savvy! Some of the tools we use include:

- Podcast production tools (editing and delivery - we host on BuzzSprout and edit in Descript)

- Online course management platforms (product creation, community building and delivery)

- LeadPages (or other landing page platform experience)

- Project management tools (e.g., Asana, Trello, ClickUp)

- Social media platforms (Instagram,
. LinkedIn would be a bonus)

- Canva for design work

- Zoom for client calls and meetings

-
 and calendar management

- G Suite applications

- Basic video editing would be a bonus (and can be taught)



This job is in Australian time (Brisbane). A good internet connection is required. A Computer or Laptop is needed with camera function (tablets, phones, and other devices are not sufficient). Note: If you don't know every platform or have every skill but do fit the overall description and skill set, please apply, we are happy to provide training to the right fit person.



HOW TO APPLY



Self-awareness, personal development and interpersonal skills are highly valued at The Rise & Shine Collective. Therefore we ask that you complete a couple of personality assessments as part of the application process and include screenshots of your results in your cover letter.



To Apply, please send the following:

1. Combined Resume + Proof of Work:

- Include relevant executive assistant, operations, and tech platform experience (particularly online course/membership hosting platforms, landing page building, podcast production, and any tech stack, operations and customer service)

- Showcase examples of systems you've created, projects you've managed, things you’ve built, or operational improvements you've implemented

- Case studies or examples of how you've supported coaches, consultants, or service-based businesses to improve internal processes and output as well as business growth.

2. Short Intro Video: 1-2 minutes introducing yourself, explaining why you're a great fit for this role, and telling us what energises you most about supporting women in business!

3. Human Design Results: Get your Human Design Chart from 
/get-your-chart/ and share your type with us

4. Include #risingoperations in the Application Title to be considered and address your application to Jada.



Ready to support ambitious women entrepreneurs while building streamlined systems and operations? We can't wait to hear from you!

title: SEO and Google Ads Specialist
description:
Part Time Organic SEO and Google Ads Specialist



Start Date: Mid September

Employment Type & Hours: Virtual Contractor Part Time | 5-7 hours per week

Reporting to: Chantel - Studio Manager

Training and onboarding provided by: Jada and Chantel



About Us:



Established in Brisbane in 1994, Rio Rhythmics is Australia’s largest and most comprehensive Latin dance Academy. We offer 40+ classes per week in two locations in the West End.



Our purpose is to support people to improve their lives by bringing people together in an environment where they can connect with others in a healthy way. Where community is key, and everyone feels included, “at home” and a part of something bigger. Providing an opportunity to have healthy physical contact with others, which is essential to human health, and to improve people’s wellbeing through developing more mind-body connections.

We do this through high-quality, professional Latin dance tuition with a focus on “dancing for life”, the social aspect of dancing, and also by sharing the South American culture. We strive to create a place and an environment which is positive and rewarding for our team and clients alike.



Within its business context, Rio Rhythmics’ supports and encourages team, and individual, creativity and growth; striving to help everyone achieve both team and personal success and fulfilment.



Position Overview:



We are looking for a part-time ongoing specialist in SEO and Google Ads who can optimise our website (on Shopify) for organic reach and attraction in a strategic and creative data driven way plus create further reach and traction to further our reach and attraction into our dance classes via paid Google Ads so we are showing up at the top in organic searches and being put in front of new ideal audience through paid Google Ads.



Experience required for this position:

- Proven and extensive SEO optimisation experience

- Experienced Google Ads speciality

- Digital footprint management



Key Responsibilities:



- Local SEO

- Website & Backlink Audit

- Keyword Research & Strategy

- On-Page Optimisation

- SEO optimised Blog posts

- SEO optimised content creation

- SEO optimisation across website

- Google Advertising

- Google My Business audit and maintenance to stay relevant and up to date for optimal organic presence.



Depending on candidate potential role extra's:

- SEO optimised Blog writing

- Shopify product updates

- Shopify website updates

- Support with upgrading and building out website

- Adding new pages as needed for new products to website

- Landing page builds

- Tech support across online platforms and linking them



Other Requirements:



- Ability to work independently, creatively and effectively to meet weekly deadlines.

- Ability to work within a small business environment that is ever evolving sometimes with long lead times, sometimes with sudden / new ideas to be brought to life quickly.

- Understanding of (or interest in) dance, fitness, or wellbeing industries is a plus!

- Access to your own computer and internet connection to work from.

- Good and open communication.

- Very strong english both written and verbal.



Position Details:

Remote, flexible hours (approximately 10 hours/week to start, with potential for more depending on skills and business growth)





Rate: Negotiable depending on experience. $7-$14 per hour

Possibility for more hours with the right fit, other skills and/or as we grow.



How to Apply:

If this sounds like you we’d love to hear from you! Please send an
 to to apply with addressed to Jada, with #organicplacementnumberone in the subject line and including:



1. 2min Video sharing a little about you, your experience, what you love about SEO and Google Advertising and why you feel you’re a great match for this position.

2. Examples of your work and results across both SEO placement increased business growth improvement and Google Advertising examples and outcome examples.

3. So that we can understand more about you and the way you function best please include your Enneagram and Human Design profile results

Human Design Chart: 
/

p)

title: SEMrush SEO Specialist for E-Commerce (Lighting Industry)
description:
We are looking for a highly experienced SEMrush expert to fully operate and execute SEO strategy using our existing SEMrush subscription.



This is NOT a beginner role. You must be able to independently use SEMrush at an intermediate and or advance level and drive real business results.



Our client is a fast-growing commercial lighting e-commerce company, and your job will be to use SEMrush to uncover opportunities, create strategy, and execute ongoing SEO improvements.



You will be working directly with management and will play a critical role in growing organic traffic and revenue.



Your Responsibilities



You will be responsible for operating SEMrush and executing the following:



Core SEMrush Execution



• Full SEMrush site audits and technical issue identification

• Keyword research for high-value commercial lighting products

• Competitor analysis and opportunity discovery

• Keyword gap analysis vs competitors

• Backlink analysis and link opportunity identification

• Position tracking and ongoing monitoring

• Identifying pages with highest revenue potential



Strategy & Execution



• Identify keywords with strongest revenue opportunity

• Recommend new pages, content, and optimizations

• Identify quick wins and long-term growth strategy

• Create clear action plans based on SEMrush data



Reporting



• Weekly summary of findings and opportunities

• Clear communication of recommendations

• Ongoing tracking of progress and improvements



Requirements 



You MUST have:



• Extensive hands-on experience using SEMrush

• Proven experience working on e-commerce SEO

• Strong understanding of keyword strategy

• Strong understanding of competitor analysis

• Strong analytical ability



Preferred:



• Experience working with Shopify or Amazon businesses

• Experience working with product-based companies

• Experience in technical SEO



Important: Application Instructions



To apply, include:

 1. Your years of SEMrush experience

 2. Examples of SEMrush work you personally performed

 3. Example of how you used SEMrush to improve SEO results

 4. Screenshot of SEMrush dashboard you’ve used before



Applications without SEMrush experience will be ignored.



Compensation



This is a long-term position for the right candidate.



Pay will depend on experience and skill level.



We are willing to pay more for true experts.



Position Details



• Remote

• Flexible hours

• Long-term opportunity

• Work directly with ownership and management 



Thank you for applying!

title: AP & Bookkeeping Accountant
description:
PLEASE READ: If you would like to apply and learn more about the role, please use the link below.







----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Come join a dynamic, award-winning cloud technology consulting firm.



Are you detail-oriented, organized, and confident working with numbers? Do you enjoy keeping financial records accurate, clean, and reliable? If yes, we’d love to meet you.



We’re looking for a Junior Staff Accountant (AP & Bookkeeping) to support our finance operations and help keep our books accurate and up to date.



About itGenius:



itGenius is a global, remote-first Google Workspace Partner dedicated to “helping small businesses play a bigger game.” We provide high-level IT support and strategic consulting to thousands of businesses globally. We are a distributed team of 60+ professionals across Australia, the Philippines, and Europe.



Why You’ll Love Working With Us:



Competitive Compensation & Bonuses



December Bonus

Performance Incentive Bonus

Annual Salary Increases

Time Off That Matters



Paid Leaves

Paid Philippine Holidays

Team & Culture



Annual Team Conferences & Events (travel, food, and accommodation covered)

People-first, remote-friendly culture

Career Growth



Training & Development Budget

Clear Career Growth Pathways

Benefits



Government-Mandated Benefits / HMO

Reports To: Senior Accountant



Job Overview:



As an AP & Bookkeeping Accountant, you are the bedrock of our financial data integrity. You are a key player on our “high-performing sports team,” ensuring that every transaction is recorded accurately and our suppliers are paid on time, which is fundamental to being a Trusted partner. Your diligent work in bookkeeping and accounts payable creates a Seamless operational foundation, allowing us to build Scalable financial processes. You are Empowered to maintain the accuracy of our books, which is the first step in providing the business with reliable financial intelligence.



Accountabilities



- Accurate Transactional Recording: Accountable for the accurate and timely processing of all accounts payable transactions and the maintenance of pristine bookkeeping records, ensuring the reliability of the general ledger.



Key Responsibilities:



- Process supplier invoices, ensuring proper coding, approval, and matching to purchase orders.

- Prepare and execute weekly payment runs for multiple currencies.

- Perform daily bookkeeping and bank reconciliation tasks.

- Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements in daily bookkeeping and accounts payable tasks to increase efficiency.

- Respond to supplier inquiries regarding payments and invoices.

- Assist with month-end closing procedures, including posting journal entries and preparing account reconciliations.

- Maintain organized and compliant financial records.



Required Qualifications & Skills:

- Education: Graduate of Accountancy or Finance related course

- Experience: At least 2–3 years of experience in accounts payable, bookkeeping, or a similar accounting role

- Accounts Payable (AP): Process supplier invoices, including proper coding, approval, and matching to purchase orders.

- Bookkeeping/GL: Perform daily bookkeeping tasks and maintain pristine records to ensure the reliability of the general ledger.

- Payments: Prepare and execute weekly payment runs for multiple currencies.

- Reconciliation: Perform bank reconciliation tasks.

- Month-End Support: Assist with month-end closing, including posting journal entries and preparing account reconciliations.

- Accuracy: Maintain a high level of accuracy and diligently follow established procedures (Scalable & Trusted behaviors).

- Ownership: Take complete ownership of assigned tasks to ensure they are completed accurately and on time (Empowered behavior).

- Efficiency: Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and learn quickly (Ingenius behavior).

- Compliance: Maintain organized and compliant financial records.



It would be nice if you have:

- Experience with cloud-based accounting systems (Xero, QuickBooks, etc.)

- Experience working in a remote setup

- Knowledge of Google Workspace

- Basic understanding of multi-currency transactions



Work Schedule & Setup:

- Full-time, permanent

- 8-hour shift | Morning shift

- Monday to Friday (Weekends off)

- Philippine holidays observed

- Permanent Work From Home



You’ll Thrive Here If You’re Interested In:

- Cloud-based tools and modern ways of working

- Supporting small businesses (1–30 employees)

- Using technology to improve productivity and collaboration

title: AI Prompt Script Writer (YouTube Long-Form Content)
description:
We’re looking for a creative and analytical AI Prompt Script Writer who understands how successful AI-generated YouTube channels work and can reverse-engineer them into repeatable prompts. Your role will be to design custom prompts that automatically generate structured scripts with scenes for 15–20 minute AI long-form videos.





This is a prompt-engineering + storytelling role — not traditional copywriting.



You will be provided a Claude subscription to generate scripts and scene outputs.





What You’ll Do



Study and decode high-performing AI YouTube channels



Build custom prompts that consistently generate engaging stories



Use AI (Claude) to generate structured scripts with scenes



Ensure each script fits a 15–20 minute video format



Maintain narrative pacing, scene flow, and emotional engagement



Deliver 20 AI-generated scripts per week



Reference AI video that your prompt needs to generate:





Script Structure Requirements

Each script should include:



Story narration



Scene breakdowns



Visual cues for each scene



Consistent pacing suitable for long-form video



Requirements



Experience using AI writing tools (Claude, GPT, etc.)



Strong prompt engineering ability



Understanding of storytelling & pacing



Ability to analyze viral content patterns



Reliable weekly delivery



Nice to Have



Experience with faceless YouTube automation channels



Understanding of retention hooks & watch-time optimization



Familiarity with cinematic or documentary style writing



Compensation



$50 per week



Claude subscription provided



Ongoing work (long-term opportunity if consistent)



To Apply

Please include:



A short explanation of how you would design prompts to generate structured video scripts



Any examples of prompts or AI-assisted writing you’ve done



We’re looking for someone who can think like both a storyteller and a systems designer.

title: Order Management Lead - Remote Based
description:
APPLY HERE: 
/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pag8APoI3f6NCl7mv/form



Job Description



We're seeking a highly capable and proactive Operations Lead to join our dynamic team at HiEnd Accents. This role is critical in ensuring seamless order management and operational excellence across our organization. The ideal candidate will be a problem-solver with strong leadership skills and a track record of driving operational efficiency.



What You’ll Do



- Oversee and optimize the entire order management process, from intake to fulfillment, including:

• Bringing in customer orders from various sources (portals, EDI,
s, faxes)

• Confirming and making changes to orders in the ERP system

• Releasing orders/backorders for shipping and organizing for easy picking

• Creating delivery slips, invoicing shipped orders, and managing EDI documents

• Uploading shipping and invoicing information to customer portals

- Lead and mentor the Order Management team, driving accountability and ensuring KPIs and SLAs are consistently met or exceeded.

- Manage key accounts with complex requirements, ensuring high customer satisfaction through:

• Responding to inquiries with same-day service

• Handling payment issues and order-related problems

• Providing information on inventory availability and product inquiries

• Phone outreach

- Proactively identify and resolve operational issues, developing and implementing solutions to prevent recurrence.

- Drive continuous improvement by:

• Analyzing operational data to identify trends and opportunities

• Collaborating cross-functionally to implement strategic changes

• Contributing to special projects aimed at improving performance and scalability

- Spearhead process documentation (SOP) creation, encompassing both refinement of existing procedures and development of new ones.

- Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including customers, vendors, and internal teams.

- Maintain accurate documentation of all actions, conversations, and issues using designated tools (e.g., Front and Airtable).

- Communicate effectively with the Warehouse team for shipment alignment.

- Perform other duties as assigned.



Who You Are



- A seasoned professional with 5+ years of experience in operations management, preferably in e-commerce or retail

- An experienced team manager

- Bachelor's degree in Business, Operations Management, or a related field

- Must have recent night shift (PH time) experience and be willing to report to work during CST hours

- Proven track record of contributing to team success and driving operational excellence

- Expert in order management systems, EDI, and inventory management

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights

- Excellent problem-solving skills with a solutions-oriented mindset

- Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities

- Proficient in the MS Office suite, with advanced Excel skills

- Experience with ERP systems and process automation tools

- Experience with SAP is not a requirement, but definitely a plus



Why HiEnd Accents?



Our small size and fast-paced culture reward people who act and think like owners. If you're someone who has a growth mentality, strives for exceptionalism, is a committed professional, and a straight shooter, you'll fit in with our culture and go far with our company.



About HiEnd Accents



HiEnd Accents designs and creates everyday luxury bedding and linens, sheeting, decorative pillows, and other home textiles. Founded in 2005 and based in Dallas, Texas, our mission is to elevate our customers' lives via beautifully designed home textiles that deliver quality and value. Our customers love our exceptional designs that span a diverse range of styles and our commitment to offering everyday luxury at accessible prices. We proudly serve a broad clientele, including department stores, furniture stores, boutique hotels, interior designers, and retail customers. HiEnd Accents is based in Irving, Texas.  and

title: Digital Operations & Executive Virtual Assistant
description:
We are looking for a reliable and tech-savvy Digital Operations & Executive Virtual Assistant to help organize, set up, and manage digital systems for an online education and coaching business.



This role is ideal for a generalist VA who enjoys building systems, organizing content, and supporting day-to-day operations. You will help turn existing content and ideas into structured online programs, courses, and smooth client experiences.



This is a remote, Philippine daytime with overlap with U.S. business hours

     2. Course & Content Management

            - Set up online programs, classes, and memberships

     3. Scheduling & Client Coordination

            - Set up and manage booking links for calls, classes, and workshops

            - Send confirmations, reminders, and follow-ups

            - Coordinate Zoom links and session details



      4. CRM &
 Automation

            - Set up basic
 automations (welcome
s, reminders, onboarding
s)

            - Apply tags, segments, and simple workflows



      5. Social Media & Online Support

            - Assist with organizing and scheduling content

            - Repurpose existing content for online use

            - Maintain consistency across platforms (no heavy content creation required)



       6. General Admin & Executive Support

            - Turn raw notes, documents, and ideas into finished digital assets

            - Keep files and systems organized

            - Support ongoing tasks as the business grows



Qualifications

       - Experience with GoHighLevel (GHL) is a strong plus

       - Familiar with CRM systems,
 automations, and scheduling tools

       - Experience with online course platforms is an advantage

       - Organized, proactive, and comfortable learning new tools



If you believe you're a strong fit for this position, please respond with the following:



     1. A link to your resume in PDF format. 

              Your resume should include your contact details, a recent professional photo, and a summary of your work

To ensure you've read this message carefully, please include the word "Systems" in the subject line of your
.



 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Full-Time Virtual Assistant (40 hrs/week)
description:
ABOUT US:

We are a well-established e-commerce company with over 10 years of success in the baby products niche, specializing in party supplies. Our brand is powered by a growing team of high-achievers who value ownership, honesty, and continuous improvement. Many of our tea
mbers have been with us for years and grown into bigger roles. For instance, our manager started as a Virtual Assistant through OnlineJobs.ph nearly 5 years ago and has grown into her leadership role. We are committed to helping you succeed and invest in people who want to grow long-term, not just find “another online job.”



ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented, and self-driven Virtual Assistant who takes pride in high-quality work. You respond quickly without needing reminders, you research questions before asking, and you enjoy finding better ways to do things. You are comfortable working with autonomy, communicating in outstanding American English, and you see this role as a chance to learn, grow, and outperform your own previous best.



This role offers semi-flexible hours with weekly calls across time zones and day-to-day work done independently.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Support daily operations across e-commerce platforms (admin tasks, customer service, simple research, documentation).

- Manage and update spreadsheets, documents, and basic reports.

- Follow and improve existing SOPs, documenting what you learn as you go.

- Communicate clearly with the team in writing and on calls, sharing progress and asking smart questions when truly needed.

- Take ownership of assigned tasks and look for small ways to improve processes and results.



REQUIREMENTS:

- Fluency in American English: Exceptional written and verbal communication.

- Familiarity with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) and Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets).

- Analytical thinking: Comfortable with basic data, simple reports, and logical problem-solving.

- Highly organized: Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize.

- Self-motivated and autonomous: You set mini-deadlines, move work forward without reminders, and keep your commitments.

- Research-first mindset: You look for answers in SOPs, past messages, and search engines before asking the team.

- Eager to learn: You actively look for feedback, new tools, and better ways to work.



DESIRED SKILLS (preferred but not required):

- Familiarity with Amazon FBA or other e-commerce marketplaces.

- Experience using tools like Asana, Slack, or similar project-management/communication platforms.



BENEFITS:

- 100% remote work.

- Competitive salary with opportunities for performance-based increases up to twice per year.

- Internet bill coverage.

- Long-term growth opportunities in a stable, fast-moving company.

- Access to training resources and a supportive leadership team that wants you to succeed.



NOTE ABOUT USE OF AI:

We actively use and encourage AI tools in our day-to-day work, and we see them as a powerful way to work smarter. However, during the hiring process we ask that you complete all application questions and exercises yourself, without AI assistance. We genuinely want to get to know the real YOU, not a "perfectly polished, robotic answer" you. Don’t worry about sentence structure or grammar; what matters to us is the substance of your answers and the honesty behind them. If we believe AI has been used to generate your responses, your application will not be considered.



HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY):

- Use this
 subject line exactly: "I will not use AI"

- At the very top of your
 body, before anything else, write this sentence exactly: "Hello PRIMEPURE team, I pay attention to small details"

- In the rest of the
 body, in few short sentences, answer these two questions:



1. What would you want us to remember about you after reading 100 applications? 

2. What are your salary expectations for this position (per month in USD)?



Applications that do not follow these few simple instructions will sadly not be considered. If shortlisted, you’ll receive an
 from Anna with instructions on the next steps. Thank you for your time, and best of luck!

description:

mber. This role has the potential to grow into a higher-level administrative or executive support position over time.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Overview

We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented, and highly organized Executive Assistant to join our team on a part-time basis. This remote role directly supports the founder with a focus on data entry, organizational management, priority planning, and business development.



As a key member of a fast-growing company, you will manage critical workflows between our online stores, customers, and factory partners.

Hours: Part-time (20 hours per week).

Requirement: Candidates must not have a concurrent full-time job to ensure dedicated focus during our core operating hours.



Key Responsibilities

Business Development: Lead and follow up on new opportunities, summarizing details and defining next steps.

Inbox & Calendar Management: Triage
 inboxes, flag high-priority items, coordinate meetings, and optimize the founder's schedule.

Order Coordination: Collate customer orders into order sheets, cross-check processed orders against the factory, and manage the end-to-end flow from online stores to production.

System Maintenance: Update and maintain 
 boards and perform basic website updates (adding new sports/content).

Stakeholder Communication: Monitor timelines and proactively remind internal and external stakeholders of critical deadlines.

Design & Content: Perform light graphic design work and draft executive-level
 responses.





Required Skills & Experience

 correspondence.

Technical Proficiency: Strong Excel skills and experience with 
.

Design & Web: Proficiency in Canva; experience with Squarespace is highly beneficial.

Soft Skills: Exceptional attention to detail, proactive attitude, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.

Background: Previous experience supporting business development or executive leadership is preferred.

Self-Management: A self-starter who takes initiative and requires minimal oversight.



To Apply

Please submit your resume along with a Loom video introducing yourself. In the video, please highlight your experience with order management and your proficiency with 
 or similar project management tools. Candidates who submitted based on the instructions will be prioritized.

title: Sales Representative
description:
READ THE JOB DESCRIPTION CAREFULLY:

Please ensure that you thoroughly review the job description to understand the responsibilities and qualifications required for this role before applying.



To apply, please SUBMIT your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and qualifications.



Employment Type: Full-Time, Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM PST



Payroll: Php25,000 base + 5%–8% commission on closed deals



Role Overview:

We are seeking a motivated and results-driven Sales Representative who doesn’t just book appointments but actively drives sales and closes deals. The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, confident in presenting to clients, and capable of generating revenue by addressing client needs, closing deals, and identifying upsell opportunities.



Responsibilities:

- Conduct outreach to potential clients through cold calls,
s, and other communication methods.

- Deliver engaging and persuasive presentations to clients to close deals effectively.

- Identify and create upsell opportunities during client meetings and presentations.

- Collaborate with the sales team to ensure seamless handoff of prospects, follow-ups, and conversion strategies.

- Maintain a deep understanding of our offerings and tailor presentations to meet specific client needs.

- Showcase confidence and professionalism while presenting, whether over the phone, via video call, or in written correspondence.

- Work independently, learn quickly, and adapt to evolving tasks and priorities.

- Focus on generating revenue, not just scheduling meetings, by proactively closing deals and ensuring client satisfaction.



Requirements:

- Familiarity with GoHighLevel, its features, and how it can be used in sales and marketing processes.

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, in English.

- Proven experience in delivering presentations, closing deals, and upselling in a sales environment.

- Comfort and confidence in presenting to clients and prospects to drive sales.

- Proficiency in conducting online research and gathering relevant information to tailor presentations effectively.

- Familiarity with AI and ChatGPT technologies for enhanced communication (preferred).

- Self-driven and able to work autonomously with minimal guidance.

- Organized and detail-oriented, ensuring accurate and organized record-keeping.

- Ability to compile and synthesize information from various sources to create comprehensive prospect profiles.

- Quick learner with the ability to grasp industry-specific knowledge.

- Prior experience with lead generation, sales support, closing deals, or upselling is a strong plus.



Application Process:

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and how you will contribute to the success of our client’s sales efforts through effective presentations, deal closures, and upselling.

title: Senior Loan Processor
description:
About FINR Advisory

Watch our company video here: 



FINR Advisory is a boutique Finance and Real Estate Advisory firm providing mortgage broking and buyer’s advocacy services to property investors growing their portfolios, and to developers seeking their next development opportunity.



We are seeking an experienced Senior Loan Processor to join our growing team. In this role, you will work closely with our Finance Brokers and support team to manage loan applications from submission through to settlement, ensuring a high standard of accuracy, communication, and compliance.



**Please don't apply if you have less than 3 years of experience in the Australian Mortgage Industry**



The Role

• Reviewing client Fact find and supporting information to complete preliminary assessments. Assessments include lender policy research, borrowing capacity (serviceability) and funding position assessments.

• Completing lender serviceability, postcode and lender mortgage insurance calculators

• Liaising with Lenders and their Credit Assessors, Business Development Managers to discuss lending policy, loan scenarios and loan structuring.

• Assisting the Finance Broker to ensure that all compliance requirements are met

• Completing lender pricing approvals, client credit checks and ordering valuations

• Loan processing which includes data input into Aggregator CRM – Mercury and ApplyOnline, Lender document collection and packaging for submission

• Proactively managing client communication, including requesting additional documents and providing status updates

• Managing conditionally approved applications and responding to lender information requests

• Coordinating with key stakeholders including lenders, real estate agents, solicitors/conveyancers and accountants



About you

• Minimum 3 years experience in the Australian mortgage broking/banking industry as a credit assessor/analyst or loan processor

• Experience with the Connective Mercury Platform and ApplyOnline is desirable but not essential

• CERT IV in Finance and Mortgage broking is desirable but not essential (training and certification offered)

• High attention to detail and extremely organised

• Great at managing workload and prioritising tasks where necessary to meet deadlines.

• Excellent English comprehension and fluency with good attention to grammar and spelling 

• Can-do attitude with the ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment

• A collaborative mindset and willingness to support the wider team



Home office requirements:

• Reliable, high speed internet connection (10MB or greater)

• Secondary backup internet connection (hotspot or comparable)

• Reliable and up to date personal computer with minimum 8GB RA
mory capacity to run various programs and applications.



Compensation:

• Php 60,000.00 – Php 80,000.00 (Depending on experience and skill set).

• Rewarding Team bonus shared equally amongst all staff (local/offshore)

• 13th Month Pay

• Paid Philippine regular holidays

• Strong Career Growth opportunities

• 90-day probationary evaluation period



APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:

**Please follow the steps below carefully. Applications that do not meet the requirements will be automatically declined.**



To submit your application for the job, please complete all of the following steps and respond to the job add or send an
 to 
 with the subject line "I read the whole ad - (Your Name)"



To apply, please include ALL of the following:

1. Please create a 2-3 minute audio recording or video explaining why you would be a good fit for this position and why you are the best candidate. Please state the date and time of your recording in the video.

2. Perform an Internet speed test at 
/ by clicking the “start” button in the middle of their homepage. After completion of the test, take a screenshot of your results and
 it as a JPEG.

3. Include a link to your onlinejobs.ph profile and attach your CV.



The application process is designed to ensure you follow directions and pay attention to detail.



Looking forward to meeting you!

title: Experienced Real Estate Acquisition Sales Specialist
description:
Hourly + High Commission

We are hiring an experienced sales closer from the Philippines to join our U.S. real estate wholesaling company as an independent contractor.

If you are fluent in English, confident on the phone, and strong at negotiation, this is a high-income opportunity with weekly pay and unlimited commission potential.

________________________________________

** What You’ll Do

You will handle property acquisitions — speaking with homeowners, negotiating purchase prices below market value, and getting signed contracts.

Your main tasks:

•	Respond to inbound seller leads (PPC + website)

•	Qualify and negotiate with homeowners

•	Follow scripts and handle objections

•	Get signed agreements

•	Track all activity in our CRM

•	Make follow-up and cold calls when needed

Our team handles resale (disposition). You earn commission from the profit.

________________________________________

** Pay Structure

Training (First 2 Weeks)

•	$6/hour (paid training + Zoom sessions)

After Training

•	$8/hour base pay

•	PLUS commission based on deal profit

Commission Tiers (per month)

•	Deals 1–3 ? 20% of pure profit

•	Deals 4–6 ? 30%

•	Deals 7–9 ? 40%

•	Deals 10+ ? 50%

Pure profit = money remaining AFTER closing costs, fees, and expenses.

Example:

Deal profit $30,000

Expenses $20,000

Pure profit $10,000

20% commission = $2,000

* Hourly pay weekly

* Commission paid when deal funds are received

________________________________________

** Performance Expectations

•	Minimum 3 closed deals per month

•	Minimum $10,000 pure profit per deal

•	At least 10 work hours per week

•	Fast response to inbound leads

•	Cold calls only between 8am–7pm prospect local time

•	Typical commission payout timeline: 60–90 days after contract

________________________________________

* Requirements

•	5+ years sales experience

•	3+ years CRM experience

•	Excellent spoken and written English

•	Strong phone and negotiation skills

•	Familiar with real estate or home buying process

•	Reliable internet and professional setup

•	Able to follow scripts and coaching

________________________________________

* Schedule

Flexible hours, but must respond quickly to leads and attend required onboarding sessions.

________________________________________

** Growth

High performers earn higher commission tiers. No income cap.

________________________________________

** How to Apply

Send:

1.	Your sales experience

2.	CRM systems used

3.	Real estate experience (if any)

4.	Your weekly availability

5.	A voice recording (link only — no attachments)

6.	Subject line must include the word Closer

________________________________________

** Voice Recording (1–2 minutes)

Use Vocaroo, Google Drive, Dropbox, Loom, or similar.

Include:

•	Your name and location

•	Your sales background

•	Why you are a strong closer

•	A short pitch to a homeowner thinking about selling

Applications without a voice recording will not be reviewed.

________________________________________

Serious closers only. We are building a high-performance team.
