title: Real Estate Data Research VA
description:
Please review this job post completely before applying.



Job Title: Real Estate Research & Data Analyst (Virtual Assistant)

Type: Full-Time, Long-Term

Hours: 40 hrs/week (EST)

Location: Remote

Start Date: Immediate (within 7 days)



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based real estate investment company actively acquiring off-market properties. We are looking for a Data Research Specialist to support our acquisitions team by cleaning, organizing, and preparing property data.



This is not a cold calling, marketing, or underwriting role. You will be working with data only — following instructions to identify qualified leads, maintain clean records, and provide accurate updates inside our systems.



If you’re detail-oriented, comfortable with large datasets, and confident in Excel and CRM work, this is a great long-term role for you.



What You’ll Do



? Organize and clean property records inside our CRM (REISift)

? Review and filter property data based on criteria we provide

? Upload/download lists from sources such as Zillow, PropStream, PropWire, and MLS (Jacksonville, FL)

? Use Excel/Google Sheets to clean and format bulk data sets

? Convert property reports from PDF to Excel using Tabula

? Flag qualified leads for the acquisitions team according to instructions

? Maintain accurate, consistent records and prepare weekly summaries of work completed



Must-Have Skills



? 2+ years working in real estate data research, list management, or related role

? Strong working knowledge of Zillow, MLS, REISift, PropStream, and PropWire

? Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (downloading, uploading, cleaning datasets, using formulas)

? Experience with PDF-to-Excel conversion tools (Tabula or similar)

? Detail-oriented and consistent — accuracy in data cleaning is critical

? Reliable computer and high-speed internet setup for daily full-time work

? Good written English for reporting and notes



Bonus Points



? Experience supporting U.S. real estate investment teams

? Familiarity with skip tracing workflows

? CRM experience (REISift preferred)

? Ability to handle large data sets without errors



Why Work With Us



? Stable, long-term role with consistent hours

? Professional U.S. real estate investment team

? Clear systems and instructions to follow

? Opportunity to grow into higher-level roles as the company expands



How to Apply (Read Carefully)



We do not accept direct applications on OnlineJobs.ph.



Apply only using this link:


/1uMRkxneOR1Kn0C3UdI9_6A1avdy



Only applications submitted via the above form will be reviewed.

title: Job Description: Document Delivery & Notarization Task (Manila to Antipolo)
description:
We are seeking a reliable and efficient courier for a time-sensitive task. The job involves traveling from Manila to Antipolo within a 4- to 6-hour window to deliver important documents to a resident and then have one specific document notarized. All tasks must be completed within the timeframe.



Key Responsibilities:

 • Pick up documents in Manila.

 • Travel to a designated residence in Antipolo to deliver documents.

 • Ensure timely delivery, ensuring the recipient signs or receives them as required.

 • Visit a notary office in Antipolo to get one document notarized.

 • Return within the agreed timeframe.



Requirements:

 • Must have a valid driver’s license and access to a car or motorcycle.

 • Familiarity with Manila and Antipolo routes.

 • Reliable, punctual, and professional.

 • Able to handle sensitive documents with care.



Compensation: PHP 7,000 to PHP 10,000, depending on experience.



If you are organized, punctual, and able to handle this task efficiently, we’d love to hear from you!



Apply now with your details!

title: Family Law Paralegal
description:
We are currently seeking a motivated Paralegal to join our expanding team. In this role, you will work closely with lawyers and paralegals to collaborate with staff across the practice to provide essential support in all areas of Family Law.



Key Responsibilities:

• Assist senior lawyers in drafting and preparing legal documents, correspondence, and Court applications.

• Conduct legal research to support ongoing family law cases.

• Manage client files, ensuring all documents and information are up to date and organised.

• Liaise with clients, providing updates and gathering information as required.

• Attend meetings, and assist in the preparation for Mediation, hearings, and court proceedings.

• Provide administrative support, including managing calendars and scheduling appointments.



Key Requirements:

• Previous experience as a Family Law paralegal in AU (strongly preferred)

• Knowledge in using Smokeball (preferred but not required)

• Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

• High level of attention to detail and accuracy in work.

• Proficiency in legal research tools and Microsoft Office Suite.

• Ability to work independently in a WFH environment.

• A genuine interest in family law and a passion for providing client-centered support.



What We Offer:

• Flexibility to work from home with a supportive, online team.

title: Full-Time Social Media Video Editor
description:

You will work closely with our creative and marketing teams to turn raw footage into high-performing content, often on tight timelines.

title: Amazon Ads Manager (with Xnurta experience)
description:
Position Type: Full Time

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Schedule: Mon-Fri, UK business hours



About the Company



Our client is a growth-focused Amazon agency partnering with ambitious brands to scale profitably on Amazon. They combine strategic thinking, disciplined execution, and data-driven decision-making to deliver consistent results across Sponsored Ads, DSP, and full-funnel Amazon growth initiatives.



We are looking for an Amazon Ads Manager with hands-on Xnurta experience who can confidently own campaign execution, optimization, and performance reporting across multiple client accounts.



About the Role



The Amazon Ads Manager will be responsible for the end-to-end management of Amazon advertising accounts, leveraging Xnurta for automation, optimization, and insights. This role requires someone who knows their numbers, understands how automation complements strategy, and can clearly articulate performance and next steps to internal teams and clients.



Responsibilities



- Own daily, weekly, and monthly management of Amazon Ads accounts (Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, Sponsored Display)

- Build, optimize, and scale campaigns using Xnurta, including:

         - Rules-based optimizations

         - Keyword harvesting and search term mining

         - Bid and budget automation

         - Performance monitoring and alerts

- Translate high-level strategy into precise execution inside Amazon Ads and Xnurta

- Analyze performance data (ACOS, TACOS, ROAS, CVR, CPC, impression share) and make data-backed decisions

- Proactively identify scaling opportunities and efficiency improvements

- Conduct ongoing keyword research, ASIN targeting, and competitive analysis

- Monitor account health and performance consistency, including time-sensitive checks when needed

- Prepare clear performance summaries and insights for internal reviews and client-facing updates

- Collaborate cross-functionally with creative, listing optimization, and strategy teams

- Stay current on Amazon Ads updates, beta opportunities, and Xnurta feature enhancements



Competencies and Qualifications



Must-Have



- 3+ years of hands-on Amazon Ads management experience (agency experience strongly preferred)

- Direct, working experience with Xnurta (setup, optimization, and scaling)

- Proven track record managing multiple Amazon accounts simultaneously

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to connect performance metrics to business outcomes

- Comfortable working with automation tools while knowing when manual intervention is required

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and execution-driven

- Strong written and verbal communication skills (able to explain performance clearly and concisely)



Application Process



We understand that searching for a new job can be challenging, and we’re here to support you every step of the way. Our goal is to make the process as transparent and respectful as possible.



Typically, the interview process includes a Recruiter Interview, Client Interview, and Practical Test, but this may vary depending on the role. Throughout each stage, we’ll keep you informed and provide feedback as quickly as we can, ensuring you feel valued and supported throughout your journey with us.

title: GHL Systems Architect & Automation Specialist
description:
We are seeking a proactive GoHighLevel Specialist to architect and implement CRM setups across diverse industries.



While management will always be available answer questions and give direction, this is not a "hand-holding" role. You will be provided with a concept, specific requirements, and a goal; from there, you are expected to design the logic, build the workflows, and deliver a fully functional, turn-key system.



The ideal candidate turns a vision into a streamlined, systematized and automated reality while documenting the process to ensure every build is sustainable, scalable, and easy to manage.





--- Key Responsibilities ---



- End-to-End Build-outs: Design and implement complete GHL sub-account setups, including snapshots, complex triggers, custom fields, and multi-step workflows.



- System Architecture: Determine the most efficient way to structure pipelines, calendars, and automations to solve specific business problems.



- Asset Creation: Build high-converting funnels, websites, and
/SMS nurture sequences within the GHL ecosystem.



- Quality Assurance & Handoff: Walk management through the finished product, explaining the "how" and "why," and providing a clear overview of how to manage or adjust the system.



- SOP Documentation: Create detailed, step-by-step SOPs and video walkthroughs for every system built to ensure seamless internal training.



- Optimization: Proactively maintain and update existing systems to improve performance.





--- Technical Skills Required ---



- GHL Mastery: Expert-level knowledge of Workflows, Custom Fields/Values, Forms, and SaaS Mode.



- Logic & Logic Mapping: Ability to map out complex "If/Then" scenarios and independently troubleshoot automation bottlenecks.



- Copy & Design: Capability to draft professional
/SMS templates and clean, functional landing pages.



- Integrations: Proficiency with 
 and Webhooks to connect GHL with external tools.



- Bonus Skills: Experience with web development, graphic design, and using AI tools to generate written/visual content.





--- Organizational Standards (Non-Negotiable) ---



- Strict Naming Conventions: We require a highly organized build style. Workflows and forms should be organized in folders. Assets should use a corresponding alphanumeric system (e.g., Form "B7 - Test Form" is used by Workflow "B7 - Test Automation").



- Proactive Communication: If a requirement is unclear, you ask for clarification. If you see a more efficient way to build a solution, you suggest it. We want you to become a part of our team.





--- Why Join Us ---



- Growth Potential: We will consider salary increases based on performance and the quality of your builds.



- Creative Freedom: This is an ideal role for someone who genuinely loves the GHL platform and enjoys the challenge of building unique systems for different use cases.

title: Sales Development Representative/Client Success Coordinator
description:
Remote Sales Development Representative (SDR)

Full-Time | Remote | Fluent English Required



About Us

Apollo Performance Chiropractic & Training is a sports rehab and performance clinic helping athletes and active adults eliminate pain, rebuild resilience, and perform at a higher level.

We don’t provide quick fixes. We don’t operate as a volume-based clinic. We DO deliver world-class rehab through personalized treatment, expert guidance, and strong relationships.

We are growing quickly and looking for a high-energy, organized, confident communicator to join our team as a Sales Development Representative (SDR).



The Role

Your primary responsibility is to convert inbound leads into booked Discovery Visits. You are the first impression of our brand. Energy. Clarity. Confidence. Organization.



You will:

Speak with prospective patients by phone and text

Build rapport quickly

Identify objections

Confidently guide prospects toward booking

Manage our CRM and pipeline

Ensure no opportunity is lost



Key Responsibilities



1. Inbound Lead Conversion

Answer inbound calls

Respond to SMS and website inquiries

Book qualified prospects into Discovery Visits

Follow our structured phone call framework



2. Objection Handling

You will be trained in our structured objection framework (Agree ? Reframe ? Ask). You must confidently handle objections such as:

“That’s expensive.”

“Do you take insurance?”

“I need to ask my spouse.”

“I’ll think about it.”



3. CRM and Pipeline Management

Update GoHighLevel CRM daily

Move leads through appropriate pipeline stages

Track no-shows, reschedules, and follow-ups

Ensure zero leads fall through the cracks

Use ClickUp for task organization



4. Outbound Follow-Up

Call and text unbooked leads

Follow up after Discovery Visits

Execute structured re-engagement campaigns

Improve show rates



5. Performance Metrics

This is a performance-based role with clear KPIs. You will be graded using a structured Sales Rubric including:

Rapport building

Objection identification

Proper tone

Talk-time balance

Follow-up execution

Minimizing filler words

Conversion rate



Who This Is For

You are a great fit if:

You speak fluent, natural English (non-negotiable)

You have high energy on the phone

You build connection quickly

You are confident discussing money

You are extremely organized

You enjoy hitting measurable targets

You are coachable and open to feedback

You can manage multiple conversations at once

You want long-term stability with growth potential



Who This Is Not For

This is not for you if:

You avoid uncomfortable conversations

You dislike being measured on performance

You get nervous talking about money

You struggle with organization

You need constant supervision

You are looking for short-term freelance work



Training and Growth

We operate with a structured sales system including:

A defined First Phone Call framework

Objection handling methodology

Performance grading rubric

Weekly role-play and feedback

Continuous improvement culture



You will receive:

Script training

Role-play practice

Weekly performance reviews

Clear KPI tracking

Growth opportunities within the company



Compensation

Competitive base pay

Performance bonus tied to:

Booked appointments

Show rate

Conversion rate

Long-term growth opportunity



Schedule Requirements

40 hours per week

Must overlap with U.S. Eastern Time business hours

Reliable high-speed internet

Quiet, professional workspace



How to Apply

Please submit:

A short video (2–3 minutes) answering:



Why are you a strong fit for this role?

How do you handle someone who says “That’s too expensive”?

What CRM systems have you used?





A short paragraph explaining:

Your experience with appointment setting or sales





Include the phrase “MOVE THE CHAINS” in your application so we know you read this completely.

title: Video Editor
description:
Platform: YouTube

Content Focus: Christian apologetics, debates, religion, and cultural commentary

Schedule: Weekly



About the Channel

Big Jon Steel is a Christian YouTube channel with 39k subscribes and over 300k on multiple platforms we are built around live debates, apologetics, religious discussion, and cultural commentary. The content features long-form conversations with opposing viewpoints, designed to challenge ideas and spark real dialogue.

The editing style here is intentional and debate-driven — not flashy vlog work. Long-form videos are structured as narratives, cutting between live stream footage and direct-to-camera storytelling to turn raw conversations into something compelling and watchable. Shorts are standalone reaction content built for fast pacing and strong hooks.



The Role

We're looking for a reliable, skilled editor to deliver on a weekly basis: That can match this editing style 
 and 



1 long-form YouTube video (30–90 min final length, approximately 8–10 hours of editing)

2 YouTube Shorts (9:16 vertical, reaction-style content)



Total weekly commitment: roughly 10–12 hours.



What the Work Looks Like

Long-form editing:

Each video tells the story of a live stream conversation or debate. You'll receive a scripted breakdown that alternates between two formats:



Clips — actual stream footage of the best 
nts: high-conflict exchanges, funny beats, and decisive arguments

Storyteller segments — direct-to-camera or voiceover sections where the host summarizes what happened, explains his thinking, or transitions the narrative forward



Your job is to assemble these into a cohesive, fast-paced video that plays like a story with a beginning, middle, and end. That means:



Following the provided script to cut between clip footage and storyteller segments

Keeping pacing tight — no dead air, no filler, no redundancy between what the clips show and what the narration covers

Balancing and cleaning up audio across both formats (stream audio and studio audio will sound different)

Applying basic color correction

Adding minimal, effective on-screen text where it helps the viewer follow the discussion or argument

Exporting in the correct format for YouTube



Shorts (reaction content):



Edit green-screen and blind-react style reaction videos

Open with a strong hook

Clearly frame the argument or 
nt of tension

Match the existing Big Jon Steel Shorts style

Optimize for engagement and fast pacing



General expectations:



Communicate clearly and hit weekly deadlines

Handle reasonable revisions when needed





Required Skills



Proficiency in Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

Experience editing debate, talking-head, or podcast-style content

Strong sense of YouTube pacing and retention

Ability to identify standout debate 
nts worth clipping

Comfortable working through long-form, audio-heavy footage

Reliable communication and consistent delivery



Strongly Preferred



Familiarity with Christian apologetics, religious debates, or culture-war content

Experience editing clips meant to provoke discussion or response

Understanding of how Shorts function differently from long-form content

Willingness to follow an established style rather than reinvent it





Weekly Deliverables



1 fully edited, upload-ready long-form video

2 Shorts (9:16), reaction-style, matching current channel style

Clean exports and project files if requested

Revisions as needed, communicated clearly on both sides





Compensation

Open to per-video, weekly flat rate, or hourly arrangements. Please include your preferred rate when applying.



How to Apply

Send the following:



Links to relevant editing work — especially debate, podcast, or discussion content, we will only be responding to people with a portfolio containing videos you have edited

PLEASE
 PORTFOLIO TO: 

A brief summary of your experience with YouTube editing

The software you use

Your rate and availability





Why This Matters

This channel engages real conversations about faith, culture, and truth. The editing isn't just technical work — it directly shapes how arguments are understood, received, and shared.

title: Marketing & Automations Assistant (Metro Manila/BGC Office)
description:
# Marketing & AI Automations Manager

Metro Manila (BGC) | Hybrid | Full-Time



---

We are a fast-growing B2B company selling high-ticket wellness and medical equipment to clinics, med-spas, wellness centers, and healthcare operators across North America.



We are building a serious AI-powered growth engine.



This role is not traditional marketing. This is revenue infrastructure, automation, and systems architecture.



---



## Location & Work Setup



This role requires working from our Metro Manila office in Bonifacio Global City (BGC) as part of the position.



* Hybrid structure with in-office collaboration required

* Must be based in Metro Manila or able to reliably commute to BGC

* Direct collaboration with leadership and operations team



We are building an in-person execution culture for speed, alignment, and accountability.



---

* Paid media

* CRM automation

* AI workflows

* OpenClaw

* Sales enablement systems

* Revenue attribution dashboards



You will own the system from ad click to closed revenue.

---

  * Lead qualification

  * Automated follow-up

  * Appointment reminders

  * Re-engagement campaigns

  * Sales support automation



* Build advanced
, SMS, and CRM workflows



* Integrate AI tools directly into marketing and sales systems



* Create intelligent lead scoring systems



* Reduce manual operational workload by 50 percent or more



We are looking for someone who can deploy AI in live revenue environments, not someone experimenting.



---



### 3. Systems Architecture & Infrastructure



* Map the entire revenue engine from lead to close



* Build marketing and sales SOPs



* Create automated KPI dashboards



* Design scalable campaign testing frameworks



* Improve:



  * Lead-to-booking rate

  * Show-up rate

  * Close rate



* Integrate tools via API or automation platforms



You should think in systems, not tasks.



---



## Required Background



No formal experience required.



We are hiring for intelligence, work ethic, problem-solving ability, and hunger to grow.



You must:



* Be comfortable with technology

* Be highly organized

* Think logically and systematically

* Be willing to learn paid media, AI tools, and automation platforms

* Take ownership of results



We will provide structured training in:



* Media buying

* AI automation systems

* CRM architecture

* OpenClaw, Claude Code, 
 workflows

* Marketing analytics and KPIs



If you are coachable and driven, we will train you to become elite.



---



## Bonus Traits



* Deployed AI agents in live revenue environments

* Built automation systems for high-ticket B2B sales

* Experience in medical, wellness, or clinic markets

* Experience building outbound automation systems

* Understanding of attribution modeling



---



## KPIs



You will be measured on:



* Cost Per Lead

* Cost Per Booked Call

* Qualified Opportunity Rate

* Revenue Generated

* Automation efficiency improvements

* Reduction in manual operational time



---



## Compensation



* Competitive base salary

* Performance bonuses tied to revenue growth

* Potential long-term upside for high performers



---



## Who This Is NOT For



* General social media managers

* Entry-level marketers

* Candidates who need step-by-step direction



---



## Who This IS For



* Operators who think in systems

* AI power users who ship fast and optimize constantly



---



If you are excited about building a fully automated B2B growth engine powered by AI, apply with:

We are looking for someone who can build, optimize, and scale — not just manage.

title: US Senior TikTok Shop Affiliate Manager (Only experienced)
description:
[About the Role]

We are a premium K-Beauty brand specializing in professional aesthetic and anti-aging skincare (Wrinkle Tox 5D Shot). We are looking for a high-performing TikTok Shop Affiliate Outreach Manager to scale our US presence. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of identifying top-tier skincare influencers and driving significant revenue through strategic partnerships.



[Key Responsibilities]



- Massive Outreach & Discovery:** Identify and reach out to 2,000+ targeted skincare influencers per month.

- Precise Targeting:** Focus on influencers within the skincare/beauty niche who have generated over $5,000 in revenue in the last 30 days.

- End-to-End Communication:** Manage all communications via TikTok DM,
, and SNS. Craft personalized, high-converting invitation messages.

- Creative Guidance: Provide influencers with "Creative Hooks" and "Visual Guides" to ensure their content aligns with our premium aesthetic image and drives sales.

- Post Management: Monitor sample delivery, track upload status, and proactively encourage influencers to post high-quality content on time.

- Reporting: Maintain a daily/weekly tracker of outreach volume, response rates, and GMV performance.



[Qualifications]



- Experience:Minimum 1-2 years of direct experience in US TikTok Shop Affiliate management (Experience in the beauty/skincare industry is a huge plus).

- Full-Time Commitment: Ability to work 8 hours a day (aligned with US or KST time zone as discussed).

- Communication: Native-level written English with the ability to build rapport with influencers.

- Data-Driven: Proficient in TikTok analytics tools (e.g., KaloData, FastMoss, EchoTik).

- Proactive Attitude: A self-starter who doesn't just "send messages" but "closes deals" and drives revenue.



[Performance Bonus & Perks]



- Competitive base salary.

- Performance-based Incentives: Additional bonuses for reaching GMV targets and high-performing video uploads.

- Opportunity to lead our expansion into the Southeast Asian (SEA) TikTok Shops for top performers.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist — Remote
description:
About Us

We are a fast-growing international technology company operating a digital services platforms. Our team spans multiple continents and we hire globally across a wide range of functions — from frontline sales agents to senior operations and management. We move fast, we build systems, and we hold our people to a high standard.We're looking for an experienced Talent Acquisition Specialist to own our recruitment function end-to-end. This is not a coordinator role — this is a full ownership role for someone who thinks in funnels, operates with data, and knows how to balance speed with quality.



What You'll Own

High-Volume Hiring



Recruiting 20–30 remote sales agents per month, sourced globally across regions including Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe, the Caribbean, and Africa

Building and maintaining fast, efficient hiring funnels that can operate at scale without sacrificing quality

Continuously optimising top-of-funnel sourcing to keep cost-per-applicant low and pipeline full



Professional & Senior Hiring



Managing end-to-end recruitment for supervisors, operations managers, team leads, and specialist roles

Taking a slower, more deliberate approach for these hires — stakeholder consultation, structured evaluation, and careful assessment

Working closely with department heads to understand role requirements, team dynamics, and success profiles



Systems & Analytics



Full ownership of our ATS — keeping pipelines clean, stages accurate, and data reliable

Managing Calendly and interview scheduling across multiple time zones

Tracking and reporting on key metrics: cost per applicant, cost per hire, time to hire, offer acceptance rate, and funnel conversion at each stage

Identifying when a channel or funnel is underperforming and acting on it — testing new sources, adjusting spend, or rebuilding the funnel



Assessment & Evaluation



Collaborating with team leads and managers to design role-specific case studies, skills tests, and interview frameworks

Ensuring every hire — from entry-level to management — is evaluated against clear, consistent criteria

Building and maintaining a library of assessments that can be reused and iterated on over time



What We're Looking For



Proven experience in a recruitment or talent acquisition role within an international company — you must have hired across multiple countries and time zones

Demonstrated ability to run high-volume hiring funnels, not just fill individual roles

Strong analytical mindset — you understand recruitment as a funnel and you use data to make decisions

Hands-on experience with an ATS and scheduling tools (experience with tools like Notion, Airtable, Workable, Greenhouse, or similar is a plus)

Exceptional written and spoken English — you will be the first point of contact for candidates globally and will work directly with senior leadership

Self-directed and proactive — you don't wait to be told what's broken, you find it and fix it

High attention to detail and strong organisational skills across multiple simultaneous pipelines





What This Role Is Not

This is not an admin role. You will not be simply posting jobs and scheduling calls. You are expected to think strategically, own your metrics, build your own processes, and escalate only when necessary. If you need constant direction, this role is not for you.



Compensation & Terms



$900/month during probation period

$1,100/month upon successful confirmation

Paid bi-monthly: 15th and last working day of each month

Fully remote, Philippines-based candidates only

Monday to Friday, 8–10 hours per day

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
VIRTUAL ASSISTANT FOR U.S. EXECUTIVE and CATHOLIC MINISTER— PART-TIME, REMOTE

Location: Philippines preferred Hours: 10+ hours/week (flexible, async-friendly) Rate: $6-8/hour depending on experience Start Date: Immediate

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

This is not a typical VA role. We’re looking for someone smart, spiritual, resourceful, and genuinely cool — someone who takes initiative, has excellent taste, writes well, is knowledgeable about Catholicism, and can handle everything from tracking rental expenses to finding the most interesting new restaurants and hotels.

You'll be supporting a busy Bay Area former CEO, magazine publisher, and entrepreneur who is a Catholic lay minister and leader, spiritual director, landlord, and all-around high-functioning, kind human who simply needs a brilliant right hand.

If you love variety, are deeply organized, have great aesthetic sensibility, and happen to be Catholic — read on.

ABOUT THE ROLE: Work directly with one person across several areas of her life:

Finance & Tax Preparation

• Monthly expense tracking and reconciliation across two properties and business activities

• Categorize expenses accurately (understanding the difference between deductible repairs vs.

capital improvements, depreciation, etc.)

• Maintain organized records for annual tax preparation

• Update and maintain expense spreadsheets monthly — no surprises at tax time

Property Management Support

• Set up and manage Instagram account for a stylish, fashion-forward and well-known Palm Springs vacation rental

• Write engaging, personality-forward captions and content for the Palm Springs property

• Idea generation for marketing and press campaigns to drive fashion reputation and occupancy

Research & Personal Assistance

• Research and book chic, interesting hotels and travel experiences (you know the difference between a generic hotel and a place with a great story and design)

• Track new and notable restaurants, events, and experiences in the San Francisco Bay Area

• Source and find thoughtful, creative gifts for various occasions

Administrative Support

• Research Catholic topics and develop prayers for weekly lectures

• Design handouts, brochures and other collateral

• Calendar management and scheduling

• General administrative tasks as assigned

YOU ARE

• An exceptional writer — clear, warm, engaging. Grammar matters to you.

• Financially literate — understand basic accounting, expense categories and LOVE spreadsheets

• Culturally curious — you follow design, food, travel, and lifestyle trends genuinely

• Knowledgeable about Catholicism— this is a genuine role requirement, as some work supports

Catholic parish and national ministry

• Proactive — you don't wait to be told. You anticipate before she asks. You notice things, flag

issues, and bring solutions

• Tech-savvy — Google Suite, Canva, PowerPoint, Instagram, and basic project management and

design tools are second nature

• Detail-oriented — reconciling numbers and checking accuracy don't feel tedious to you; they

feel satisfying

• Discreet — you access personal and financial info and treat it with the utmost confidentiality

QUALIFICATIONS

• Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or Business required. Theology studies a major plus!

• 3+ years experience in finance, bookkeeping, or accounting role.

• Real estate or property management experience strongly preferred (rental property accounting,

capital improvements vs. repairs, depreciation)

• Understand the Catholic faith

• Passion for fashion and design

• Demonstrated experience managing Instagram accounts (please include handle or portfolio)

• Excellent written and spoken English

• Available for occasional real-time calls (Pacific Time) for check-ins

• Filipino nationals strongly encouraged to apply

WHY THIS ROLE IS GREAT

• Interesting, varied work — no two weeks are the same

• Flexible, async-friendly hours

• Work with someone who is kind, creative, organized, and respects your time

• Room to grow as the role expands

HOW TO APPLY

Please send to 

1. A brief introduction — who you are, why this role fits you (One short paragraph)

2. Your resume or CV

3. One writing sample (anything you’re proud of – doesn’t have to be long!)

4. Answer this question in 2-4 sentences: "What's the most interesting restaurant, hotel, or travel

experience you've discovered recently, and why did it stand out to you?"

5. Answer this question in 2-4 sentences: "Walk us through how you would categorize a $15,000

bathroom renovation on a rental property? How would you track it?"

6. Answer this question in 1-2 sentences: Who is your favorite Catholic Saint and why?

Applications without a writing sample and all three questions answered will not be reviewed.

title: Social Media Manager (SMM) Specialist – Long-Term, Personal Brand Focus
description:
Hey! I’m Draye.

I’ve been in the digital marketing industry for almost 2 decades, and I’ve worked with some big names you’d probably recognize—think Shark Tank sharks, top bestselling authors, and brands/entrepreneurs who take marketing seriously.

Now I’m looking for a solid, experienced SMM Specialist who can help me build my personal brand across multiple platforms—consistently, creatively, and with strategy (not random posting).

This is for someone who wants a long-term home and can focus on ONE main project (this one).



The Main Focus (First 3–6 Months)

For the first 3 to 6 months, your focus is 100% on MY PERSONAL BRAND across all platforms.

Once we’ve built a strong content engine, you may also start supporting my business pages (Redfern Media + Fractional CMO), but personal brand comes first.



Who This Is For

You’re a great fit if:

You have 3+ years experience as an SMM Specialist

You’ve worked in a digital marketing agency (required)

You can handle strategy + execution (not just posting)

You’re creative and can make content that doesn’t look “VA generic”

You’re confident editing videos for Reels, TikTok, Shorts, LinkedIn video, and YouTube

You know how to read analytics and actually improve performance



What You’ll Be Doing

1) Content Strategy + Planning

Build content pillars + weekly/monthly posting plan

Turn ideas into scroll-stopping posts

Repurpose content across platforms without it looking copy/paste

2) Posting + Engagement (Multi-Platform)

You’ll post and engage across:

Meta 
 + Instagram)

LinkedIn

YouTube

Google Business Profile

Other platforms as needed

Daily engagement includes comments, DMs, replies, community-building.

3) Creative Production (Design + Video)

• Design graphics/carousels (Canva + Adobe preferred)

• Video editing:

Short-form: Reels / TikTok / Shorts / LinkedIn video

Long-form: YouTube videos (basic clean edits, captions, pacing, etc.)

• Make content look premium and on-brand

4) Analytics + Reporting

• Weekly check-ins on performance

• Monthly report with:

What worked / what didn’t

Growth + engagement trends

Clear recommendations for next month



Important: This is NOT a “many clients” role

I’m looking for someone who can lock in on this project long-term and treat it like a real brand, not a side task.

If you’re juggling 3–5 clients already, this probably won’t work.



How to Apply

Apply here: 
/careers

Quick heads up—we shortlist fast. Just follow the simple instructions on the application page (it’s intentional). The people who follow directions usually end up being the best fit, and it helps us move you to the top ASAP.



If you’re the kind of person who can take ownership, create great content, and stay consistent long-term… I’m genuinely excited to start working with you.



Note: You’ll be working closely with me and my Chief of Staff who’s been with me for 6 years. This role isn’t just “do what you like” — you’ll also learn how we operate from people who are strong in leadership, process management, and marketing, and you’ll level up fast if you’re coachable.



Draye Redfern

title: Music Producer (Multi-Genre)
description:
I’m looking for an experienced music producer to recreate high-quality instrumentals for cover songs across various genres, including electronic and other simple, modern styles. The main goal is to faithfully reproduce the original production while achieving a polished, professional sound inside the DAW.



The producer should be comfortable creating electronic elements such as synths, programmed drums, and sound design, as well as producing guitar-driven, instrument-focused tracks when requested. The ability to make virtual instruments sound realistic and dynamic is important.



A solid understanding of basic mixing is also required to ensure the final instrumental sounds clean, balanced, and ready for vocal recording. Please include examples of similar instrumental recreations or cover work you’ve completed. This may lead to ongoing collaboration for the right fit.

title: Business Operations & Project Management VA (Full Time | PH Remote | US Hours)
description:
Business Operations & Project Management VA (Full Time | PH Remote | US Hours)



ROLE SNAPSHOT:



- Compensation: $1,000 USD/ month + benefits

- Experience: VA/ Ops/ Admin/ EA (1-3 years)

- Time Zone Alignment: 9am–5pm Pacific Standard Time (Los Angeles). Please only apply if this is sustainable for you.

- Reports To: COO

- Role Type: Full-Time, Remote



ABOUT THE COMPANY:



Assistynt is a virtual assistant and growth agency built specifically for established content creators who are ready to scale like a real business. We partner with 6-figure influencers, bloggers, and digital entrepreneurs to streamline operations, increase revenue, and free up their time so they can stay in their creative zone of genius.



Our team supports everything from content scheduling, LTK and affiliate management, and brand deal coordination to
 marketing, funnel builds, Pinterest strategy, digital product launches, and backend systems. We are deeply embedded in our clients’ businesses, acting as an extension of their team, not just a task-based VA service.



At our core, we help creators move from overwhelmed operator to confident CEO with the systems, strategy, and support to scale sustainably.



We operate a lean, fully remote, high-performance team with very high standards for client experience, operational excellence, and emotional maturity. We move quickly and expect total ownership in execution.



OUR CORE VALUES:



Competitive Greatness: We don’t just get things done, we do them at the highest standard. We pursue excellence through proactivity, innovation, and relentless progress.



Think Like an Owner: Every decision impacts the bottom line. Act like it’s your name on the P&L with pride, accountability, and long-term thinking.



Integrity: Do what’s right, even when it’s uncomfortable. Communicate honestly, take full responsibility, and lead with clarity.



Adaptability: Move fast, pivot with purpose, and figure it out. Stay resourceful, innovative, and steady under pressure.



Sincere Candor: Speak the truth with empathy and respect. Say what needs to be said, directly, kindly, and with the goal of growth.



Play: Great work feels good. When we’re aligned and energized, 
ntum builds — and the process becomes fun on purpose.



ROLE PURPOSE:



The Business Operations and Project Management Virtual Assistant exists to stabilize the business by ensuring day-to-day operational execution runs accurately, consistently, and without bottlenecks. This role is the execution backbone that keeps growth, fulfillment, logistics moving cleanly so nothing drops, breaks, or blocks 
ntum.



This role closes loops, protects standards, prevents small issues from becoming big problems, and ensures reliable follow-through across departments, especially with our clients.



HOW THIS ROLE SUCCEEDS:



- Executing operational tasks accurately and on time

- Preventing small issues from becoming large disruptions

- Maintaining clean systems, schedules, and SOPs

- Reducing friction for the executive team and department leads

- Being incredibly reliable, detail-driven, and proactive



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:



1. Growth Team Support



-
 campaigns scheduled in Flodesk

- Weekly newsletter uploaded and schedule

- Creation and organization of tags and automations in Flodesk

- Ensuring integrations across Flodesk, Zapier, and other softwares remain functional

- Landing page / ShowIt updates (Link swaps, etc.)

- Social media post scheduling

- Reach outs/ follow ups to book executive team on podcasts

- Calendar integrations (Calendly, Google Calendar)

- Maintaining evergreen digital resources (e.g. lead magnets)

- Executing assigned tasks inside Asana

- Offer creation with growth team



2. Operations & Admin Execution



- Execute day-to-day operational tasks across departments

- Maintain internal company calendars (launches, events, fulfillment)

- Ensure meetings and events are properly scheduled w/ correct links

- Manage executive calendar logistics (no double-bookings, correct links, etc)

- Maintain clean payment records across Stripe



3. Fulfillment Support



- Schedule client calls and tea
etings

- Ensure recordings are placed in Asana and posting meeting items are assigned out

- Make client decks on Canva as needed

- Fill in client KPI scorecards and provide analysis for team to review with clients

- When needed, assist in responding to client inquiries and sending proposals

- Offboarding clients as needed

- Schedule posts in Later or creating 
 workflows

- Schedule client posts in Meta and Like to Know It as needed

- Create DM automations with Manychat and LinkDM as needed

- Manage content creation flow with editors



4. KPIs, Reporting & SOPs



- Collect and compile weekly KPIs across departments

- Submit reports to leadership on time

- Maintain and update SOPs across departments

- Ensure correct versions are accessible in Asana

- Flag outdated, unclear, or missing processes

- Assist in documenting new systems as they are built

- Maintain clean internal knowledge and resource organization



5. Participation In Assistynt efforts



- Take courses as assigned during onboarding

- Watch Assistynt YouTube videos



TOOLS YOU’LL USE REGULARLY:



Experience in these tools is a strong advantage (training provided for the right candidate):



- GoHighLevel

- Asana

- Zapier

- Slack

- Zoom

- Google Suite

- Loom

- Stripe

- Typeform

- Flodesk

- ManyChat

LinkDM

- Google Sheets / Docs

- Drive



You don’t need mastery in all, but you must be tech-comfortable and fast to learn new systems and tools, especially Asana.



Training will be provided for all tools and responsibilities.



SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:



Must-Have:



- 1-3+ years in operations, admin, exec assistant, or similar role

- Fluent in English language

- Demonstrated ability to manage calendars and logistics

- High attention to detail and accuracy

- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English language

- Tech-comfortable (you can learn new platforms quickly)

- Reliable with fast follow-through and status updates

- Able to work independently in a remote environment



Nice-to-Have:



- Experience previous business operations or project management role

- Experience in set up of marketing funnels

- Experience in digital course, coaching, or online education environments or content creator environments

- Experience with payment processing or revenue ops

- Experience with customer support

- Experience with Asana, Flodesk, GoHighLevel, Stripe

- Experience supporting online brands and influencers



TRAITS & BEHAVIORS THAT MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL HERE:



- Total ownership of deadlines and results

- Self motivator and able to work efficiently and independently

- Proactive problem prevention

- Calm, steady, and organized under moving priorities

- Direct, clear communicator

- Forward thinking. Does not wait until the last minute to complete tasks.

- Detail-oriented (catches the missing link before anyone clicks it)

- Coachable and fast-learning

- Takes pride in accuracy

- Asks for clarity before something breaks

- Closes loops without being chased

- Loves making things cleaner, simpler, and more efficient

- Suggests ways to improve systems instead of just following systems

- Willing to make mistakes and learn from them



WORKING ENVIRONMENT & EXPECTATIONS:



- Remote team, ongoing slack communication, semi-regular meetings

- Daily Slack check-ins

- Must be available for internal meetings when scheduled

- Occasional evening/weekend flexibility during launches (with advance notice)

- High standards, fast-moving environment

- High speed, reliable internet connection (20mbps or higher)

- Backup internet or data hotspot

- Webcam/ microphone for zoom needed

- Computer in working order with no issues (8GB RAM minimum preferred)

- Willing to work during US Pacific Time Hours (9am-5pm)



OWNERSHIP & AUTHORITY:



You Own (Primary Responsibilities):



- Day-to-day operational assistant execution

- Cross-department task follow-through

- Scheduling accuracy & calendar logistics

- KPI collection & reporting

- SOP maintenance & documentation

- Event & fulfillment logistics execution



You Support (But Do Not Own):



- Growth strategy and marketing campaigns

- Student success strategy

- Offer creation and product design



You Escalate When:



- A task or deadline is at risk

- Systems or automations break

- Patterns of issues appear

- Information is missing or unclear



COMPENSATION & START:



- Compensation: $1,000 USD per month via PayPal once per month, converted to PHP at prevailing exchange rate



- Additional Compensation: 13th month pay after 6 months of continuous full-time employment (prorated), paid in December. For example, if you start in February 2026, you would be eligible for 11/12th of 1 month salary paid in December 2026. In 2027, you would be eligible for the full 12 months.



- Hours: ~40 Hours/ Week



- Start Date: Ideally within 1-2 weeks of offer or sooner



- Holidays/ Paid Time Off: PH Public Holidays Off (paid), 1 Paid Birthday Leave Day (paid), 5 Sick Days Per Calendar Year (Non-cumulative, paid, no doctor’s note required), 5 Paid Vacation Days (2+ weeks advance notice, paid. Not eligible in November.)



HOW TO APPLY:



1.) Do NOT click apply on Online Jobs

2.) Please apply via
 to 

3.) Please include the following in the same
:



- Send resume to 
 your resume file as “Firstname_Lastname_Resume.pdf” and please start your
 with “Dear Dani,”



- Include a short Loom video (under 5 minutes) answering:

--- Why are you interested in this role?

--- What tools have you used in past ops/ project management VA roles?

--- What was the last book or podcast you listened to?

--- Tell us about you (do you have a family/ kids/ what are your hobbies)

--- At the end of your loom video, say the phrase “I have very strong attention to detail.” so we know you completed the instructions



- Attach examples of your work (if you have them). Examples include (but are not limited to): screenshots or SOPs you’ve written, sample Google Sheet dashboards you’ve created, ClickUp/Asana project screenshots



- Use this exact subject line “Business Operations Assistant Application - YOUR NAME - 2026”



The reason for all of these items is to filter out candidates without strong attention to detail. Incomplete applications or applications that do not follow all instructions will not be considered.



We look forward to reviewing your application. Thank you for your interest in working for Assistynt LLC and helping us make an impact!

title: Business Development & Customer Success Associate
description:
As a Business Development & Customer Success Associate, you’ll serve as the voice of a growing floral and gifting brand to both potential and existing clients. Your primary focus will be outbound calling to businesses to generate leads, build relationships, and uncover new opportunities. You’ll also play an important role in refining messaging, supporting customer service, and coordinating with internal operations teams to ensure a smooth client experience.



Key Responsibilities:

Lead Generation & Relationship Building

-Conduct outbound calls to businesses to introduce the company’s offerings and generate qualified leads.

-Build rapport with potential clients, understand their needs, and identify opportunities for collaboration.

-Document key insights from calls, including contact details, interest level, and next steps.





Sales Intelligence & Process Mapping

-When a lead doesn’t convert, dig deeper to understand the prospect’s buying process, decision-makers, and timing.

-Share findings with the team to improve targeting and messaging strategies.





Team Communication & Messaging Optimization

-Write clear, concise call notes and summaries to share with the team.

-Provide feedback on what messaging resonates and suggest improvements.

-Be available for ad hoc calls or huddles to pivot strategy based on real-time insights.





Customer Service & Operational Support

-Respond to customer inquiries via
 with professionalism and empathy.

-Coordinate with the florist and warehouse teams to ensure timely fulfillment of customer requests or issue resolution.





What We’re Looking For:

-Excellent verbal communication and active listening skills.

-Comfortable making cold calls and navigating gatekeepers.

-Strong writing skills for internal documentation and customer communication.

-Proactive, curious, and adaptable — you’re not afraid to ask questions or change course.

-Team player who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

-Bonus: Experience with ShipStation, Shopify, Etsy or customer support platforms. / Experience in the floral business

title: YouTube Video Editor (Real Estate Niche)
description:
**WE ARE NOT WORKING WITH AGENCIES**



**PLEASE SEND PROOF OF VIDEOS MADE (Preferably your top 3 videos edited). ANY APPLICATION WITHOUT PROOF WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY THROWN OUT**



** We've received hundreds of applicants over our past few listings, so if you have applied and we haven't gotten back to you yet, please be patient as we are still in the process of scanning through everyone. **



We are two Filipino Entrepreneurs looking for additional creative video editors for our YouTube Media Marketing Company (Real Estate Niche). The culture that we've built within our team is like a family. We are all Filipino and can understand Tagalog and Bisaya but prefer English. 



Currently, we have an expert media department that has been with us long term. We're starting to gain 
ntum as a company and get new clients at a fast rate, so right now we're hiring both contractors (Per Job Basis) and Potential full-time editors to add to our amazing media team. 



The salary stated in the application is only STARTING SALARY. You have the potential to make as much as you want if you can provide great value.



Our company's name is WG Media, and our website is 
dia



In one year's time, we managed to get 600k+ Video views, and 4,000 subscribers with hundreds of videos on our personal channel and now we are producing results for our other real estate clients.



On your application, please state what makes you stand out from everybody else. We've scanned through hundreds of applicants and those that we've hired so far didn't just copy and paste their applications. Stand out from the crowd by providing something unique about yourself :)



You will be required to edit 3 - 5 videos every week, including thumbnails. Our Head of media will provide you with video templates to make things easier. You will need to cut both audio and video while adding b-roll content.



You must be proficient in Video Editing & Photoshop.



WE ARE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE LONG TERM (AT LEAST 1-5 YEARS ), So if you are looking for stability and a place where you can work and truly build a career, then this is the place for you. On top of editing videos/photos, we are very into self-development, so you will be required to read one book a month. We give a PDF of this book so you can read it along with the rest of the team.



Also, you will be required to attend 1-2 meetings a week via
 where you will also meet the rest of the team (who are also located in the Philippines)



We need you to have experience editing videos for this position and WOULD LIKE TO SEE PROOF OF VIDEOS THAT YOU'VE ALREADY MADE. We have MASSIVE goals for our company and have been doing YouTube for many years, so if you have YouTube experience then please state that in the description. If you have experience doing YOUTUBE VIDEO EDITING, we will prioritize your application over every else's.



We're looking for somebody who is teachable and can work very fast, so if you are a quick learner and can perform the tasks that we ask, you will be compensated very well. What are you waiting for? APPLY NOW because interviews get booked and we hire FAST (Usually within 2-4 days) There is HUGE upside potential. Again,The salary stated in the application is only STARTING SALARY. You have the potential to make as much as you want if you can provide great value.

title: YouTube Video/Thumbnail Editor [One Spot Left]
description:
We are two Filipino Entrepreneurs looking for a creative video editor for our YouTube Media Marketing Company (Real Estate Niche). The culture that we've built within our team can not be found anywhere else and it's kind of like a family. We are all Filipino and can understand Tagalog and Bisaya but prefer English. 



*WE ARE NOT HIRING AGENCIES*



Our company's name is WG Media, and our website is 
dia 



In one year's time, we managed to get 600k+ Video views, and 4,000 subscribers with hundreds of videos on our personal channel. 



On your application, please state what makes you stand out from everybody else. We've scanned through hundreds of applicants and those that we've hired so far didn't just copy and paste their applications. Stand out from the crowd by providing something unique about yourself :)



*PLEASE SEND PROOF OF VIDEOS MADE. ANY APPLICATION WITHOUT PROOF WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY DISMISSED*



You will be required to edit 3 - 5 videos every week, including thumbnails. Our Head of media will provide you with video templates to make things easier. You will need to cut both audio and video while adding b-roll content.



You must be proficient in Video Editing & Photoshop. 



WE ARE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE LONG TERM (AT LEAST 1-5 YEARS ), So if you are looking for stability and a place where you can work and truly build a career, then this is the place for you. On top of editing videos/photos, we are very into self-development, so you will be required to read one book a month. We give a PDF of this book so you can read it along with the rest of the team. 



Also, you will be required to attend 1-2 meetings a week via
 where you will also meet the rest of the team (who are also located in the Philippines)



We need you to have experience editing videos for this position and WOULD LIKE TO SEE PROOF OF VIDEOS THAT YOU'VE ALREADY MADE. We have MASSIVE goals for our company and have been doing YouTube for many years, so if you have YouTube experience then please state that in the description. If you have experience doing YOUTUBE VIDEO EDITING, we will prioritize your application over every else's.



We're looking for somebody who is teachable and can work very fast, so if you are a quick learner and can perform the tasks that we ask, you will be compensated very well. What are you waiting for? APPLY NOW because interviews get booked and we hire FAST (Usually within 2-4 days) There is HUGE upside potential. The salary stated in the application is only STARTING SALARY. You have the potential to make as much as you want if you can provide great value.



IF YOU CAN'T DO A
 VIDEO INTERVIEW THEN DO NOT APPLY, WE HAVE GOTTEN MANY APPLICANTS AND ARE VERY PICKY WITH WHO WE WILL HIRE SO PLEASE BE READY.

title: Canva Workbook Designer (Virtual Assistant – Remote)
description:
Job Type: Contract / Part-Time (Ongoing Opportunity)



About Us

We are a workforce development and technical training company that creates hands-on learning programs for technicians, trades professionals, and industrial teams. Our training materials are used in classroom, corporate, and online learning environments and focus on practical, real-world skill development.



We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant with strong Canva design skills to help convert raw instructional content into professional, branded student workbooks.



This is an ongoing opportunity for the right person as our course library continues to grow.



Responsibilities



Convert raw course content (Word documents, outlines, notes, and worksheets) into clean, professional workbook layouts using Canva



Apply existing brand guidelines including fonts, colors, spacing, and visual standards



Format content for clarity, readability, and consistent presentation



Create and maintain consistent page layouts for lesson summaries, worksheets and exercises, lab instructions, reflection pages, checklists, and reference materials



Prepare files for both print and digital distribution



Make revisions based on feedback



Maintain organized file naming and version control



Requirements



Strong experience using Canva for document layout and design



Excellent attention to detail and formatting consistency



Ability to follow templates and brand guidelines precisely



Strong English reading comprehension



Ability to work independently and meet deadlines



Good communication and organizational skills



Preferred (Not Required)



Experience designing workbooks, manuals, or educational materials



Experience with training or e-learning content



Basic understanding of print layout and margins



What Success Looks Like



Raw instructional content is transformed into clear, professional workbooks



Consistent branding across all materials



Clean, easy-to-follow layouts that improve the learner experience



How to Apply

Please include:



A brief introduction and summary of relevant experience



Examples of Canva work or workbook-style layouts you have created



Your hourly rate



Your weekly availability



We are looking to build a long-term working relationship with someone who takes pride in producing high-quality work.

title: Executive Personal Assistant to the CEO
description:
Executive Personal Assistant to CEO (Remote – Philippines)



Overview



We are seeking an exceptional, highly organized Executive Personal Assistant to support a U.S.-based CEO. This is a full-time, fully remote role for an experienced professional who has previously supported U.S.-based CEOs or senior executives and understands the pace, expectations, and discretion required at this level.



This role is mission-critical. Your primary responsibility is to ensure the CEO operates efficiently, stays on top of priorities, and executes responsibilities in a timely, organized manner.



Key Responsibilities



Executive Support & Organization

-  Attend all CEO meetings (approximately 8–10 meetings per day, 30–60 minutes each)

-  Take clear, structured meeting notes with action items and deadlines

-  Maintain and actively manage the CEO’s daily and long-term to-do lists

-  Proactively track follow-ups, deadlines, and commitments

-  Ensure tasks are completed on time by holding the CEO accountable to priorities



Communication & Coordination

-  Draft, send, and manage professional
 communications on behalf of the CEO

-  Coordinate schedules, meetings, and priorities across internal and external stakeholders

-  Act as a reliable point of contact during business hours



Daily Planning & Accountability

-  Conduct a daily end-of-day review with the CEO to:

-  Recap completed tasks and outstanding items

-  Align on priorities for the following day

-  Clarify responsibilities for both parties



Technology & Tools

-  Navigate Zoo
etings all day with ease

-  Use productivity tools (Google Workspace, HubSpot, task managers, calendars, Slack, etc.)

-  Leverage Ai tools to streamline tasks, summarize information, and improve efficiency

-  Adapt quickly to new software and workflows



Required Qualifications

-  Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or Personal Assistant to a U.S.-based CEO or senior executive

-  Accent-neutral English with excellent written and verbal communication skills

-  Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail

-  Strong judgment, discretion, and professionalism

-  Ability to manage a fast-paced schedule with frequent meetings

-  Highly proactive — anticipates needs rather than reacting to them



Work Schedule & Availability

-  Fully remote (Philippines-based)

-  Must be available and reachable at all times during:

-  8:30 AM – 4:30 PM Pacific Standard Time (PST)

-  This is a full-time role only - No secondary jobs or freelance work permitted



Technical & Infrastructure Requirements

-  Reliable, high-speed internet connection (non-negotiable)

-  Reliable phone and backup connectivity options

-  Quiet, professional remote work environment

-  Ability to stay consistently connected during working hours without interruptions



What Success Looks Like

-  The CEO is consistently prepared, organized, and focused

-  Tasks and commitments are completed on time

-  Meetings are documented clearly with actionable follow-ups

-  The CEO’s workload feels structured, prioritized, and manageable

title: Video Editor (Remote)
description:
Video Editor (Remote) | U.S. Family Law Brand



Are you creative, detail oriented, and serious about storytelling that actually moves people to act? We are hiring a Full Time Video Editor to turn raw attorney/education footage into polished, on brand videos that inform, inspire, and convert. This is a production role with clear output targets. If you need hand holding, this isn’t for you.



Job Description:

You will own the end to end video pipeline, from assembling rough cuts to publishing on YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, and our website. You will deliver clean edits, strong pacing, crisp captions, and optimized thumbnails, all while following brand and legal compliance guidelines for a family law practice. Your work will be measured, not guessed: output, quality, and audience growth.



Key Responsibilities:

• Produce attorney/educational videos for YouTube and short form for Reels/TikTok/Shorts.

• Add captions, lower thirds (attorney name/title), thumbnails, and CTA end cards.

• Export in multiple aspect ratios: 16:9, 9:16, 1:1.

• Upload and optimize across platforms (metadata, chapters, tags, end screens, cards).

• Apply YouTube SEO best practices (titles, descriptions, chapters, tags, schema).

• Maintain structured project folders in Google Drive (or other tools) with naming conventions and backups.

• Manage versions and handoffs so anyone can find what they need in under a minute.

• Track performance (watch time, retention, CTR, follower growth) and propose improvements.

• Coordinate schedules with attorneys and freelance videographers; hit deadlines without delays.

• Ensure legal disclaimers and confidentiality standards are applied consistently.



Performance Expectations:

1. Output

 • 4–6 long form attorney/educational videos per month.

 • 30–40 short form reels/TikToks per month.

 • 5–10 static assets (thumbnails, carousels) per month.



2. Quality & Branding

 • 100% of videos include captions, lower thirds, CTA end cards, and required aspect ratios.

 • 95% brand consistency (logo, fonts, colors, tone).

 • 100% required legal disclaimers included; captions properly timed and readable.



3. Engagement & Reach (within 6–12 months)

 • +15–20% average video watch time

 • +10–15% social engagement (likes, comments, shares)

 • +5–8% YouTube CTR via improved thumbnails/titles

 • +20% growth in YouTube subscribers or TikTok/Instagram followers



4. Collaboration & Efficiency

 •  95% of content delivered on schedule per content calendar.

 • 80–90% of attorney filming sessions successfully coordinated with videographers.

 • 100% of final edits reviewed and approved within 72 hrs of draft delivery.



Qualifications:

 • Strong editing skills in Adobe Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve (After Effects or Motion a plus).

 • At least 2+ years of experience editing for YouTube and/or social media platforms.

 • Sharp sense of pacing, structure, and audience retention (hooks, pattern breaks, CTA placement).

 • Excellent organization: you respect file structures, version control, and deadlines.

 • Professionalism and discretion with sensitive family law topics.

 • Proficiency with Google Workspace and project tools (Asana, Trello, or similar).

 • Bonus: YouTube SEO, GA4/analytics, or content marketing experience.



Work Schedule:

 • Full time (40 hours per week).

 • Must be available to work during U.S. Eastern Standard Time (EST) business hours for team coordination.



Screening Questions (answer all to be considered)

1. Do you have at least 2 years of video editing experience? Briefly describe the project types and your role.

2. Have you created content for YouTube, Instagram Reels, TikTok, or Shorts? Share links and note what you owned (edit, captions, thumbnail, etc.).

3. What editing software do you primarily use, and what’s your level of expertise?

4. How do you manage file organization and version control across multiple concurrent projects?

5. Link your reel/portfolio that best demonstrates storytelling, pacing, and results (watch time, CTR, or growth if available).



----------------------------------------------

How to Apply

 • Submit your resume, cover letter, and answers to all screening questions directly.

 • Use the subject line: “Video Editor – [Your Name] – Empower.”

 • Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.



If you can deliver consistent, on brand edits, move fast without sacrificing accuracy, and back your creative choices with data, we want to see your work!

title: Experienced Customer Service Specialist (Dropshipping)
description:
We are a fast-growing e-commerce brand selling high-demand supplement and beauty products to the United States market. We drive traffic primarily through
 Ads and operate on a dropshipping model with fulfillment from China.



We are looking for a savvy, "A-player" Customer Service Representative who understands the reality of dropshipping and knows how to keep customers happy even when shipping takes time. You are not just answering
s; you are the front line of defense against chargebacks and the voice of our brand.



We need someone with high initiative who can de-escalate angry customers and manage expectations professionally.



Key Responsibilities

* Ticket Management: Respond to all customer inquiries within 24 hours. You must clear the queue daily during your shift.

* Order Tracking Support: Proactively handle "Where is my order?" (WISMO) inquiries. Since we ship from China with limited tracking updates, you must be skilled at reassuring customers and explaining shipping timelines (2-4 weeks) without causing alarm.

* Chargeback Prevention: Identify at-risk customers and resolve their issues before they file a dispute. You will be responsible for keeping our chargeback rate low by offering creative solutions (refunds, reshipments, or appeasements) based on our SOPs.

* Issue Resolution: Troubleshoot delivery issues and product questions for US-based customers with perfect English grammar and tone.



What We Are Looking For

* Dropshipping Experience is a MUST: You must have proven experience working with dropshipping stores (Shopify). You understand the logistics of shipping from China to the US.

* Chargeback Savvy: You understand what a dispute/chargeback is and have strategies to prevent them.

* Communication Skills: Native-level written English. You must be able to sound empathetic, professional, and firm when necessary.

* High Initiative: We do not want to micromanage you. If you see a problem (e.g., a tracking number isn't updating for 10 days), you investigate it before the customer complains.

* Tech Savvy: Comfortable using Shopify and Google Workspace, USPS and ParcelWill software 

Work Schedule & Compensation

* Pay: Up to $5 USD per hour (paid bi-weekly or monthly via) 

* Hours: 4 hours per day (20 hours per week).

* Flexibility: While the hours are flexible, you must ensure all tickets are responded to within the 24-hour service level agreement (SLA).



How to Apply Please apply with the subject line "Dropshipping CS Expert - [Your Name]" and include:

1. A brief summary of your experience with dropshipping stores.

2. Your expected start date (we are looking to hire immediately!).

title: Tech & Automations Specialist - Data Integrity, CRM Ops & Zapier Expert
description:
We are a fast-growing online coaching company looking for an experienced Tech & Automations Specialist to help us maintain clean data, build reliable automations, and improve system performance across our entire operations stack.



You will take ownership of our backend technical systems and ensure all platforms communicate accurately and consistently. Your work will directly support sales, marketing, and operations by maintaining data integrity and creating clean, stable automation workflows.



Core Responsibilities

Ensure data in:

• Go High Level

• Close.io

• Calendly

•
 Ads

• Zapier workflows

…remains consistent, accurate, and up to date.



Tasks may include:

• Mapping new fields

• Ensuring tags populate correctly

• Preventing data duplication

• Creating systems to validate and clean data regularly



Automation Building & Maintenance (Zapier Expert)



Design and maintain high-quality, modular Zapier automations, including:

• Multi-step logic with filters, paths, and error handling

• Clean, scalable workflows that are easy to maintain

• API/webhook integrations where needed

• Logging, fallback conditions, and versioning best practices



Everything must be clean, organized, and documented.



CRM Workflow Setup (Close.io + GHL)



Implement workflows and automations inside each CRM, such as:

• Automated follow-up
s with custom variables

• Smart sequencing and task creation

• Lead routing logic

• Pipeline stage automation

• Updating records based on events or triggers



Support for New Marketing Campaigns



As we launch new campaigns 
, Instagram, lead magnets, etc.), you will:

• Build the tracking + automation logic

• Update CRMs with new fields, tags, and workflows

• Ensure attribution data flows correctly

• Set up testing environments before launch



This is ongoing, fast-paced work.



Troubleshooting & Problem Solving



Identify issues before they cause problems:

• Fix broken automations

• Repair inconsistent data

• Solve integration errors

• Optimize workflows for speed + reliability



We want someone who proactively improves systems, not someone who waits for things to break.



Required Skills



You must have strong, demonstrated experience in:



Tools

• Zapier (expert) — advanced logic paths, clean structuring, error handling

• Go High Level — workflows, triggers, custom fields, pipelines

• Close.io — custom variables, sequences, automation, lead routing

• Calendly — event routing & data mapping

•
 Ads — campaign naming conventions, tracking setup



Core Competencies

• Excellent understanding of data architecture

• Strong documentation and process building

• Ability to follow (and improve) naming conventions and standards

• Clear communication

• Fast debugging and troubleshooting abilities



To Apply



Please include:

1. A short introduction

2. Your top 3 Zapier or automation builds (screenshots or Looms)

3. A brief explanation of the most complex data integrity challenge you’ve solved

4. Your availability (weekly hours). We operate in EST time 9am-5pm typically. 



We are ready to hire immediately and move quickly for the right person.

title: Property Operations & Guest Relations Specialist
description:
Are you a Property Management Rockstar who is fast, efficient, and tech-savvy?



We are an established, San Francisco Bay Area-based property management firm with nearly 8 years of success in the short-term (STR) and long-term rental (LTR) industry. We have built a reputation for excellence, and we are looking for a seasoned professional to join our stable, high-performing team.



We don’t just need "customer service"—we need a Property Management Expert who understands the mechanics of the industry, moves quickly, and never lets a detail slip through the cracks.



Why Join Us?

Proven Stability: Work for a company with an 8-year track record of growth and industry expertise.

High-Speed Environment: We value efficiency. If you are fast and productive, you will thrive here.

Professional Standards: We have clear processes in place—no "startup" guesswork.

100% Remote: Long-term, stable remote work from your home office.



The Requirements (Strict)

Please do not apply if you only have general Call Center/BPO experience. We require specific industry expertise.

Direct Property Management Experience: Minimum 2+ years managing Short-Term Rentals (Airbnb/VRBO) and Long-Term Rentals.

PMS Mastery: Advanced proficiency in OwnerRez is highly preferred. You should know how to navigate workflows, triggers, and guest communication within the platform.

Operational Speed: You must be fast-thinking, fast-typing (60+ WPM), and able to handle multiple guest issues simultaneously without losing quality.

Reliability: We require high accountability. As an established firm, we rely on teammates who respect schedules and deadlines.

Tech Stack: Knowledge of AI tools (ChatGPT), Time Doctor, and dual-monitor setups.



Your Responsibilities

End-to-End Guest Management: Manage inquiries, bookings, and high-stakes resolution cases across Airbnb, VRBO, and direct sites.

Property Oversight: Coordinate check-ins/outs, send and track lease agreements, and monitor security footage.

Logistics & Maintenance: Schedule cleaning teams, review quality assurance photos, and manage supply inventory.

Listing Optimization: Maintain and optimize listings to ensure maximum occupancy and 5-star reviews.

Process Contribution: Use your experience to help refine our established internal workflows.



Compensation & Benefits

Base Pay: Starting at $5/hour (Negotiable for candidates with extensive Property Management experience).

Schedule: Pacific Standard Time (PST) | Includes Weekends

Paid Leave: Accrued leave credits after 1 year

Bonus: Performance-based bonuses



How to Apply

To filter for the high-attention-to-detail candidates we need, please follow these steps exactly:

 your Resume to 
 Introduction: Record a brief intro highlighting your specific experience with PMS and STR/LTR management. (Share via Dropbox/Google Drive link).

Subject Line: Must be: [Property Management Specialist] – (Last Name, First Name)

Expertise Check: In your
, briefly describe the most complex issue you resolved in OwnerRez or a similar PMS.



Bonus: End your
 by telling us who the current Prime Minister of the United Kingdom is.

title: Recruitment Sales Representative
description:
Job Summary

?We are looking for a results-driven Outreach Specialist to join our recruitment team. Unlike traditional recruiters who find candidates for jobs, your primary mission will be to find jobs for our top-tier candidates. You will be responsible for identifying companies currently hiring for roles that match our talent pool and proactively pitching our "Most Placeable Candidates" (MPCs) to their hiring managers and decision-makers.

?Key Responsibilities

?Market Mapping: Scour job boards (LinkedIn, Indeed, Glassdoor) to identify companies actively hiring for specific skill sets.

?Lead Generation: Use tools like LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Apollo, or Hunter.io to find the contact information of Hiring Managers, HR Directors, and CEOs.

?Cold Outreach: Execute high-volume outbound campaigns via
, LinkedIn, and [optional: cold calling] to introduce our candidates to potential employers.

?Pitching: Craft compelling, personalized "mini-bios" or pitch decks that highlight why our candidate is the perfect solution for their open vacancy.

?Appointment Setting: Schedule discovery calls between our Account Managers and the interested company’s hiring team.

?CRM Management: Maintain clean records of all outreach activities in our CRM (e.g., HubSpot, Pipedrive, or Salesforce).
