title: Hospitality Operations Manager - Remote (Short-Term Rental & Wedding Venue)
description:
About the Role

We run a US-based luxury hospitality portfolio — currently 3–6 short-term rental properties and a boutique micro-wedding venue. We're looking for an Operations Manager, not a Virtual Assistant.

We run a modern, tech-forward operation — we use a lot of tools, build custom systems, and lean on AI to work smarter. You don't need to be an engineer, but you do need to be the kind of person who picks up new software quickly and genuinely enjoys finding better ways to do things.

This role is the "Control Tower" of our business. You will own logistics, guest experience, wedding sales, and brand marketing simultaneously — solving problems, spending company money when needed, and making judgment calls without waiting on the owner. If you need to be told what to do every hour, this is not the right fit. If you thrive with real ownership and a direct line to leadership, keep reading.



What You'll Own

1. Logistics & Procurement

You are responsible for ensuring our properties never run out of supplies. You'll manage inventory across all locations, use the company card to reorder linens, toiletries, and consumables proactively, and maintain accurate stock logs. You own this — not us.

Cleaner & Contractor Oversight: You are the direct supervisor for our cleaning teams. You'll set schedules, review photo quality reports after each turnover, and approve payments. If something breaks — a heater, a lock, an appliance — you troubleshoot with the guest, source and hire a local contractor, authorize payment, and then notify the owner once it's resolved.

2. Wedding Venue Sales & Coordination

Our systems are set up to help you respond to inbound wedding inquiries within 5 minutes during your shift — and that standard is non-negotiable. You'll answer questions about pricing, capacity, and availability with a warm, white-glove tone that matches the caliber of our venue. You'll qualify leads, schedule on-site tours, and keep our CRM (HoneyBook/Dubsado) clean and up to date so no lead falls through the cracks.

3. Guest Experience — Short-Term Rentals

Own all guest communication from inquiry to checkout across Airbnb and VRBO. Handle escalations, disputes with platform support, and craft professional responses to reviews — both positive and negative.

4. Content & Marketing 

This is a real part of the job, not an afterthought. You'll be responsible for:

- Social media posting and scheduling across Instagram,
, and TikTok using our content calendar and tools (e.g., Later, Buffer, or similar)

- Marketing
 execution — sending pre-written or lightly templated campaigns to our lead lists via our
 platform (e.g., Mailchimp, Klaviyo, or similar)

- Keeping our pipeline warm — following up with cold leads, past inquirers, and potential repeat guests using pre-approved messaging



You won't be writing strategy from scratch, but you need strong written English and an eye for what looks and sounds premium.



Requirements:



- 3+ years of experience in operations, property management, event coordination, or a hybrid hospitality/marketing role

- Must be available to work full-time, Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST (US Central Time) — this is a hard requirement, no  exceptions

- Prior experience handling company expenses, purchasing, or petty cash — you will be trusted with a company card

- Fluent English communication, both written and spoken — you will be on calls with guests, wedding couples, and vendors regularly and must be able to represent the brand with confidence and warmth

- Solid working knowledge of Google Drive, Sheets, and Docs as a daily operating environment

- Comfortable with a tools-heavy workflow — you'll use multiple platforms simultaneously and are expected to learn new software quickly, including tools that are custom-built for our operation

- At least passing familiarity with Slack, a CRM platform (HoneyBook, Dubsado, or similar), a social media scheduling tool (Later, Buffer, or similar), and Airbnb/VRBO host dashboards

- Open to using AI tools like ChatGPT or Claude as part of your day-to-day — we'll show you how we use them, but curiosity beats credentials here

- High emotional intelligence — you can de-escalate a frustrated guest and keep an anxious bride feeling taken care of, all in the same afternoon

- Strong written English with a warm, professional tone that reflects a premium brand

Platform experience with Ownerrez is a strong plus but not required — we'll train the right person



Hardware Requirements: Reliable PC or Mac, 25 Mbps+ internet connection, Noise-canceling headset (required for guest and vendor calls)



Why This Role

Our last ops hire treated this like a task queue. We need someone who treats it like a business they co-own. As we add properties — and we are actively acquiring — your scope and compensation grow with us. This is a long-term career position with a direct relationship with the owner, not a seat in a call center.



How to Apply

Applications that don't follow these instructions will not be reviewed — this is your first test of attention to detail.

Send an
 with the subject line: Hospitality Ops Manager – [Your Name]

Include:

1. Your resume or portfolio link.

2. Written answers to both scenarios below:

Scenario A — The Inventory Problem: You review a cleaner's post-checkout report and notice one of our properties has 2 rolls of toilet paper left. A guest checks in tomorrow. Next-day delivery isn't available and the owner is unreachable. What do you do, step by step?

Scenario B — The Wedding Inquiry: A bride
s asking to tour the venue this Saturday at 2 PM. Your calendar shows a private event in progress at that time. Write the actual reply you'd send her — it must decline that slot while keeping her warm and moving toward a booking.

Maintain accuracy and consistency across all Revit models and related documentation.

Coordinate with project managers and other disciplines to ensure seamless project delivery.

Bachelor’s degree in Structural Engineering, Civil Engineering, or related field.

Industrial and commercial engineering experience preferred, particularly with heavy load-bearing structures.

Proven expertise as a Revit Modeler, with advanced knowledge of large-scale modeling.

Strong understanding of structural systems, especially for multi-level and heavy storage buildings.

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and collaboration abilities in a remote team environment.



Preferred Skills:

Experience with Steel Structures, Concrete Structures, Masonry Construction, Light and Gauge Steel Structures

Familiarity with BIM coordination and clash detection.

Knowledge of U.S. building codes and standards is a plus.

Knowledge of ETABS and SAFE is a plus.

title: Risk Management / CFO
description:
Job Title: Risk Management & Resolution Lead



Department: Finance / Operations

Reports To: Designated Stakeholders (Dual Reporting Line)

Employment Type: Contract / Offshore

Start Date: ASAP

Compensation: $8 per hour (Not more than $100 per week)

Payroll: Paid under MIDOS

Risk Level: High-Risk Operational Environment



Role Overview



The Risk Management & Resolution Lead is responsible for identifying, managing, and resolving operational and strategic risks across the organization. This role ensures business stability by driving accountability, cross-functional coordination, and structured resolution of high-impact issues.



Operating in a high-exposure environment, the role requires proactive risk assessment, strong execution discipline, and consistent stakeholder reporting. The individual will have cross-team coordination authority to ensure timely mitigation and operational stability.



Key Responsibilities



Identify operational and strategic risks affecting business performance



Lead structured risk resolution processes across departments



Drive accountability and ensure follow-through on corrective actions



Coordinate cross-functionally to stabilize operations and reduce exposure



Maintain full system and data visibility to monitor risk areas



Produce clear and concise weekly stakeholder reports outlining:



Key issues identified



Actions taken



Pending risks



Resolution progress



Preventive controls implemented



Implement process improvements to prevent recurring operational risks



Escalate critical issues with recommended solutions



Authority & Scope



Cross-team coordination authority



Direct access to operational systems and relevant data



Responsibility for risk visibility, reporting, and resolution tracking



Required Qualifications



Proven experience in Risk Management, Operations, Finance, or similar strategic roles



Strong analytical and problem-solving skills



Experience in high-risk or fast-paced operational environments



Excellent reporting and stakeholder communication skills



High accountability and execution-focused mindset



Ability to manage sensitive information with discretion

Send follow-up
s

Calls made

Conversations held

Qualified leads generated

Meetings scheduled

Ideal Candidate

Required Skills

Self-motivated with a results-driven mindset



Preferred Experience

Additional bonuses for closed deals 





A successful Lead Generator in this role will:

Consistently schedule qualified meetings each week

Build a strong pipeline of drayage prospects

Help increase direct shipper and forwarder accounts

Bonus:

Tools

Schedule

- Opportunity to become lead content editor

We help people:

We’re building a serious movement — not just posting videos.



Looking for someone who wants to grow with us, not just complete tasks.

title: Cold-Calling Appointment Setter – Australian Trade Businesses IMMEDIATE START
description:
Job Title: Cold-Calling Appointment Setter – Australian Trade Businesses



Job Type: Remote / Performance-Based



About Us: We help Australian trade businesses (plumbers, electricians, builders, carpenters, and more) grow by generating high-quality, qualified leads and converting them into paying clients. We’re looking for a motivated cold-calling appointment setter based in the Philippines to contact Australian businesses and schedule qualified appointments for our sales team.



Role Overview:

As a Cold-Calling Appointment Setter, you will:

Make outbound cold calls to Australian trade businesses during Australian business hours (8:30?AM – 5:00?PM AEST / 6:30?AM – 3:00?PM PHT).

Prospect and qualify businesses to ensure they are decision-makers and suitable clients.

Schedule appointments for the sales team — target: 40 booked appointments per month.

Follow up to confirm appointments and maintain accurate CRM records.

Maintain high-quality standards — only qualified appointments count for payment.



Requirements:

Excellent English communication skills (spoken English must be clear and professional for Australian clients).

Confident, persuasive, and resilient to cold-call rejection.

Experience in cold calling, appointment setting, or B2B sales preferred.

Must be able to work Australian business hours (8:30?AM – 5:00?PM AEST / 6:30?AM – 3:00?PM PHT).

Understanding of Australian business culture is a plus.

Self-motivated, results-driven, and comfortable with a performance-based pay structure.



Compensation:

$15 AUD per booked appointment (must be a qualified prospect and show up).

$25 AUD bonus if the appointment converts into a paying client.

Performance-based payouts fortnightly.



Earnings are uncapped — top performers can earn significantly more.



Example potential monthly earnings (high performer):

40 booked appointments/month ? $600 AUD

15 of those convert ? $375 AUD bonus

Total monthly: $975 AUD (with potential to earn more as performance increases)



Why Join Us:

Work remotely from anywhere in the Philippines.

Flexible schedule aligned with Australian business hours.

High earning potential based purely on performance.

Training provided for prospecting, qualifying, and scheduling appointments with Australian trade businesses.

title: Content Strategist / Head of Creative Strategy
description:
About the Company

We are a fast-growing AI-powered content creation agency helping brands build authority and generate leads through high-quality video content. We're a fully remote team on a mission to scale from the ground up, and we're looking for sharp, driven people to grow with us.

The Role

This is one of our most critical hires. As our Content Strategist, you will be the creative brain behind every piece of content we produce for clients. You'll sit between the client, our Project Manager, and our production team — translating client goals into content strategies, hooks, angles, and briefs that actually drive results. You're not just an ideas person; you understand what content performs, why it performs, and how to replicate it at scale.

Key Responsibilities

• Develop content strategies and creative briefs for all client accounts

• Research and define winning hooks, angles, and messaging frameworks for each client niche

• Collaborate closely with the PM and video editing team to ensure creative vision is executed correctly

• Analyse client content performance and continuously iterate strategies based on data

• Stay ahead of trends on YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn to identify what's working

• Help position our agency's content offer with clear, compelling strategy decks

• Ensure every piece of content we produce ties back to client business goals

Requirements

• 3+ years of experience in content strategy, social media strategy, or creative direction

• Deep understanding of short-form and long-form video content performance

• Experience working with brands or clients across multiple niches

• Strong written communication — you can write sharp, punchy briefs and hooks

• Comfortable using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Jasper, etc.) to accelerate creative output

• Highly organized and able to manage multiple clients simultaneously

• Experience with platforms like YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, or TikTok content strategy is a must

• Portfolio or case studies of content strategies you've created

Nice to Have

• Experience at a content or creative agency

• Familiarity with tools like Notion, Airtable, or ClickUp

• Knowledge of SEO and its relationship to content strategy

Compensation & Growth

Competitive monthly salary based on experience. This is a full-time, long-term remote role with room to grow into a leadership position as the company scales.

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
description:
About the Company

We are a fast-growing AI-powered content creation agency helping brands grow through strategic video content. We're building out our sales engine and need a driven SDR to help fill our pipeline and book qualified calls for our sales closer.

The Role

As our SDR, you are the first point of human contact for our prospects. Your job is to take warm leads from our outreach team, follow up persistently and professionally, handle early objections, and book qualified discovery calls for our sales closer. You're not cold-calling from scratch — our outreach team generates interest, and you convert that interest into booked meetings.

Key Responsibilities

• Follow up with warm leads generated by the outreach team via
, DMs, and WhatsApp

• Qualify leads based on our ideal client profile before booking them for a closing call

• Book and confirm discovery calls in our closer's calendar

• Track all lead activity and update our CRM accurately and consistently

• Send personalized follow-up sequences to leads who haven't responded

• Work closely with our CRO and outreach team lead to refine messaging

• Report daily on lead status, call-booked numbers, and conversion rates

Requirements

• 1–3 years of experience in sales, lead qualification, or appointment setting

• Excellent written and spoken English

• Experience using a CRM (GoHighLevel, HubSpot, Pipedrive, etc.)

• Persistent, organized, and comfortable with high-volume follow-up

• Understanding of the B2B sales process

• Self-motivated with the ability to work independently in a remote environment

• Strong attention to detail — you never let a lead fall through the cracks

Nice to Have

• Experience in the marketing, media, or content agency space

• Familiarity with cold outreach tools (Instantly, Lemlist, Apollo)

• Experience working for a US, UK, or Australian-based company

title: Senior Finance & Accounting Manager
description:
We are looking for a Senior Finance & Accounting Manager to lead our accounting and financial reporting function. This role will be responsible for ensuring accurate financial reporting, supporting forecasting and budgeting, and partnering with leadership on financial strategy.



This position will manage an existing accounting tea
mber and play a key role in strengthening accounting processes as the company continues to grow—particularly within an ecommerce environment powered by Shopify and with the launch of a new line of business.



Key Responsibilities:

* Oversee day-to-day accounting operations, including month-end and year-end close

* Review and ensure accuracy of financial statements and internal financial reports

* Lead budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow analysis

* Analyze and reconcile Shopify financial data, including revenue, refunds, fees, chargebacks, and payouts

* Partner with operations and leadership to translate Shopify reporting and ecommerce performance metrics into financial insights

* Support the launch of a new line of business, including setting up and structuring the QuickBooks chart of accounts

* Integrate the new line of business into financial reporting, tracking, and performance analysis

* Manage and mentor accounting staff, ensuring high-quality and timely work

* Ensure compliance with accounting standards and internal controls

* Provide financial insights and recommendations to support leadership decision-making

* Continuously improve accounting processes, reporting efficiency, and ecommerce-related financial workflows



Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

* 5–10+ years of progressive accounting and finance experience

* Strong background in financial reporting, forecasting, and cash flow management

* Hands-on experience with Shopify reporting and ecommerce financial analytics

* Experience setting up or restructuring charts of accounts in QuickBooks or similar systems

* Experience managing or reviewing the work of other accountants

* Strong attention to detail with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

* Experience working with U.S.-based companies is a plus





Compensation & Details: 

* USD $15,000–$20,000 annually

* Full-time, remote position

* Long-term opportunity with growth potential

title: Google Ads & SEO Specialist
description:
About the Role

We’re looking for a genuinely experienced Google Ads & SEO Specialist to take ownership of search performance across a portfolio of client accounts.



This role sits at the intersection of paid and organic search. You’ll lead Google Ads strategy and optimisation while also guiding SEO direction — identifying opportunities, prioritising work, and ensuring search visibility and lead generation improve over time.



You won’t be micromanaged, and you won’t be handed step-by-step instructions. We’re looking for someone senior enough to assess, decide, and act — someone who understands why performance changes and knows how to respond quickly and logically.



This is a part-time contractor role suited to a specialist who prefers focused, meaningful work over high-volume task execution.



What You’ll Do



Google Ads 

- Manage and optimise Search, Performance Max, and remarketing campaigns

- Improve lead quality, conversion rates, and cost efficiency

- Review keyword targeting, match types, negatives, and bidding strategies

- Identify wasted spend and scaling opportunities

- Develop and run structured testing plans

- Ensure conversion tracking and attribution are reliable



SEO (Strategic & Hands-On)

- Conduct technical and on-page SEO audits

- Identify ranking opportunities and prioritise actions

- Create SEO roadmaps and implementation plans

- Review site structure, internal linking, and metadata

- Collaborate with developers and content teams where required

- Reporting & Communication

- Provide clear monthly performance reporting with insights and next steps

- Share concise updates on progress, risks, and opportunities

- Translate performance data into plain-English business impact

- Offer proactive recommendations rather than reactive reporting



What You’ll Bring

- 6+ years’ experience managing Google Ads and SEO end-to-end

- Deep understanding of search intent, keyword strategy, and conversion optimisation

- Proven ability to improve lead generation or revenue outcomes

- Strong analytical skills and confident decision-making

- Experience working independently and managing priorities

- Excellent written communication and structured reporting

- Ability to collaborate with developers, marketers, and stakeholders



Nice to Have

- Experience with B2B lead generation or service-based businesses

- Familiarity with GA4, GTM, and Looker Studio reporting

- Experience reviewing landing pages and conversion pathways

- Understanding of technical SEO and site performance factors



What Success Looks Like

- Improved lead quality and cost efficiency in Google Ads

- Measurable gains in organic visibility and search performance

- Clear, reliable reporting and communication

- Proactive identification of issues and opportunities

- Well-structured, well-maintained accounts and search strategies



Why This Role Appeals

- Flexible part-time hours

- Remote work 

- High trust and autonomy

- Opportunity to make meaningful impact across multiple accounts

- Long-term potential for the right specialist



If you’re a senior search specialist who enjoys analysing performance, improving outcomes, and owning results, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Image Retoucher and Coordinator
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a detail-oriented and creative Image Retoucher & Coordinator to support one of our suppliers in the  Product and Marketing teams. This role is perfect for someone who’s strong in visual editing, highly organised, and comfortable managing large volumes of imagery from multiple sources.

You will be responsible for managing, retouching, and distributing product imagery that will be used across our eCommerce platforms, marketing campaigns, and brand communications.



What you’ll be doing:



* Image Management & Coordination (Product Team)

Manage and track all incoming imagery from suppliers and manufacturers.

Work closely with the Product Team to ensure all image files are complete, high-quality, and aligned with product data.

Organise and maintain a structured digital image library (file naming, folders, version control).

Coordinate with suppliers and internal teams to request missing or updated images as needed.



* Image Retouching & Enhancement (Product + Marketing Teams)

Retouch, colour-correct, and enhance images following design briefs and brand visual guidelines.

Ensure visual consistency across all products and marketing touch points.

Prepare and export files in the correct formats and ratios for eCommerce and digital use.



* Image Resizing & Formatting (Marketing Team)

Resize, crop, and optimise images for various platforms (website, social media, advertising).

Optimise file size for the web while maintaining image quality.

Apply consistent naming conventions and metadata for efficient asset management.



* Image Distribution (Marketing Team)

Prepare and deliver final image assets to internal teams (design, marketing, eCommerce) and external partners (retailers, PR, media).

Maintain an organized and up-to-date shared folder or asset management system.

Ensure timely delivery to support product launches and campaign timelines.





What we are looking for:



*Experience in image retouching, editing, and asset management.

*Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop (required).

*Strong sense of visual quality, colour accuracy, and consistency.

*Excellent file organization and naming conventions.

*Ability to manage deadlines and coordinate with multiple teams.

*Experience in eCommerce image preparation is a plus.

*Good communication skills when working with suppliers and internal stakeholders.



What We Offer



*13th-month performance based bonus

*Annual performance based salary increase

*HMO for you + 1 Free Dependent after 6 months

*10 days Vacation Leave

*5 days Sick Leave

*3 days extra PTO (holiday seasons)

*8 hours; Fixed Morning Shift

*Permanent Work From Home Setup

*Salary: TBD



Please fill out this link:


/?k=zLdqBdvRPLt5qwEBbrrYEA&d=

title: Full Time UGC Video Editor and Content Producer (Instagram + TikTok)
description:
We are hiring a full time UGC editor and content producer to turn daily raw footage into high quality, on brand short form content for Instagram Reels and TikTok. This role is for someone who can own the full short form pipeline: ideas, hooks, scripts, editing, captions, and trend adaptation.



You will be producing 5 to 7 content pieces per day across Instagram and TikTok. This means you must be fast, consistent, and organised, while still keeping quality high.



What you will do

 • Create daily content ideas based on trends, formats, and what is performing in our niche

 • Write hooks, scripts, and short talking point outlines (UGC style)

 • Edit raw footage into 5 to 7 short form videos per day (vertical 9:16)

 • Add captions, on screen text, b roll overlays, sound effects, and platform safe music

 • Repurpose raw footage into multiple angles (different hooks, cuts, lengths)

 • Keep everything aligned to our brand voice and visual style

 • Deliver final videos daily with clean file naming and consistent formatting

 • Track what performs and suggest improvements (retention, watch time, saves, shares)



Output expectations (non negotiable)

 • 5 to 7 edited content pieces per day

 • Optimised for IG Reels + TikTok (9:16)

 • Captions included on every video

 • Variations when needed for hook testing

 • Consistent style templates (fonts, caption look, pacing) to scale volume



Who you are

 • You have strong experience editing short form TikTok and Reels content

 • You understand retention editing: hook, pattern interrupts, pacing, payoff

 • You can write scripts and hooks, not just edit

 • You have excellent taste and clean execution (subtitles, timing, text placement)

 • You can work quickly without losing attention to detail

 • You are proactive, reliable, and communicate clearly

 • You are comfortable working with finance content and compliance friendly wording



Tools and requirements

 • Your own computer and reliable internet

 • CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve

 • Comfortable using Google Drive (or similar) for file handling

 • Bonus if you can build CapCut templates to speed up daily production



How to apply (include ALL of the below)

 1. A short intro and your experience with short form editing

 2. Links to your best 5 to 10 Reels or TikTok edits

 3. What software you use and your daily turnaround speed

 4. Your expected monthly salary in PHP

 5. Answer this question (short but specific):

“How do you reliably produce 5 to 7 high-quality short-form videos per day from raw footage?”



Paid trial task



Shortlisted candidates will complete a paid trial day: edit a small batch of raw clips into multiple short-form videos following our style brief.

title: Automation & Systems Specialist (Airtable / Make.com / System Migration)

title: Senior Consultative Sales Executive (U.S. Market) Philippines-Based | $20/hr + Commission + Residual Income
description:
About Us



We are a U.S.-based company with over 20+ Virtual Assistants and several years of operational experience serving American business owners.



We are now launching a new division focused on growth and expansion.



This is not a risky startup with no backing.

This is a new revenue division inside an established company with infrastructure, systems, and leadership already in place.



You will be joining at the ground level of something built to scale.

A totally neutral American accent (mandatory)



Extensive, proven success selling to U.S. clients



A strong closing background



Confidence running discovery calls and leading conversations



Experience selling services (not just products)



The ability to think strategically, not just follow a script



This is not entry-level.

This is not a training ground role.



We want someone with real numbers, real performance, and real confidence.



Why This Role Is Different



Because this is a startup division:



You will help shape the sales process



You will have influence over scripts, positioning, and strategy



You will help build something from the ground up



You will have leadership opportunities as we grow

Close deals consistently

You will not just be dialing.

You will be building.



Compensation

Commission on all closed deals



Residual income on recurring accounts



No artificial cap on earnings



High long-term upside for serious performers



Ideal Candidate

CRM experience

Growth Path



As this division scales, this role can evolve into:

Sales Manager



Director of Sales



If you perform, you will grow with the company.



How to Apply

Resume



Top 3 sales achievements (with numbers)

Average monthly commissions in your last role



We invest in long-term tea
mbers and reward commitment.

If your selected coverage exceeds the allowance, you are responsible for the difference

Available after 90 days of employment.



1,500 PHP per month

Available after 90 days of employment.



1,000 PHP per month

Use-it-or-lose-it policy

title: Creative Designer
description:
Fusion Vine is a remote-first company focused on building scalable systems by combining skilled talent with AI-powered workflows. We support businesses through content, creative, and digital execution while prioritizing efficiency, clarity, and quality.

title: Video Producer
description:
About Us

We run pay-per-call affiliate campaigns for pest control services in the Dallas-Fort Worth area. Our ads appear on major publisher sites like NBC News, Bloomberg, MSN, and Weather Channel through native advertising platforms. We need consistent, high-quality creative assets to drive phone calls from homeowners dealing with pest problems.



The Role

We're looking for a creative editor who can produce editorial-style images and commercial videos that blend naturally with news content while driving strong click-to-call conversions.



Weekly Deliverables:



5-10 static images optimized for native ad platforms



1 short video (maximum 45 seconds) with compelling call-to-action



What You'll Create

Static Images:



Editorial-style visuals that match news site aesthetics



Pest-specific creatives (rodents, bed bugs, termites, mosquitoes, wildlife)



Localized messaging targeting DFW homeowners



3-4 variations per pest type for A/B testing



Videos:



Maximum 45 seconds with strong urgency



Commercial-use stock footage only



Clear call-to-action driving phone calls (not website clicks)



Professional editing with text overlays and branding



Seasonal themes matching our quarterly campaigns



Campaign Focus by Quarter

Q1 (Now): Rodents, bed bugs, wildlife seeking shelter



Q2: Termites, mosquitoes, ants (peak season)



Q3: Roaches, scorpions, spiders (summer heat)



Q4: Rodents and wildlife return



Requirements

Must Have:



2+ years creating assets for native ad platforms (Taboola, Outbrain, MGID)



Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite or equivalent (Canva Pro, CapCut, Premiere)



Experience sourcing and licensing stock media (Shutterstock, Storyblocks, Getty, Envato)



Understanding of native ad specs and platform requirements



Strong headline integration skills



Ability to create urgency without violating platform policies



Preferred:



Experience in home services, pest control, or local lead generation



Familiarity with pay-per-call or affiliate marketing compliance



Previous geo-targeted campaign work



Creative Direction

Your assets will support headlines like:



"Dallas Homeowners: Rodents Are Invading Attics This Winter"



"The Bed Bug Warning Signs Dallas Residents Miss"



"5 Signs Termites May Be Eating Your Dallas Home"



"Take Back Your Backyard: DFW Mosquito Season Is Here"



"Hearing Scratching in Your Walls? Here's What DFW Contractors Say"



The tone is informative but urgent. We're a referral service connecting homeowners with licensed contractors—not a pest control company directly.



Non-Negotiables

Human-created content only – Absolutely no AI-generated images or videos



Commercial licensing – All stock media must be cleared for paid advertising use



Weekly consistency – Must reliably deliver assets on schedule



Iteration willingness – Be ready to adjust based on performance data



Compensation

Contract/freelance basis



Approximately 10-15 hours per week



Open to per-asset pricing or weekly retainer



Ongoing engagement with potential to scale as campaigns grow



To Apply

Submit:



Portfolio link showing native ad or editorial-style advertising work



1-2 short commercial videos demonstrating stock footage editing and CTA integration



Brief description of your stock media licensing workflow



Your rate structure (per asset or weekly retainer)



Current availability and turnaround capacity



Screening Questions

Have you created advertising assets specifically for Taboola, MGID, or similar native platforms? Describe a campaign you worked on.



What stock media platforms do you use, and how do you ensure proper commercial licensing?



Can you confirm all deliverables will be 100% human-created with no AI-generated content?



Walk me through your process for creating a 45-second commercial video with a strong CTA.



What's your realistic turnaround time for 5-10 static images and 1 video per week?

title: Executive Assistant / Personal Secretary (Virtual)
description:
Requirements: Executive Assistant (Personal) Virtual

Required Schedule: Monday to Saturday - 9am to 7pm. 

Type: Full Time (No to multiple clients (Juggling).



Looking for Male Virtual Assistant only. (No discrimination intended, just a preference based on my workflow). 



ABOUT ME:



1. I am Half Japanese and half Filipino. I speak fluent Tagalog and English. However, I easily adjust to who I talk to. It is important to know, though, that Reading and writing in English are both separate skills. More on that later on. We can communicate in Tagalog or English. Usually, I prefer proper English.



2. I am a workaholic. My schedule is hectic, and I have many responsibilities. My current assistant will leave after three years of working with me to pursue her path. She has been excellent in fulfilling her duties and responsibilities. I also found her here on this platform. 



3. Time is very important to me. I want to add more time and reduce my workload. I want to spend more time with my family when I go home every day. Most of the tasks are personally related. Task-intensive, yes, because there are a lot of small tasks like calls, messages, and research. I value the time that much. I don't want to get sidelined and distracted with my day to day tasks. 



4. I am a technology-oriented person. You will be introduced to many tools you have probably not heard of before (win-win). Security is another factor. I will try our relationship first before introducing myself further.



5. I am more available at night after a busy day's work. I am still trying to assess our workflow. It is more of a let's see what works, and let us communicate properly on how you want things. Usually, I would reply in the morning, and of course reply during the day if a concern is there but if we come to an arrangement wherein we can review the day or plan the next tasks after 7pm or if you are still awake by 10pm then that would be really good.



6. Since I am busy, I can be flexible. Maybe there will be some weekdays when I won't need you, but the payment is fixed. 



Disclaimer: I am not sure if my job description is really the industry standard, but what I can say is I do not need a highly skilled VA in terms of Wordpress or Marketing. I want someone who is very good with Research and Communication. This is just a heads-up before moving to the next points.



REQUISITES:

1. Proper English (Reading & Writing)

2. Mobile Phone (I will provide your own, postpaid number & etc). 

3. Laptop or Desktop PC (I will provide your own)

4. Speed Test of your internet ( I will assess this)

5. Typing Test (Words per minute, I use Type Racer)

5. Good Communication Skills (This is just my preference, but if you communicate with (....Hello po) and like that, I will ask you to change and improve on that part. Proper punctuation, spelling, and sentence construction will be appreciated.)

6. Good Logic and Analytical Skills

7. Reading between the lines. (Context of Clues)

8. Advance notice is critical to me. I plan my tasks obsessively and schedule my life based on Time. As mentioned, I treat it like I treat it with money.

9. Loyalty and Trust.

10. I hope you don't mind me messaging you early in the morning or very late at night (mute it) since there are times that I create messages or instructions at these times.

11. It would be a plus BUT NOT MANDATORY if you are in the Apple ecosystem (iPhone)



MAJOR JOB DESCRIPTION:

1. Monitors and Updates my purchases.

2. Set Appointments (Meetings, Doctors, and other scheduled activities).

3. Manage my purchases, inquiries, research, returns, and everything included.

4. Purchase on my behalf (I am still researching how to authorize purchases without actually giving out my personal credit card information)

5. Research (Must be excellent). For example: Give me a list of Five-star restaurants, etc.



MINOR:

1. Writing

2. Compilation of Articles (Connected to Research)

3. Contact this person on behalf of me.

4. Transcribing



BENEFITS & INCLUSIONS:

1. Payroll will be done weekly every Friday. 

2. Of course, overtime will be paid.

3. I'll give you all the tools with licenses and everything for you to do your work. As mentioned, I value time with the same value as money.

4. I will give you YouTube Premium and Spotify if you want.

5. Training and guidance will be provided.

6. If we are successful for months and have established trust with our partnership, I will provide you with equipment such as a Laptop or Desktop, Webcam, and headset.

8. I am willing to teach and train. We are both investing (Win-win)





TOOLS:

- I am a very technical person. All software, tools needed will be provided. Here are some of the tools that are usually part of my toolbox. This doesn't mean that you will use all of these tools. Just wanted to lay it out there just in case you are familiar. I will be putting a (#) hashtag after a number if it is a major requirement. Expect to be assessed on these things if you are familiar.



OFFICE SUITES:

1. Google Workspace (Chrome, Docs, Sheets, Slides, Drive, Gmail)

2. Office 365 (Edge, Word, Excel, Powerpoint)



COMMUNICATION TOOLS:

1. Slack

2. Zoom

3.

4. LINE

5. Viber

6. WhatsApp



DOCUMENTATION:

1. Evernote



STORAGE

1. Google Drive



SPECIAL MENTION TOOLS:

1. Airtable

2. Asana 

3. Others

title: Creative Content Editor & Social Media Manager
description:
Intro Video: 











- Salary can grow, and we expect employees to showcase result before salary is increased.





## About Echosetter



Echosetter provides white-label AI infrastructure for agency owners — giving them the software, systems, fulfillment, and support they need to launch and scale AI-powered agencies. We're a small, fast-moving team that punches well above its weight, and we're building one of the most complete ecosystems in the AI agency space.



Our founder creates a high volume of raw content (on-camera video, screen recordings, ad scripts, educational content). What we're missing is the creative engine that turns that raw material into polished, scroll-stopping content across every platform we operate on.



That's where you come in.



---



## The Role



You're the creative engine. You take raw footage, scripts, and ideas from the founder and turn them into finished assets — ads, YouTube videos, Reels, Shorts, thumbnails, statics. A separate performance marketer handles strategy, metrics, and ad account management. Your job is to make the content look incredible and produce it at volume.



You'll own the full creative pipeline from raw footage to finished asset, and you'll work closely with the founder to stay 30 days ahead on the content calendar at all times.



This is a hands-on role where you'll be trained directly by the founder over time — not just on editing technique, but on the brand voice, audience, and what makes content connect in this space. The goal is to develop you into someone who creates with intention, not just speed.



**Growth path:** As Echosetter scales, this role has direct scope to grow into a Creative Lead position, managing a team of editors who produce content for both Echosetter and our clients' agencies. You'd be building the department, not just filling a seat.



---



## What You'll Do



### Video Editing (Paid Ads)



- Edit direct-response Meta ad creatives (UGC-style, talking head, testimonial compilations, B-roll overlays)

- Produce multiple distinct creative variations per campaign — not just different hooks on the same edit, but genuinely different visual treatments, pacing, and structures. You'll be briefed on what's needed and your job is to deliver creative diversity at volume

- Create compelling static ad images and carousel assets

- Use AI tools like Kling AI for face swapping and synthetic video generation to expand creative output

- Turn around iterations quickly when the performance team requests new variations or tweaks to winning creatives



### Video Editing (Organic)



- Edit long-form YouTube videos (educational/value-driven content, 8–20 min)

- Create original short-form content for Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts — this is not just cutting clips from long-form. Short-form often requires its own visual approach, pacing, and hooks. You need to understand what works natively on short-form platforms and create accordingly

- Repurpose long-form footage into short-form where appropriate, but know the difference between a lazy chop and a purpose-built short

- Add captions, motion graphics, transitions, and visual hooks optimized for each platform



### Content Management & Scheduling



- Own the content calendar across Instagram, YouTube, YouTube Shorts, and

- Batch-create and schedule content to maintain a 30-day content buffer

- Maintain cadence: 1–2 short-form posts/day on IG and YT Shorts, plus 3 long-form YouTube videos per week



### Creative & AI-Assisted Design



- Design thumbnails, social graphics, and ad statics that drive clicks

- Use AI image and video generation tools (ChatGPT/DALL-E, Midjourney, Higgsfield, Kling AI, or similar) for creative concepting, face swapping, and visual asset production

- Stay current with emerging AI creative tools and integrate them into your workflow — the landscape moves fast and we expect you to move with it



---



## What We're Looking For



### Must-Haves



- 2+ years of experience editing short-form and long-form video content for social media

- Strong portfolio showing ad creatives, YouTube videos, and/or Reels you've produced

- Proficiency in CapCut, Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or equivalent editing tools

- Experience creating direct-response ad creatives (you understand the visual language of ads that stop the scroll)

- Ability to produce genuinely distinct creative variations — different looks, different energy, not just the same edit with a new intro

- Eye for design: you can create clean, high-converting static images and thumbnails

- Comfortable working with AI tools (Kling AI, Higgsfield, ChatGPT image gen, or similar) for creative production

- Excellent attention to detail, self-motivated, and comfortable working autonomously in a remote setup

- Reliable internet connection and ability to overlap with US/AU business hours for async communication



### Nice-to-Haves



- Previous experience working with a SaaS or B2B company

- Experience with GoHighLevel, agency/marketing content, or the AI automation space

- Experience with Kling AI face swapping or Runway for synthetic video generation

- Basic motion graphics or After Effects skills

- Experience working with a founder-led brand where you're the sole creative

- Any experience managing or mentoring junior editors



---



*Short-form content includes both repurposed clips from long-form AND original standalone pieces. The goal is to stay 30 days ahead on the content calendar at all times through batch creation.*



---



## Why This Role Matters



Our tech infrastructure is built. Our fulfillment engine is running. Our sales systems work. But the content engine — the thing that feeds every channel, builds the brand, and creates trust at scale — is the missing piece.



You won't be buried in a team of 20 editors. You'll be THE creative engine for the entire company, working directly with the founder, with real ownership over the visual identity and content output. And as we grow, you'll have the opportunity to build and lead the creative team that produces content not just for Echosetter, but for the agencies we serve.



---



## Tools We Use



CapCut Pro, Claude (AI), Higgsfield (AI video/image gen), Slack (internal communication)



Beyond these, we're tool-agnostic. If there's software that makes you faster or better — Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, Kling AI, Midjourney, Runway, Canva, After Effects, whatever — we'll get it. You tell us what you need to do your best work.



---



## How to Apply



Send us:



- Your portfolio or reel showing ad creatives, YouTube edits, and/or short-form content you've produced

- A short Loom video (2–3 min) introducing yourself and walking through one piece of work you're proud of

- Links to any social accounts or YouTube channels you've managed

- Bonus: show us an example of something you created using AI tools (Kling AI, Midjourney, etc.)



**We move fast. If you're the right fit, you'll know within a week.**

description:

/cro-shopify-web-developer/



CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript/Shopify Liquid required. 

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

- 1+ years of backend python (flask/django) development experience preferred but not required

- 1+ years of marketing agency experience preferred but not required

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

- All applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of experience or education



APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED:

title: AI Operator
description:
Primary Responsibilities



Develop and implement effective sales processes and workflows.



What this role actually is:



Systems architect, not task manager. You design operational infrastructure that scales.



Project owner, not coordinator. You take fuzzy problems and turn them into functioning systems without hand-holding.



Builder, not executor. You implement automations, iterate on workflows, and create leverage through technology.



Problem solver, not assistant. You identify bottlenecks and engineer solutions that compound over time.



You should be fluent in AI tools (not just familiar, fluent). You should think in systems, feedback loops, and automation-first design. You should be able to take a 30-minute conversation and walk away with a blueprint that didn't exist before.



This is the wrong role for you if:



You're looking for a traditional VA or admin support position



You need detailed instruction to execute



You think of yourself as "helping with tasks"



You're not deeply embedded in AI-native workflows already



This is the right role for you if:



You've built operational systems from zero before



You default to "how can this run without me" instead of "how do I do this faster"



You can translate ambiguous strategy into concrete architecture



You view AI as infrastructure, not a productivity hack



You've designed and implemented automations that eliminated entire categories of work



?What we're looking for:



Proven ability to own and ship projects independently. Show us what you've built.



Deep fluency with AI tools and automation platforms (we want to see your stack)



Systems thinking and operational design experience



Track record of creating leverage, not just completing work



Ability to work in ambiguity and create structure where none exists.



Job Type: Full-time



Work Set-up: Remote

title: IT Support Specialist, Tier 2+ (VoIP & MSP):
description:
Who We Are:

We are a fast-growing Hawaii-based IT and VoIP provider supporting small and mid-sized businesses across multiple industries. 



We are growing and looking for a technically strong Tier 2 IT Support Specialist who can troubleshoot independently and communicate clearly with business clients.



This is not an entry-level help desk position.



Role Overview:



You will support clients in Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, networking, cybersecurity, and VoIP systems. This role involves direct client interaction, remote troubleshooting, and working across cloud, desktop, and network environments.



We are looking for someone who can think critically, troubleshoot independently, and communicate clearly.



Required Soft Skills

 • Strong written and spoken professional English

 • Comfortable speaking directly with business owners and end users

 • Self-starter who takes ownership of issues

 • Calm under pressure

 • Able to manage multiple tickets and priorities

 • Available to work Hawaii business hours



Core Responsibilities

 • Support and administer Microsoft 365 & Google Workspace

 • Troubleshoot login, authentication, and access issues

 • Configure and support VPN solutions

 • Diagnose and resolve network connectivity problems

 • Support Windows (10/11) and macOS environments

 • Troubleshoot printers, scanners, and peripherals

 • Monitor and maintain backup systems

 • Support VoIP systems (FreePBX, Grandstream)

 • Assist with server administration and Active Directory

 • Maintain documentation and ticket notes

 • Deliver dependable, professional client communication



Required Technical Experience

Candidate will possess most or all of these skills:



MSP Environment Experience (2+ years preferred)

 • Remote troubleshooting

 • Ticket-based support workflows

 • Client-facing support



Microsoft & Collaboration

 • Microsoft 365 Global Admin

 • Exchange Online

 • SharePoint / OneDrive

 • Teams

 • Google Workspace Admin



Networking

 • TCP/IP fundamentals

 • DNS & DHCP troubleshooting

 • Firewall basics

 • UniFi management experience preferred



Security & Endpoint Management

 • Endpoint protection platforms (e.g., ThreatDown, Malwarebytes, etc.)

 • RMM tools (Datto RMM preferred)

 • Patch management systems



Backup & Recovery

 • Synology NAS

 • Datto or similar BDR platforms



***



Additional Skills to Be Considered:



VoIP & Telecom (Strong Plus)

 • FreePBX

 • Grandstream systems

 • SIP troubleshooting

 • Basic firewall SIP awareness



Cloud & Infrastructure (Nice to Have)

 • Microsoft Azure

 • AWS

 • Rackspace

 • Linux administration



Security & Compliance (Nice to Have)

 • Cybersecurity best practices

 • Microsoft 365 compliance

 • HIPAA / SOC 2 familiarity



What Success Looks Like

 • Tickets resolved efficiently and documented clearly

 • Clients feel confident and supported

 • Proactive issue identification

 • Minimal escalations

 • Strong ownership of assigned accounts



Candidates without MSP experience will not be considered.



To apply, please include:

1. A short paragraph explaining your MSP experience.

2. A description of how you would troubleshoot a Microsoft 365 login issue affecting one user.

3. Your current internet speed (upload/download).

4. Your computer specifications.

5. Confirmation that you can work Hawaii business hours.

title: Real Estate YouTube Video Editor
description:
Ongoing Weekly Work | Systems-Based Editing



We run RealVideo.pro, a video editing company that works exclusively with real estate agents and mortgage brokers producing long-form educational YouTube content.



This is not a creative agency role.

This is a structured, repeatable editing position inside a defined system.

What The Work Involves



You will be editing:



• 6 to 12 minute YouTube talking-head videos

• Most average 7 to 8 minutes

• Clean cuts with strong pacing

• Removal of filler words and dead space

• Basic audio cleanup and leveling

• Simple color correction

• Light, intentional b-roll only when it supports the message

• Clean lower thirds when required, meaning simple and professional on-screen text that supports the message without flashy animation

• Occasional simple on-screen text



No heavy motion graphics.

No flashy transitions.

No overproduction.



The goal is clarity, professionalism, and audience retention.



Workflow & Expectations



• 48 hour maximum turnaround

title: Guest Support for Short Term Rental Company
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

We are seeking a Guest Support & Operations Analyst to manage overnight guest communications and support key backend operations. This role combines guest relations, reservation management, and administrative tasks to ensure seamless service and operational accuracy.



IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT THIS ROLE

- This is NOT a generic support role.

- You’ll be juggling guests, cleaners, and maintenance teams in real time — often with imperfect information and real consequences if poor decisions are made. Because of that, our hiring process is intentionally more challenging than a typical “message responder” position.

- The assessment you’re about to take is designed to understand how you think — how you prioritize, communicate, and make judgment calls when there isn’t one obvious right answer.

- If you enjoy solving realistic scenarios, thinking critically, and taking ownership, you will likely enjoy both this assessment and the job itself. If you are looking for a simple, scripted support role, this probably won’t be the right fit — and that’s okay.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Guest Communications & Support

- Respond promptly and professionally to booking inquiries, guest messages, and support requests across multiple platforms.

- Provide phone support to address urgent guest needs and ensure timely issue resolution.

- Collaborate with the operations team to facilitate smooth check-ins, check-outs, and overall guest satisfaction.



Operational & Administrative Support

- Perform booking cleanup, ensuring reservations are accurate and conflicts are resolved.

- Conduct guest cleanup by maintaining accurate records and organizing guest profiles.

- Manage listing accuracy and resolve platform-related issues across Airbnb, 
, Expedia, etc.

- Support accounting functions, including expense tracking, invoice updates, and discrepancy reporting.

- Assist in lead management, including organizing, qualifying, and supporting follow-up efforts for potential property acquisition opportunities.



Qualifications

- Experience with short-term rental platforms (Airbnb, 
, Vrbo, etc.).

- Strong communication skills and professional phone etiquette.

- Detail-oriented with strong organizational abilities.

-Tech-savvy and able to work independently during overnight shifts.

- PREFERRED: Experience with PriceLabs, Beds24, accounting tasks, or lead management.



HOW TO APPLY

Upload your resume here >>> 
/s/5sal0p7n

We are not looking for "help." We are looking for a miracle worker. We are a premier marketing agency serving the U.S. Collision Repair (Body Shop) industry. We help shop owners tough, busy entrepreneurs, get more crashed cars into their shops.



Our owner, Shah, is the only salesperson. We have a high-tech system in place where leads from various avenues are automatically prompted to schedule an appointment. Your job is the human safety net. If a lead does not book, if they cancel, or if they "think about it," you are the one who hunts them down. You will follow up until they sign, they tell you to stop, or they are dead.



0% LEAD LEAKAGE IS THE ONLY ACCEPTABLE METRIC.



The Brutal Truth (Read This Carefully)

This is a high-pressure, high-volume role.



The English Requirement: You must speak English with zero accent. Your cadence, slang, and tone must be indistinguishable from a native North American speaker. You will be calling blue-collar business owners in the U.S.; you must sound friendly, professional, and natural. If you have a "call center" accent, do not apply.



The Intensity: You will be on the phone and in GoHighLevel all day.



The Responsibility: You are the gatekeeper of Shah’s calendar. If his calendar has a gap, you are losing the company money.



Your 5 Orders of Priority

The Calendar Guardian: You call and confirm every single lead on Shah’s schedule for today, tomorrow, and the day after. If they don't confirm by phone, they don't get the meeting.



The Gap Filler (The Hunter): If a lead is booked for next Tuesday, but Shah has a gap today at 2:00 PM, you call that lead and convince them to move their appointment up to today.



The Resurrector: You track every "No-Show." You call them within 5 minutes of their missed meeting to get them back on the books.



The Persistence Specialist: You follow up with every lead that "slipped through the cracks." If the automation didn't get them to book, you do it manually. You manage the "Long-Game" leads who saw a demo but haven't signed yet.



The Newsletter Architect: You will draft weekly persuasive newsletters using our "Proof of Success" (e.g., how we generated $45k in revenue for a shop in 3 months) to nurture our database into booking calls.



Technical Requirements

GoHighLevel (GHL) Mastery: You must be proficient in GHL pipelines and CRM management.



System Builder: You must be able to create your own SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) so that your follow-up process is repeatable and flawless.



The "Safety Net" Mindset: You take it personally when a lead is "lost."



THE GAUNTLET: How To Apply

Failure to follow these instructions exactly results in an immediate "Deleted" status.



Step 1: Your Subject Line Must read: "I am the Lead Superhero Shah is looking for - [Your Full Name]"



Step 2: Tell me what my name



Step 3: Written Questions (Answer in your application)



Describe a time you built a manual follow-up system that increased conversion.



What is your philosophy on "Lead Leakage"?



If you were an animal, what would you be and why? (Be creative).



Briefly explain how a DRP (Direct Repair Program) works in a U.S. Body Shop.



What is a "supplement" in collision repair and why does it matter to a shop owner?



Step 4: THE VIDEO (Mandatory Final Filter) Provide a link to a Loom or direct video (5 minutes maximum). IF YOU DO NOT DO THIS YOUR APPLICATION WILL IMMEDIATELY BW REJECTED.



Section A (Intro): Introduce yourself and describe your experience with cars or the automotive industry.



Section B (The Quiz): Answer these on camera without reading a script:



What is the difference between a fender and a bumper?



How do insurance deductibles work?



What does it mean for a customer to "pay out of pocket" vs. "go through insurance"?



Section C (The Roleplay): Shah has an open slot at 2:00 PM today. A lead named "John" is scheduled for next Friday. Call John and use your natural, friendly, persuasive English to move him to the 2:00 PM slot today. We are judging your accent, your confidence, and your "vibe."

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
Full Time | Remote | 2 Active Openings | Aim to Hire by March 15, 2026 | HKT overlap during onboarding



—



Do you solve problems, not just close tickets?



We're hiring modern CS specialists who can work with our AI tools, solve root causes, and own outcomes — not just close tickets.



Join a women-led brand that has grown from zero to 8 figures annually and is scaling fast across the US, UK, and EU. This is not a traditional support role — you'll blend daily ticket work with project work that shapes the business using modern AI-driven workflows.







—



[1] About the Company



We are a women-led sexual wellness and intimate health brand, redefining how women experience pleasure, confidence, and comfort. We have grown from zero to 8 figures in annual revenue and are scaling rapidly across the US, UK, EU, and beyond.



Our customer experience is central to our mission. We need people who are comfortable navigating sensitive conversations — around intimacy, wellness, and menopause — with discretion, warmth, and clarity.



We are building a team of problem-solvers, not ticket machines.



—



[2] The Role



As a Customer Support Specialist, you will split your time between high-quality support (~70–80% of your time) and project work that improves systems and processes (~20–30%).



You will be the nerve center of the business — handling customers directly while spotting patterns, fixing root causes, and building better workflows.



This role reports to the Head of CX and works alongside a small, growing CX team.



—



[3] What You'll Do



Daily Support (~70–80%):



- Respond to customer inquiries via
, chat, and social media

- Handle sensitive conversations related to sexual wellness with empathy and discretion

- Manage tickets end-to-end — investigate, resolve, and follow through

- Make confident decisions in ambiguous situations where policy doesn't neatly apply

- Escalate intelligently with clear context and recommendations



Project Work (~20–30%):



- Spot patterns in customer issues (faulty batches, courier problems, content gaps) and flag trends

- Recommend and implement fixes to root causes, not just symptoms

- Build reports tracking weekly ticket trends, product issues, or courier performance

- Quality-check AI-assisted responses and automation workflows

- Create and update SOPs, macros, and internal playbooks



—



[4] What We're Looking For



Must-haves:



- 2+ years of customer service experience, ideally in D2C, e-commerce, or consumer wellness

- Comfortable discussing sensitive topics including sexual wellness and intimacy

- Proactive self-learner — you anticipate issues and act without waiting to be told

- Strong attention to detail while moving at speed

- Experience with Gorgias, Zendesk, Intercom, or a similar helpdesk tool



Nice-to-haves:



- Experience with Shopify or e-commerce operations

- Exposure to reporting or analytics (Google Sheets, Excel, Shopify reports)

- Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, macros, automation) for support workflows

- Cross-functional exposure — ops, logistics, marketing, or product



—



[5] What You'll Get



- USD $850-$1,100 / month (40 hours/week)

- Performance-based growth — rate increases tied to impact and milestones

- First-hand experience in modern AI-driven customer service workflows

- Fully remote work

- Direct exposure to a fast-scaling global brand (US, UK, EU markets)

- Ownership of real projects — not just ticket queues

- A team that values systems thinking and proactive problem-solving

- Opportunity to shape CX processes and tools from the ground up



—



[6] HOW TO APPLY



Submit your application here:







You will be asked to:

1. Upload your most updated CV

2. Answer a few short questions about your CS experience and why this role interests you

3. Record a short Loom video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself — tell us why this brand interests you and one thing you'd change about our website



Applications sent outside this link will not be reviewed.

title: Guest Support for Short Term Rental Company
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

We are seeking a Guest Support & Operations Analyst to manage overnight guest communications and support key backend operations. This role combines guest relations, reservation management, and administrative tasks to ensure seamless service and operational accuracy.



IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT THIS ROLE

- This is NOT a generic support role.

- You’ll be juggling guests, cleaners, and maintenance teams in real time — often with imperfect information and real consequences if poor decisions are made. Because of that, our hiring process is intentionally more challenging than a typical “message responder” position.

- The assessment you’re about to take is designed to understand how you think — how you prioritize, communicate, and make judgment calls when there isn’t one obvious right answer.

- If you enjoy solving realistic scenarios, thinking critically, and taking ownership, you will likely enjoy both this assessment and the job itself. If you are looking for a simple, scripted support role, this probably won’t be the right fit — and that’s okay.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Guest Communications & Support

- Respond promptly and professionally to booking inquiries, guest messages, and support requests across multiple platforms.

- Provide phone support to address urgent guest needs and ensure timely issue resolution.

- Collaborate with the operations team to facilitate smooth check-ins, check-outs, and overall guest satisfaction.



Operational & Administrative Support

- Perform booking cleanup, ensuring reservations are accurate and conflicts are resolved.

- Conduct guest cleanup by maintaining accurate records and organizing guest profiles.

- Manage listing accuracy and resolve platform-related issues across Airbnb, 
, Expedia, etc.

- Support accounting functions, including expense tracking, invoice updates, and discrepancy reporting.

- Assist in lead management, including organizing, qualifying, and supporting follow-up efforts for potential property acquisition opportunities.



Qualifications

- Experience with short-term rental platforms (Airbnb, 
, Vrbo, etc.).

- Strong communication skills and professional phone etiquette.

- Detail-oriented with strong organizational abilities.

-Tech-savvy and able to work independently during overnight shifts.

- PREFERRED: Experience with PriceLabs, Beds24, accounting tasks, or lead management.



HOW TO APPLY

Upload your resume here >>>

title: Founder Operations & Executive Assistant (Long-Term, Remote)
description:
I am the founder of a growing, purpose-driven travel and hospitality company startup and am looking for a long-term Executive Assistant based in the Philippines to support day-to-day operations, client requests, and business systems.



This role works closely with me and is hands-on, structured, and evolving. A genuine interest in travel and hospitality is important, as much of the work involves supporting client travel requests, researching options, and keeping operations running smoothly.



This is not a short-term or task-only role. I am looking for someone reliable, detail-oriented, proactive, and interested in growing into a true long-term partnership.



Training will be provided, and systems will be built together.





Core Responsibilities



Executive & Administrative Support

 • Manage and organize
 inboxes (triage, follow-ups, flagging priorities)

 • Track action items, reminders, and deadlines

 • Calendar coordination and scheduling

 • Maintain clean documentation and internal processes



Travel Research & Client Support (Training Provided)

 • Research flights, hotels, cruises, and vacation options based on client requests

 • Compare pricing, availability, and basic inclusions

 • Prepare clear, organized summaries for review

 • Track follow-ups related to client travel inquiries

 • Support trip-planning workflows using internal tools

(Final decisions and bookings handled by the founder)



Operations & Systems Support

 • Assist with tracking customer payments and identifying discrepancies

 • Support QuickBooks setup and light reconciliation (training provided)

 • Prepare summaries for contractor payouts (travel advisors)

 • Help maintain CRM and internal tools (TravelJoy, Dubsado, Stripe, Google Workspace)



Optional / Bonus Responsibilities (Not Required)

 • Light support with social media organization or scheduling

 • Basic Canva, CapCut or short-form video assistance (Reels or clips)

 • Digital project coordination as the business grows





Required Skills

 •
 Management

 • Executive Assistant / Personal Assistant

 • Travel Planning





Required Traits

 • Based in the Philippines

 • Strong written and spoken English

 • Highly organized and detail-oriented

 • Comfortable with
, spreadsheets, and cloud-based tools

 • Reliable internet connection

 • Proactive and able to anticipate needs

 • Willing to learn new systems and processes

 • Interested in a long-term role, not short-term gigs

 • Genuine interest in travel and hospitality





Compensation & Hours

 • $5–$7 USD per hour to start, based on experience and trial performance

 • 20 hours per week to start

 • Opportunity to grow hours and pay over time based on performance and responsibility

 • Paid trial period before long-term engagement





How to Apply (Important)



Please include:

 1. Your resume

 2. A short introduction about yourself

 3. Your experience as an Executive Assistant or Virtual Assistant

 4. Your internet speed

 5. One sentence: Why are you interested in a long-term role rather than short-term gigs?

 6. One to two sentences: What interests you about supporting work in travel and hospitality?



Applications that do not follow these steps may not be reviewed.





Final Note



I value clarity, follow-through, and trust. If you are looking for a role where you can grow, take ownership, and support meaningful work behind the scenes, I would love to hear from you.

title: US Senior Accountant - WFH
description:
About ProfitWorks USA



For the Skilled. The Driven. The Remote.



At ProfitWorks USA, we believe great talent deserves more than just a gig — it deserves a career path, a community, and a company that truly sees your value. That’s why we don’t work with just any clients, and we don’t accept just any resumes.



We handpick professionals who bring real skill, work ethic, and integrity — and match them with companies who are ready to treat them right.



Remote-first, global opportunities

Long-term roles with real career paths

Fair pay for serious professionals

A team that has your back

You’re not just hired — you’re handpicked.



About the Role: Senior Accountant



We’re looking for a tech-savvy, detail-obsessed Senior Accountant to support our U.S.-based clients — mainly in the trades and construction industries. You will be the right-hand person for business owners who rely on clean books and meaningful financial reports to drive smart decisions.



This role is ideal for someone with a strong U.S. accounting background, a QBO ProAdvisor certification, and experience managing multiple client accounts. If you love spreadsheets, job costing, and solving problems before they become issues — this is for you.



Key Responsibilities



Client Communication: Manage client relationships via Zoom, chat, and
 — you’ll be the go-to for all things financial.

Full Cycle Accounting: Handle AP/AR, payroll, bank reconciliations, journal entries, sales tax, and advanced month-end close processes.



Reporting & Analysis: Prepare timely and accurate financials, clean balance sheets, and provide actionable insights.

System Optimization: Maintain and improve cloud-based systems like QBO, and propose process improvements.

Construction Accounting (Preferred): Job costing, WIP, deferred revenue, and margin tracking.



You’ll Succeed If You Have:



5+ years U.S. accounting experience

QBO ProAdvisor certification (required)

Strong understanding of GAAP

Experience working remotely with U.S. clients

Confidence juggling multiple client accounts

Great communication and client service skills

Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills

Bonus: Experience in the home services or construction industries

Your Tech Stack Will Include:



QuickBooks Online

Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Gmail, Meet)

Excel / Google Sheets

HubStaff for time tracking (Required)

Other cloud-based accounting tools (as needed)

Bonus: ClickUp for task management

Compensation & Perks:



80–120 Hours of PTO

10–11 Paid Holidays

13th Month Pay (PH)

Paid HMO Plan (PH)

SSS & PhilHealth Contributions (PH)

Paid Training

Career Advancement After Mastery

Performance-based Compensation Opportunities

Why You’ll Love This Role:



100% remote work — from wherever you thrive

Join a client with an incredible team culture and national recognition

Grow your technical skills while making real operational impact

Be a core part of long-term business transformation

Work with a team that values integrity, accountability, and excellence

Job Type: Full-time



Benefits:





Health insurance

Work from home

Work Location: Remote
